dialogue.text: But ye worked hard, so I'll give ye the same advice as last time: a tailor-made eel pie an' a piece o' perfect cloth are the keysh to Ma'sh heart.

dialogue.name: EALDWINE
dialogue.text: Well, I'm off to find new treashure. I'll keep an eye out for ye on the road─long as I ain't shleepin' one off in the ditch, ahaha!

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: You were gone for quite a while, adventurer. Does that mean my son has come to his sens─ Eh? You have something to give me?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Hehe, my favorite eel pie and some beautiful cloth for my needlework... And Ealdwine told you to get them, you say?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: That son of mine, remembering what is dear to my heart! Hehe, he might not have too much betwixt the ears, but he has a good heart.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: My late husband was just the same, always chasing his dreams. Now, my son is the very same. Little wonder he is off on yet another treasure hunt.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: And deary me, I had you running about after him! Thank you for trying. I should say you have more than earned this crystal.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: Well, well, eel pie and some beautiful fabric. I suppose this means Ealdwine won't be giving up his treasure hunting?

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: <sigh> He is truly his father's son, but I'll get him to stop chasing empty dreams someday.

dialogue.name: BRANGWINE
dialogue.text: But that's my burden to bear. Here, have your alexandrite, and a mother's thanks.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have obtained all the necessary items to recreate a Zodiac Weapon. Report to Gerolt at Hyrstmill to proceed.

obj.n: 無垢のアレキサンドライト
ゾディアックウェポン
現実悲惨！ トレジャーハンター！

quest.name: 眠れる大器
journal: You sense that Gerolt is excited to see you back in Hyrstmill.

Now that you have gathered the necessary pieces, Gerolt reveals the identity of his secret materia: your relic weapon nexus. Indeed, he reasons, if all the combined energies bound to the weapon could be made into materia, the very souls you have worked so hard to cultivate can ascend to the new host. But whether such an outrageous thing is even possible remains to be seen. To find out, Gerolt bids you seek the counsel of Master Mutamix at the Bonfire.
Mutamix readily agrees to lend his aid to your cause. Inform Gerolt that the materia master is ready and willing.
Delighted that Master Mutamix has promised to help, Gerolt now says everything is in place. Speak with Jalzahn when you are ready to recreate your Zodiac Weapon.
objectives: Speak with Mutamix Bubblypots at the Bonfire.
Speak with Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So ye've found all four bits an' pieces, eh? How do I know? Hah, it's written all over yer smug face.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Does Gerolt speak true, my friend? You have acquired all the items? Huzzah! Come, my friendsgentlemen, let us recreate an arm of yore!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We ain't there jus' yet, Jalzahn. Aye, I can forge a host with the raw materials what Forename brought quick as ye please. But all we'll have then is a fancy weapon without the essence of a legendary arm.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've still got to join it with special materia. By my reckonin', it's the only way to infuse our new host with the power o' souls.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: How do you propose we fashion this materia? Should Forename gather ten pieces of each form of atma? No, mayhap...twenty? Fifty? Surely materia composed of fifty pieces would be sufficient.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What the hells're ye on about, old man? The answer's right in front o' yer eyes: the bleedin' relic itself!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, you an' Forename have done a fine job o' fillin' the thing up with soul energy as the ancients did. Jus' turn all that to materia, an' meld it with our new host─make the souls ascend into an arm o' legend!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Tis an awful amount of energy to deal with, though. Yer average old craftsman would make a right mess o' me finest smithin', an' disperse the souls to boot. What we need is a real master o' materia─if ye catch me drift.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Master Mutamix─but of course! Who else but he could create such potent materia?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Come, Forename, you must go to the Bonfire and ask his aid at once! Surely he will not refuse the challenge.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I have never been so close to achieving my dreams... But long experience among failed experiments, however, teaches caution in such matters.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I thought ye were off speakin' with Mutamix at the Bonfire about the arm o' legend?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “His Dark Materia,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon nexus. Paladins must be equipped with both Curtana and the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “His Dark Materia,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon nexus. Paladins must be equipped with both Curtana and the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Hubairtin and Adkin trade many tongueflaps about sphere scrolls. But today, uplander seeks materia-knowings of Mutamix?

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: ...Uplander wants to make legendary fighty-tool into materia? Interesting. Fighty-tool full of airyself become amazing materia... And with the knowings in Mutamix's braincase, it possible!

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: But Mutamix has shivershakes. It is very big chance-game! Even with the knowings of Mutamix, cannot give wordbond of success. Braincase filled with doubtful buzzing muchly!

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: May go very, very unrightly! If Mutamix is failing, legendary fighty-tool will turn to bittybits! Airyself go bye-bye, too!

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: But will give hand-lending if uplander is unweak of bladder. Give hail-call, and Mutamix make trip to your stayplace.

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: When uplander makes up braincase, give hail-call. Mutamix will make trip to your stayplace.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' what did Mutamix have to say? ...Hah! I knew he couldn't say no to a challenge like this!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' that...that means that everything's set fer the great show! I've got me forge fired up, so all that's left is to tell Jalzahn yer ready an' willin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, me adventurin' friend, what say we recreate us a legendary arm? Ahahaha!

quest.name: 目覚めし力
journal: Jalzahn wears a bittersweet smile upon his face, one that would suggest a parting is in the offing.

After expressing his gratitude, Jalzahn informs you he will return to his native Radz–at–Han ere long. However, he has one last favor to ask of you: deliver a bottle of Sunshine─an incomparable liquor distilled in the alchemist's very own cellarage─to Gerolt as a gift.

Though he would have preferred to receive the liquor from Jalzahn in person, Gerolt unsurprisingly accepts the present. Much to your surprise, however, the smith reveals that there is yet work to be done─awakening sentience itself within your Zodiac Weapon. Indeed, it would seem the arms of legend consciously bonded with the soul of their bearers. Upon overhearing this, Jalzahn pledges to postpone his homewards journey. He posits that certain varieties of crystal can transfer a sense─a fragment of consciousness─via soul resonance, and thereby awaken the sentience slumbering within your weapon. To obtain these crystals, Gerolt tasks you with obtaining an introduction to Remon, a man of the black market, from Rowena in Revenant's Toll. Go now and speak with her.

According to Rowena, Remon holds an old grudge against Gerolt─the result of an unpaid loan─and will not deal with any friend of the blacksmith without an apology from the man himself. Return to Hyrstmill and inform Gerolt of this, and that Remon resides in his “usual haunt.”

According to Gerolt, Remon's bitterness stems not from the loan unpaid, but rather from a love unrequited─though he will say no more on the subject. Jalzahn urges Gerolt to make his amends with a gift: the bottle of Sunshine. Once you, too, have added your voice to the proceedings, Gerolt reluctantly gives up his prized liquor. Take the bottle of Sunshine and seek out Remon in Swiftperch.

Remon, a fellow with many, many connections, has anticipated your coming. He accepts Gerolt's apology, and offers to trade you mahatma in exchange for aught that will profit Rowena. Speak to him again when you wish to begin your dealings.
objectives: Deliver the bottle of Sunshine to Gerolt.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Gerolt.
Deliver the bottle of Sunshine to Remon at Swiftperch.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! You see before you a man content. My studies are complete, and I am now composing my master treatise on the enhancement of arms through soul infusion.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Once I have finished, I intend to return to my homeland. My journey of discovery, in other words, now draws to a close.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I tell you, though, the research I performed here was the most meaningful of my career. 'Twas your deeds that led me to these new heights, and you have my deepest gratitude.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, and I must not forget to thank Gerolt. I have an exquisite liquor from my own private cellar─a small token of my appreciation.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Might I ask you to deliver it? It would be altogether too embarrassing to give it to him myself.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Rise and Shine,” you must be equipped with a Zodiac Weapon. Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur and the Aegis Shield.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “Rise and Shine,” you must be equipped with a Zodiac Weapon. Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur and the Aegis Shield.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Eh? A present from Jalzahn now, is it?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah. Ye'd think the bugger'd thank me in the flesh, but I'll have his gift all the same. I'm still dreamin' o' the last bottle's fiery kick.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' as well yer here, though. I've been meanin' to have a word with ye 'bout yer Zodiac Weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: See, I got curious as to the Trials of the Braves. So I bargain a bit with Rowena, an' get meself a complete set from the she-devil. I even laid me hands on the last tome o' the series, the “Book of Netherdark.” What's written there surprised the livin' hells out o' me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems the original Zodiac Weapons each had a self all o' their own─a sentience shaped by the bearer's very soul.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The arms grew mightier an' easier to wield o' their own will, based on nothin' but the character an' needs o' their heroes.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Weren't jus' somethin' as simple as havin' a piece o' steel ye've grown accustomed to. Those weapons were like extensions o' the Braves' bodies.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, 'tis why they were the greatest arms o' their own ages─an' why they were lost. Ye can hardly pass a weapon down through the generations if no other bugger can wield it fer shite, can ye?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: (-Jalzahn-)Gerolt! This is hardly what I expected to hear upon coming to bid you farewell. Tell me, do you think this tale true?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, gods help me, I do. An' I even reckon there's a decent chance the recreated Zodiac Weapon can do the very same thing.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Mind ye, any other arm, an' ye'd be a fool to try. But Forename's weapon's got soul an' light in it. I'd wager me next six pints o' mead it's got some form o' sentience already.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'm o' the mind that it ain't been fully awakened yet.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: 'Tis a strange concept, but I suppose we've encountered stranger in our travails. Moreover, this notion of sentience could be the origin of how these arms came to achieve their legendary status...

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Hah! A weapon able to choose its wielder by its own will─fascinating, simply fascinating! Why, I can imagine no truer ally!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It ain't like to keep ye company with its banterin', Jalzahn. We're talkin' about forgin' an unbreakable bond 'twixt the souls o' the wielder an' the weapon. Well, Forename? Ye've come this far. Ye keen on seein' this through?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Dear me, it would seem as though a postponement to my homewards journey is in order. We must set to this venture forthwith!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'm glad o' the help, Jalzahn, but startin' out on that venture's easier said than done. Afore aught else, we've got to crack how to awaken the sleepin' sentience in Forename's arm.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Indeed, indeed... Mayhap we can awaken the soul within the arm via some substance alike in character. Creating a resonance betwixt souls can allow for the transference of certain qualities, after all.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Atma, for instance, has no sentience of its own to speak of. Yet as the crystallized soul of a living being, it can contain a particular sense─an aspect of consciousness, if you will.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Alas, I fear atma is too weak. However, some stronger variety of crystallized soul may be capable of bestowing its sense unto the slumbering sentience.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Of course, for the weapon to profit by this, simply possessing the crystal will not be enough. The sense will not magically transfer itself. We will have to find a way to make the soul without connect to the soul within.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Wielding the weapon whilst the crystallized soul is near could be the answer. Or we might also─

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Wait, wait... The first thing ye said about wieldin' the weapon─that ain't half bad. An' it jus' so happens I've an idea on where ye might get the kind o' crystallized souls yer talkin' about.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename, ye'll need to pay Rowena a visit. 'Course, it ain't her ye want, but her introduction to a bloke called Remon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The man handles arcane goods, an' comes 'round to Rowena's place every now an' again. Not regular-like, though. Remon's one what only wheels an' deals in the shadows.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Gerolt, you are acquainted with a merchant of the black market? I knew your shady past would aid us at some point. There is no time to waste, Forename! Pray see about arranging this introduction!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I haven't a bleedin' clue where Remon is. But ask Rowena real sweet-like, an' she should tell ye where he's holed up.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Let me guess─you're here on account o' Gerolt an' some weapon or another. How close'd I come?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Well, least now I know why Gerolt was hankerin' for those old tomes. Like a starved cat after a plump mouse, he was.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Hehe, when that man starts workin', there ain't naught in this realm as can stop him. Ain't changed a bit from when we were travelin' around─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Oh! But that's, er... Wh-What's it we were talkin' about again? Ah, that's right─you were huntin' for Remon.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Hmmm, well... I reckon he's the man you want, given what you're after. 'Course, the problem ain't findin' him─it's the gettin'-him-to-help-you part.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: See, a fair ways back, Remon lent Gerolt a pretty lump o' money. Time comes to repay it, an' Gerolt tries to run. Certain words are said, certain bottles...thrown. Needless to say, Remon hates the blacksmith more than morbol bile.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I ended up repayin' the sum Gerolt owed, but Remon's kept that grudge smolderin' inside him for nigh on twenty years.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I understand why well enough, I suppose. Could've bought ten manses in the Lavender Beds with what Gerolt took. I conjure any man'd be hesitant to forgive an' forget after that.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Now that you know the particulars, I'll give you your introduction. But best to keep in mind that folk as work in the shadows are real sticklers for their code. Won't deal with a soul what's broken it, nor their friends.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: So run on back to Hyrstmill an' tell Gerolt that Remon's in his usual haunt. But I don't think the merchant'll touch you with a ten-fulm pole unless the dolt apologizes in full...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You tell Gerolt that Remon's in his usual spot. He'll know where that is.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Eh? What's that about Remon? Bah! Jus' like that gil-pinchin' bastard to not deal with ye unless I grovel at his bloody feet!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye'd think it water under the bridge by now, as it's been a full twenty years since─ Aaah, but it ain't the money, is it? It's the woman...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: N-Never ye bleedin' well mind who! The point's that Remon won't jus' forgive me, no matter how long or loud I apologize!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Have you considered that a gift may say more than words can, Gerolt? Surely you know of something dear to him.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Ye heard all that, did ye? As it happens, I can't rightly remember what Remon likes. Well...save fer a bottle o' liquor or three.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Then the fiery liquor I gave to you is the answer, is it not?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: N-Now don't talk nonsense! It ain't every day I can drink such fine spirits. That liquor's mine, an' mine it's goin' to stay!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Fine! Fer the sake o' the bloody Zodiac Weapon, I'll part with me bottle o' Sunshine!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text:
You will not regret this, Gerolt.
...Though I am sorry to say that bottle represents the last of the spirits I brought from Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Gods damn it all! Please, Jalzahn, at least tell me ye've not run out o' the ingredients ye'd need to brew a potion!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I...I have not, though all of my alchemical equipment is now buried at the bottom of my luggage. But pray tell─what would you have me do with them?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Er...somethin' I read in the Trials of the Braves. Fer now, let's jus' say we'll need a potion or the like if this awakenin' business goes to plan.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now, Forename, if Rowena said Remon's in his usual haunt, then ye'll need to make yer way to Swiftperch. Once ye find the bloke, give him...ye'll need to give him... <shudder> Jus' give him this bottle o' Sunshine and say it's from me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get yerself some o' what he's dealin', an' then hie off to battle! Sense'll pass to yer weapon through soul resonance, an' the more blows ye strike, the sooner its sentience'll start to wake!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: No doubt the Zodiac glass will aid you in taking measurements of the soul resonance. Once you have imbued your arm with enough senses, return to me and I will do my utmost to see its potential realized!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Weren't ye off to Swiftperch? Hurry an' get that bottle out o' me sight! 'Tis hard enough that it's goin' to Remon─ye don't need to parade it around in front o' me, too!

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: Good eveningGood morningGood day to you...Forename, isn't it? So I thought, so I thought. I've been expecting you.

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: Ahhh, this must be Gerolt's token of apology. <sniff> What an exotic aroma...

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: I'm afraid no bottle of liquor, be it ever so fine, can quell the hate I bear the man. However, I will accept this olive branch nonetheless.

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: But surely you came as much to rouse something from slumber as to lay an old grudge to rest. No need to explain, not to a man with a web of a thousand eyes and ears.

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: You seek to awaken the sentience nestled within your Zodiac Weapon...or am I wrong?

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: So I thought, so I thought. I must say, even I was surprised to hear that Gerolt succeeded in recreating a Zodiac Brave's arm─and amazed to learn the weapon concealed yet another secret!

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: Now, of all my wares, “mahatma” should serve best to bring that secret to light. I have twelve types all told, each the shard of a soul with a distinct sense contained within.

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: I cannot say if it will be what Gerolt was expecting, but attaching them to your weapon in careful order should do...something. As one who once sweated over the anvil, I am intrigued to see what.

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: The merchant in me, however, cannot give mahatma away for free. My price is Allagan Tomestone of Poetics. Rowena will nevermore be mine, but I would still aid her with these where I can.

dialogue.name: REMON
dialogue.text: Ah, and you needn't worry about me. I may deal from the shadows, but I dislike shadowy dealings. When you are ready to purchase mahatma, simply say the word─and produce the Allagan tomestones, of course.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Completing certain activities with mahatma affixed to your Zodiac Weapon will generate soul resonance. As this increases, the soul within your arm will begin to awake.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By using the Zodiac glass, it is possible to visually verify your progress with each variety of mahatma.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you misplace your Zodiac glass, you may obtain a replacement by speaking with Drake at Hyrstmill.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have used all twelve varieties of mahatma and increased the soul resonance to the point of awakening, return to Jalzahn.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Paladins only need to affix mahatma to Excalibur.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Increasing the soul resonance of Excalibur to maximum will have the same effect on the Aegis Shield.

quest.name: ふたりの称号
journal: Something seems to be giving Jalzahn pause.

Jalzahn is perplexed as to why such a priceless resource as the Book of Netherdark never came to light alongside the other Trials of the Braves. He wishes to learn more of the tome's origins for his own erudition, and asks that you accompany him to question Gerolt. Speak with the blacksmith, and help the alchemist solve this lingering mystery.

Upon consulting Gerolt, you learn that it was Jalzahn's ancient forefather who penned the Book of Netherdark. Moreover, you discover that the author left as his legacy the title of “Starforger” to the person who could succeed in fully recreating a legendary arm of yore. Gerolt and Jalzahn, both desirous of this, allow their pride to tear them apart. Speak with Jalzahn now, to discover if the matter has been resolved.

Unable to decide who should be crowned “Starforger,” Jalzahn has decided to remain in Hyrstmill until Gerolt gives up his claim. However, the alchemist can now continue to aid you with your arm should the need arise. With a fondness in his voice, Jalzahn bids you to go forth, and use your Zodiac Weapon for good and so create your own legend.
objectives: Speak with Gerolt.
Speak with Jalzahn.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: My dear, dear girlboy! Thanks to you, I have developed my soul infusion methodology and seen a legendary arm reborn in all its glory. For all this and more, you have my eternal gratitude.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I had devoted my life to just these two goals, yet neither could I have accomplished alone. Though I risked life and limb, verily 'twas right I should come to Eorzea.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: One matter puzzles me still, however: why was the Book of Netherdark─a priceless resource─never completed nor circulated?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: If I have learned anything by now, 'tis that Gerolt can shed some light on the matter. Come, my friend, let us make one last journey across the village green─for the sake of knowledge itself!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “The Vital Title,” you must be equipped with a Zodiac Weapon Zeta. Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur Zeta and Aegis Shield Zeta.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you no longer possess a Zodiac Weapon Zeta, you may also equip a Zodiac Weapon Zeta replica to receive the quest “The Vital Title.” Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur Zeta replica and Aegis Shield Zeta replica.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Zodiac Weapon Zeta replica can be obtained from Drake in Hyrstmill.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “The Vital Title,” you must be equipped with a Zodiac Weapon Zeta. Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur Zeta and Aegis Shield Zeta.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Might be as I had one too many earlierlast night, but aren't we done with the Zodiac Weapons? Why is it ye keep houndin' me like a pair o' bloody debt collectors?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: We have merely come with a question about the Book of Netherdark, Gerolt. Where did you lay hands upon this unfinished tome, pray tell?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Eh? Well, Rowena's place, o' course. I came across it while I was pickin' up the rest o' the Trials of the Braves.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Rowena said she'd only sell the tome to a collector what'd pay a king's ransom fer it─till I threatened to wed her again, that is. Well, ye can bet she handed it over in a hurry after that, hehe.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I-Is that so?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Er...anyroad, there's prints aplenty o' the Trials, but I've heard nothin' about another copy o' the Book of Netherdark. Like as not, that's why ye never saw it in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: See, the Trials is a load o' scattered tales about the ancient heroes gathered an' bound up in a book. 'Tis admired as a work o' fancy jus' as much as an account o' the ancients.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But this Book of Netherdark, well, it's jus' raw facts. Seems like it were added to the set after everythin' else, an' ye can tell that no editor's pen ever touched it. 'Tis really jus' a treatise on the Zodiac Braves.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: So we owe our gratitude to a scholar... Was there aught by which to identify the author? I would remember him, and so learn by his example.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hells, Jalzahn, I don't... Well, now that ye mention it, there is a name written here. Looks like “Ulthalam”...

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: “Ulthalam,” you say!? He was the father of my line─an artisan famed for his pursuit of knowledge!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be thrice damned! If the man's yer ancestor, might be as ye'd like to hear what I found scrawled at the back o' the book. Jus' a moment...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: After years of careful study, I come to realize that I, Ulthalam, cannot recreate an arm of the Zodiac Braves. I record mine own findings here, that men with like ambition may follow in my footsteps.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To the one who succeeds in bringing forth a weapon of the ancient heroes, I leave my eternal admiration, and the title of “Starforger,” bringer of radiance.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Gods be good! Though I knew it not, I have dreamed the same dream as my forefather! Everything, from my encounter with tales of the Braves to my choice of studies, must have been written in the stars!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: <sniff> In sooth, 'twas right that I journeyed countless malms and weathered stormy seas to come to Eorzea. Hearken to me, spirit of Ulthalam! Rest well, knowing that I, Jalzahn, accept the title of Starforger from you!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi! Hold on fer one soddin' second!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Might be as yer the one what came with the tale o' the legendary weapons, but who was it what made the bloody thing?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Me, that's who! An' who was it what found the Book of Netherdark!? Poor ol' unthanked Gerolt! The title is mine, fair an' square─even if there ain't a single gil in it.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: G-Gil!? The title cannot be measured, not even in gold, sir! 'Tis a priceless honor, granted by my ancestor to the one who fulfilled his dream─me!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: The title is mine by blood and merit both!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Like hells it is! Do ye know what a smithy does? We work a bit of our soul into each blade an' kettle we forge!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've sacrificed a good slice o' me own bleedin' life to the Zodiac Weapon, an' I ain't about to jus' let you walk away with the title!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: You insolent cur! I had thought you were but rough around the edges, but I see now that I was right about you from the start! You are the greatest boor in all the lands!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah! Ye bleedin' coot, yer jus' stubborn in yer ol' age! The title should go to someone what's got a future, an' if ye can't see that, then yer the biggest arse around!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can ye believe the bleedin' nerve o' that ol' coot!? The hells take him─an' leave the title fer me!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Whew... That encounter has quite sapped my strength─though not my sense of outrage. I can scarce believe that boor would not yield so much as an ilm!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I simply cannot abide the thought of Gerolt taking that title. I had thought to journey homewards, but now I see I must stay and make him listen to reason.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: There are far worse places to call home than Hyrstmill, I suppose. And I have, after all, developed a taste for Eorzean cuisine.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Of course, my continued tenure here would be all the better if you visited now and again. I should like to learn of your adventures, and would be happy to enhance your arm through the power of materia.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Now, Forename, go forth with your Zodiac Weapon, and with it create your own legends!

obj.n: 鍋が薬鑵を黒いと言った

quest.name: 英雄の武器を求めて
journal: Gerolt appears to be in a spot of bother.

Busy as ever with his kettle mending, Gerolt the weaponsmith would have you entertain an unexpected guest in his stead. Do as bade and speak with the visitor, an elderly gentleman by the name of Jalzahn.

Hailing from the Near Eastern city–state of Radz–at–Han, Jalzahn reveals himself to be none other than the genius mind behind Thavnairian mist, the elixir which you used to enhance your relic. According to the alchemist, your weapon can be raised to new heights of power through the use of crystalline objects he calls atma. Twelve unique pieces are required, and these can be obtained by equipping a relic weapon zenith and participating in FATEs in the following regions:
- Central Shroud: Atma of the Maiden
- Southern Thanalan: Atma of the Scorpion
- Upper La Noscea: Atma of the Water-bearer
- East Shroud: Atma of the Goat
- Eastern Thanalan: Atma of the Bull
- Middle La Noscea: Atma of the Ram
- Western Thanalan: Atma of the Twins
- Outer La Noscea: Atma of the Lion
- Lower La Noscea: Atma of the Fish
- North Shroud: Atma of the Archer
- Central Thanalan: Atma of the Scales
- Western La Noscea: Atma of the Crab

※Upon collecting all pieces of atma, present them to Jalzahn to complete the enhancement process.
objectives: Speak with Jalzahn.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's you! Gods, I never thought I'd be glad to see ye!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Just the other day, this old bloke from some faraway land suddenly appeared. He's been buggin' me ever since, askin' about puttin' souls in relics or summat. None of it makes a whit o' sense to me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can't the man see how busy I am, poundin' kettles all bloody day!? I ain't got the time to be humorin' the elderly!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What's more, yer the one with a relic, ain't that right? If there's anyone this Jalzahn bloke oughta be botherin', I reckon it's you! Run along, then, an' keep the old coot off me back!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Up in Arms,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon zenith. Paladins must be equipped with Curtana.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “Up in Arms,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon zenith. Paladins must be equipped with Curtana.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, the impropriety! In my land, the elderly are treated with deference, and visitors received with honor!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: You must excuse me, adventurer. I have endured a trying sea voyage to meet with Eorzea's greatest weaponsmith, only to find that he is the greatest boor I have ever had the displeasure of knowing.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: ...But what is this? Your weapon─unless I am gravely mistaken, 'tis a relic infused with Thavnairian mist!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Marvelous, marvelous! Ah, but where are my manners?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Jalzahn, and I hail from the Near Eastern city–state of Radz–at–Han. I am an alchemist by trade.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: It has been my life's work to study the enhancement of arms through soul infusion. Verily, Thavnairian mist is one of the fruits of my toils.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Upon learning that the elixir had come to some prominence in Eorzea, I journeyed here with the intent of exploring new possibilities in my research. I want but for a subject to proceed.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: If you would be that subject, your weapon will become further enhanced. Will you agree to assist me, adventurer, and for your troubles come to possess a mightier relic?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you assist Jalzahn?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: You answered in the negative, but the yearning in your eyes tells me a different tale. You are doubtful of my endeavor, and small wonder since we have only but met. If you would allow me to explain what my research shall entail, it may well put your doubts to rest.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: A decision you will not regret! But without further ado, allow me to explain what my research will entail.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Now, I trust you are aware that aether permeates all things in our world. What you may not know, however, is that aether is found in greater concentrations in Eorzea than elsewhere.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: When a weapon infused with a quasi-soul such as your relic is used to slay a living being in this aether-rich land, a peculiar phenomenon occurs.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: The aether released by the fallen creature resonates with your weapon, and agglomerates into a crystal which I have dubbed “atma.” It must be noted that this occurs only on rare occasions, due to factors I have yet to identify.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Now, as you may have already gathered, atma is essentially the crystallized soul of a living being. And these crystals hold the key to strengthening your weapon.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: According to my research, twelve unique pieces of atma are required, meaning they must be acquired from twelve different foes. See the deed done, adventurer, and you shall hold in your hands such power as you have never known!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By participating in certain FATEs while equipped with a relic weapon zenith, you may obtain an atma crystal. The locations of the FATEs and the atma yielded are as follows:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Central Shroud: Atma of the Maiden
Southern Thanalan: Atma of the Scorpion
Upper La Noscea: Atma of the Water-bearer

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
East Shroud: Atma of the Goat
Eastern Thanalan: Atma of the Bull
Middle La Noscea: Atma of the Ram

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Western Thanalan: Atma of the Twins
Outer La Noscea: Atma of the Lion
Lower La Noscea: Atma of the Fish

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
North Shroud: Atma of the Archer
Central Thanalan: Atma of the Scales
Western La Noscea: Atma of the Crab

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This information can be reviewed in the completed journal for the quest “Up in Arms,” which can be found under “Weapon Enhancement Sidequests.”

quest.name: 黄道十二文書
journal: Jalzahn is a man with grand plans for your relic weapon.

According to Jalzahn, your relic weapon still has room to grow. If you would enhance it further, you must recreate the valorous deeds of the Zodiac Braves, revered heroes in Thavnairian legend. So as to take the guesswork out of the process, Jalzahn suggests you acquire the “Trials of the Braves,” a collection of sacred texts that tell of the heroes' deeds. As a known vendor of such literature, perhaps Rowena will have the books in stock.
Rowena believes that she may have the literature you desire. She bids you take your inquiry to G'jusana, one among her burgeoning ranks of underlings.

Much to your delight, G'jusana has the full collection of the Trials of the Braves in stock, and offers to sell you each book for the bargain price of 100 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics. The means to possessing a mightier arm lies before you─you need but reach out and take it.

※You must be equipped with the relic weapon atma you wish to enhance when making the purchase.
※You can possess only one book in a set of nine at any given time.
※Upon completing the objectives in all nine books, present your relic weapon atma to Jalzahn to complete the enhancement process.
objectives: Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with G'jusana.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, my stout assistant. I trust you are enjoying your atma–infused relic?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Now, while your newfound might may indeed be impressive...what if I were to tell you that your weapon may grow even mightier still?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: My research leads me to believe that this is a distinct possibility. As before, if you would agree to be my subject, I promise that you will not be the worse for your part. What say you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you assist Jalzahn again?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Come now, there is no need to be coy─'tis man's nature to be desirous of greater power. And though our interest in the subject may differ, we share the selfsame objective. At any rate, pray humor me─lend an ear to the theory I have recently formed.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I knew I could count on you, my friend. Listen, then, to the theory I have recently formed.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Legend tells that, when the world lies upon the brink of destruction, brave souls who bear the Light shall arise to banish the Darkness.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: These heroes are known by myriad names, but in my native Radz–at–Han they are called the “Zodiac Braves.”

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: The Zodiac Braves were said to wield arms of unparalleled might, that shone with the radiance of a thousand stars.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: My ultimate objective, dear adventurer, is no less than the recreation of these legendary arms.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Thavnairian tradition holds that the Zodiac Braves gathered light to their weapons by vanquishing formidable foes. 'Tis my theory that the heroes were in fact absorbing souls.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: And now, through the use of atma, your weapon has been transformed into something with the selfsame ability, and it exists as a vessel for souls. At present, however, this vessel holds but a small fraction of its capacity.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: If your weapon is to realize its potential, you must have it drink deep of the souls of slain foes.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Of course, not every soul is created equal, and so it follows that not all creatures will serve our purpose. Indeed, the Zodiac Braves themselves were very particular as to which foes they chose to vanquish.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: In the interests of efficiency, you would do well to seek out adversaries of like nature. For this, you might refer to the “Trials of the Braves,” a collection of sacred texts that tell of the heroes' deeds.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: The books are common enough in Radz–at–Han, but having recently formed my theory, I did not think to bring them with me, alas. Though, with trade flourishing between our lands, mayhap there is a local merchant dealing in imported wares who has them in stock.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Trials of the Braves,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon atma. Paladins must be equipped with either Curtana or the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “Trials of the Braves,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon atma. Paladins must be equipped with either Curtana or the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Eh? Thavnairian literature on heroes who wielded dazzlin' weapons? An' it's called the Trials o' the Braves...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Might be as I've got somethin' what fits your description. G'jusana's the one who deals in tomes an' the like. You'll find her near the north gate o' the Toll.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Might be as I have this Trials o' the Braves series in stock. G'jusana's the one who deals in tomes an' the like. You'll find her near the north gate o' the Toll.

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: ...Trials of the Braves? Why, yes, we happen to have the tomes, but why would anyone be interested in moldy old things like─

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Ah! What I meant to say was, they're extremely rare, and you aren't like to find them anywhere else in Eorzea!

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Nine books comprise a set, and each alone is worth a small fortune. But I like you, adventurer, so I'm willing to offer them at a discount.

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: For the bargain price of 100 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics, you can be the proud owner of a piece of history─a book from the sacred Trials of the Braves!

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Make no mistake, anywhere else and you'll easily pay twice that. When you're keen to make the exchange, just let me know!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By defeating all the foes listed within a book of the Trials of the Braves, your relic weapon atma will gain in attributes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Distinct sets of Trials of the Braves exist for each relic. A set is comprised of nine books, of which only four are available for exchange at first.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A paladin's set comprises seven books for Curtana, and two for the Holy Shield. Only six of these are available for exchange at first.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Each book can be purchased from G'jusana. Please note, however, that you can possess only one at any given time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must complete all of the objectives in a book before you may obtain another.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alternately, you may also dispose of it by speaking with G'jusana, or via the Key Items menu.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: May your relic drink deep of the souls of your enemies!

quest.name: スフィアの輝き
journal: Jalzahn has the look of a hungry wolf as he eyes your relic weapon.

Jalzahn believes that your relic weapon animus may yet grow stronger through the power of materia. Explaining that conventional melding will not work due to the preclusive presence of soul energy, the alchemist bids you consult the experts on the matter. Make your way to the Bonfire in central Thanalan, and speak with the goblin Mutamix.
Mutamix introduces you to his new disciple, Hubairtin, who he says is attempting to extract the power of materia. Speak with the man and learn of his research.

Hubairtin seeks to overcome the limits of advanced materia melding by converting the power of materia into a form of light energy. Recognizing the benefits of collaboration, the excitable young arcanist bids you procure three bottles of superior enchanted ink. The ink can be had from none other than your favorite merchant, Rowena, at Revenant's Toll.

Rowena has plenty of superior enchanted ink in stock, and offers to sell you bottles of it in exchange for Allagan tomestones. Acquire three such bottles, and present them to Hubairtin at the Bonfire.

You have shown the bottles of superior enchanted ink to Hubairtin, who explains its role in the creation of sphere scrolls, the medium for storing materia-derived light energy. Furnish Hubairtin with the ink, and he will prepare for you a sphere scroll suitable for enhancing your relic.
objectives: Speak with Mutamix Bubblypots at the Bonfire.
Speak with Hubairtin.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Obtain three bottles of superior enchanted ink from Auriana and show them to Hubairtin.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Greetings, my dear assistant. I trust your enhanced relic is serving you well.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Yet know that we are but halfway to recreating the mighty arm described in the legend of the Zodiac Braves.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Aye, your weapon can house power even greater than now, and I believe that this power can be attained through the use of materia.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: As is my wont, I have dabbled in these peculiar stones and acquired a rudimentary knowledge of their workings.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: With my limited grasp of the subject matter, I have gleaned that, already being laden with soul energy, your relic cannot be enhanced via conventional materia melding. An alternate method is required, and for this we shall need to consult the experts.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: If you desire to wield a mightier weapon, you would do well to seek Mutamix, the goblin credited with bringing the secrets of materia to Eorzea. He and his students are said to be camped at a place called the Bonfire in central Thanalan, though you doubtless already knew this.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Celestial Radiance,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon animus. Paladins must be equipped with both Curtana and the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “Celestial Radiance,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon animus. Paladins must be equipped with both Curtana and the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...?
What brings uplander to tent-ring of Mutamix Bubblypots?

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: ...Uplander has fighty-tool already filled with airyself, wishes it to gain power of materia?

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Uplander has difficult desire. Such knowings do not exist...yet.

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: Mutamix has new underlearner, name of Hubairtin. Hubairtin seeks to out-draw power of materia, but is having brainblocks muchly.

dialogue.name: MUTAMIX
dialogue.text: If uplander gives lenthand to Hubairtin, brainblocks may be broken, yes?

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Gah! Why won't it work!? Why won't you bond, damn you!?

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me my outburst, adventurer. I have hit a proverbial wall in my research, and it has driven me nigh insane.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text:
...What? You've been working with a man from Radz–at–Han? And this Hannish alchemist has had you infusing your relic with soul energy?
<gasp> And now you'd seek to further enhance it with materia!?

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Huzzah! The Builder be praised for guiding your steps to me!

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: A-Ahem! Begging your pardons, adventurer. The prospect of a breakthrough so excited me, I quite took leave of my propriety.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: My name is Hubairtin, and I have but recently joined the Carriers of the Cauldron. I seek to overcome the limits of advanced materia melding, also known as “secret joiny-skill.”

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: As you may already be aware, an object can safely host only a limited number of materia. But by extracting the soul energy held within the stones and converting it into light, we may circumvent this constraint.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: ...Or so my theory goes. While I have succeeded in transferring this light energy to a transitory medium, all attempts to then have it bond with equipment have ended in dismal failure.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: I had all but given up hope when you arrived. Your soul-infused relic, I believe, is an ideal vessel for this light energy. And with the revolutionary techniques possessed by Master Jalzahn, I am confident that our efforts will bear fruit.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Aye, our efforts, I say, for we share the selfsame goal. I trust you shan't object to a collaboration. And so, without further ado, I bid you fetch me enchanted ink. Not any enchanted ink, mind you, but one that boasts superior aetherial conductivity.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text:
The ink is central to our endeavor, but I have recently depleted my stores. For a blessing, 'twould seem that it can be had at Revenant's Toll, from a merchant named Rowena.

...Why are you frowning? Did I...say something inappropriate? If so, please accept my apologies─my mother always said that I lacked tact. But to return to the matter at hand, for our purposes, I must have no less than three bottles of ink. Pray return here when you have procured the requisite amount.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Have you procured the three bottles of superior enchanted ink? Without it, we cannot proceed.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Such ink can be had at Revenant's Toll, from a merchant named Rowena.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Well, if it ain't my best customer. What's your fancy today, then?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Ink with “superior” aetherial conductivity, you say? Haha, ain't nothin' ever simple with you, eh? Well, just so happens a shipment arrived from Thavnair not three days ago.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Auriana can fix you up with the stuff. We've got plenty in stock, so long as you've got Allagan Tomestone of Poetics to exchange for 'em.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Oh, an' in case you're wonderin', you won't find it elsewhere in Eorzea. I make a point o' bein' the sole supplier for whatever it is I sell─that's just good business, see.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Ah, you're back! Have you acquired three bottles of superior enchanted ink?

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Yes! This shall serve our purposes perfectly!

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: With this ink, I shall draw arcanima patterns of power upon parchment to create a sphere scroll, the medium for storing materia-derived light energy!

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: This, my friend, is the key to raising your relic to the next level of might.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: We want for but the catalyst by which the power of materia may be converted into light and infused into the scroll─a rare stone known as alexandrite.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Being a variety of dark matter, alexandrite possesses light-altering properties. When placed beneath a light source, it bursts into a dazzling display of colors.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Owing to its singular beauty, alexandrite was highly prized by ancient civilizations, and so nigh every natural deposit has been exhausted.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: However, the stone is known to emerge amongst hidden treasures─we just need to know where to look. It may behoove us to consult dealers of artifacts from bygone eras.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Gods, I cannot recall when last I felt so invigorated! Many and more things remain to be done, but any sort of progress is better than none. Give me but a moment to gather my thoughts, and I shall resume my explanation.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Sphere scrolls may be obtained from Hubairtin in exchange for bottles of superior enchanted ink.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Each sphere scroll can be infused with up to five types of materia. Please note, however, that certain restrictions apply to quantity and variety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, due to the unstable nature of materia-derived light energy, infusion attempts are known to fail occasionally.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, each infusion requires the use of a catalyst known as alexandrite. Alexandrite is yielded from treasure coffers whose locations are marked on mysterious maps.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Mysterious maps can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll in exchange for Allagan tomestones. Completing a certain quest will also earn you a map.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alexandrite may also be obtained, albeit at a low probability, by participating in FATEs while equipped with your relic weapon (animus or beyond).

obj.n: ハイエンチャントインク
現実悲惨！ トレジャーハンター！

quest.name: 輝きは新星の如く
journal: Hubairtin can barely contain his excitement at the prospect of enhancing your relic weapon animus.

Hubairtin has offered to prepare as many sphere scrolls as you desire, so long as you furnish him with the required quantity of superior enchanted ink. Having explained the materia-infusion process in detail, the young arcanist bids you report to Jalzahn at Hyrstmill in the North Shroud, that the wizened alchemist might lend his formidable knowledge to the cause.

Jalzahn is impressed by Hubairtin's ingenuity, and expresses confidence that he will be able to finish what the young arcanist has started. For now, it falls to you to fully infuse the sphere scroll. If you would wield a mightier relic, see the deed done, then present the scroll to Jalzahn.

※Each materia infusion requires the use of alexandrite, a catalyst yielded from treasure coffers whose locations are marked on mysterious maps.
※Mysterious maps can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll in exchange for Allagan tomestones, or by completing a certain quest. Alexandrite may also be obtained by participating in FATEs while equipped with your relic weapon (animus or beyond).
※The enhancement process will raise your relic weapon animus's strength, dexterity, vitality, intelligence, and mind attributes to a value befitting gear of item level 110. Attributes that remain will be replaced with the ones infused into the sphere scroll. In the case of Thyrus Animus and Omnilex Animus, base direct hit rate will not be replaced.
objectives: Speak with Jalzahn at Hyrstmill.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Using the superior enchanted ink you bring, I shall prepare a sphere scroll bearing arcanima patterns for enhancing your relic.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Your task will then be to acquire suitable varieties of materia, along with the pieces of alexandrite by which to convert and infuse their spiritual energy.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: When the sphere scroll is fully infused, the time will be ripe for its power to be bonded with your relic. The overseeing of this final step, I shall leave to Master Jalzahn.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Now, as you go about infusing materia, you may well undergo a change of heart. If you wish to have any infusion removed, bring the scroll in question to me, and I will see the deed done.

dialogue.name: HUBAIRTIN
dialogue.text: Lastly, pray relay to Master Jalzahn all that you have learned from me. His wealth of knowledge, I believe, will be instrumental to our success.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Sphere scrolls may be obtained from Hubairtin in exchange for bottles of superior enchanted ink.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Similarly, if you wish to undo the infusion process, you may do so by speaking with Hubairtin.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Star Light, Star Bright,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon animus. Paladins must be equipped with both Curtana and the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “Star Light, Star Bright,” you must be equipped with a relic weapon animus. Paladins must be equipped with both Curtana and the Holy Shield.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, my friend. By your triumphant expression, I take it you have found a way to enhance your relic with materia.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: ...Converting the spiritual energy into light for collective transference? A truly inspired idea! While I am not one to count my dodos before they hatch, based on my experience, I am quietly confident that this method shan't disappoint.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Now, depending on the varieties of materia used, I expect that your weapon's properties may undergo change.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Precisely in what manner, I cannot say until the infusion process is complete.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Go forth and infuse the sphere scroll as per young Hubairtin's instructions. When you have accomplished this task, bring the scroll to me, and I shall see to bonding its light energy with your relic.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Likewise, if you desire to know how your weapon will evolve, present it to me along with the scroll, and I shall divine for you the answer.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have fully infused a sphere scroll with materia, present it to Jalzahn at Hyrstmill in the North Shroud to have the corresponding relic weapon animus enhanced.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the process will replace the weapon's attributes with those that were infused in the sphere scroll.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The attributes strength, dexterity, vitality, intelligence, and mind will be raised to a value befitting gear of item level 110.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Attributes that remain will be replaced with the ones infused into the sphere scroll. In the case of Thyrus Animus and Omnilex Animus, base direct hit rate will not be replaced.

quest.name: その名をアニマウェポン
journal: Rowena is planning a trip to Revenant's Toll.

You happen upon Rowena just as two unexpected visitors arrive. The first is an earnest young researcher bearing an urgent request, the second, Gerolt the ale-sodden blacksmith. Wasting no time, the researcher, one Ardashir, declares that he has been conducting research into the creation of artificial life─something he refers to as “anima.” Though all of his trials have thus far ended in failure, he is convinced that the Sharlayans' work on arcane sentries holds the key to success. Before he can continue with his suit, however, Gerolt decries him for his lack of imagination, and wryly suggests fusing the anima with a weapon─a proposal which Ardashir considers a stroke of genius. Never one to miss a chance to turn a profit, Rowena sets about persuading Gerolt to take part in the venture, and before you know it, you too have been roped in to test the finished product. You are to rendezvous with Ardashir and Gerolt in Azys Lla, where the pair will apparently be working.
You find Ardashir in Azys Lla marveling at the technological wonders of the once-great Allagan Empire. Now that you have arrived, he is ready to begin work on the anima weapon.
objectives: Speak with Ardashir in Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Good evenin'Good mornin'Afternoon to you, Forename. Somethin' on your mind? I've been called back to Revenant's Toll to take care of a new shipment o' wares, but if you've matters o' money that require my attention─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Hold that thought. It seems I have visitors. Some more welcome than others...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: (-Dubious Youth-)Pardon the intrusion, Mistress Rowena. I realize I was here only a few days ago, but I really must speak with you about─

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Good, yer still here. We need to talk about that promissory note. Now I know what yer thinkin': “That stinkin' sack o' goobbue shite ain't got me godsdamned money!” Well, yer wrong. I saved it up, every last gil. The thing is, me mates took me out for a drink to celebrate, and─

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: (-Dubious Youth-)Excuse me, sir, but when people are talking, it is generally considered rude to interrupt. I know not what manner of business you have with Rowena, but I am quite sure it can wait.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: (-Dubious Youth-)As I was saying, Mistress Rowena─have you perchance been able to arrange a meeting with your associates? There is much I would ask them about their work on arcane sentries.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hold on a bleedin' minute! You are tellin' me to wait? Didn't no one ever teach ye to shut yer gob when grown-ups are talkin'? Me life and, more importantly, me note at the tavern's at stake here. Now be a good lad and bugger off till Uncle Gerolt's had his say.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Gerolt! Mind your own advice for once and keep quiet. I'll deal with you soon enough.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Regardin' your question, Ardashir─the answer's no. The client I had in mind's a bit of a recluse, and stubborn as all hells in her old age. She wouldn't hear of any meetin', and I ain't got time to press her on it at the moment. Too much to do by half.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Sounds like ye've got enough on yer plate without havin' to worry yerself over an old mate's owin's. I tell ye what, let's forget about it for─

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I know not what hole you have drunken yourself into, sir, and quite frankly, I do not care. I have important business to discuss with Mistress Rowena, and I demand you leave us be this instant!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah, the youth o' today! Jumped-up, self-servin' little shites the lot o' ye! ...Fine! Tell us then, Yer Highness─what's this business o' yers that's more important than a man's life, eh? Well? Out with it!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Very well. If only to explain myself to Rowena.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Together with my master, I have been conducting research into the manipulation of spiritual and aetheric energies in what you call the Near East. Our work has shown that the soul is in fact an agglomeration of a specific type of force. This force defines the quiddity of man and makes us who we are.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: While the soul is indeed inimitable, we believe it possible to create a quasi-soul. Thus we turned our attention to anima─the selfsame force which allows individuals to traverse the Lifestream via aetherytes. By infusing a soulstone with the requisite quantities of aether, this force may be harnessed.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Yet after years of research and experimentation, we have naught to show for it but inert husks of stone. We repeated the process again and again, adjusting every element, but the result was always the same. At length, my master declared the project a failure, and turned his thoughts to other matters.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But I could not give up! Not after witnessing the beauty of anima. Not after coming so close. And that is why I have journeyed hither to Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I am certain that with the Sharlayans' knowledge of arcane sentries, I can complete my project. I am also certain that the resultant souls will be worth more to mankind than the ale-soaked dishclout that passes for yours!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Finished, have ye? Well then, allow me to retort. Seems to me yer a cockered little brat as speaks a lot without sayin' aught. Ye talk like a man o' learnin' when 'tis plain yer just a boy what's never had a thought o' his own, and couldn't even if he tried─not that ye ever would, o' course.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And why? 'Cause the youth of today can't be bothered to do an onze of honest work for 'emselves. No sense o' duty. Things get rough, and ye run fer help, leavin' a trail o' piss in yer wake.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: D'ye reckon them scholarly folks from Sharlayan asked for the answer whenever they got stuck? Not bloody likely! 'Cause they used their bloody brains!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Tain't even that hard! If I saw these soul things burnin' out too quick, I'd think about sealin' 'em inside summat strong, like a weapon maybe, to keep all that life from escapin'. It'd cost 'em a bit o' freedom, aye, but it'd keep 'em around for a damn sight longer than you managed.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What's more, if the bloody things really are alive like ye say, ye'd end up with a weapon what could think for itself, which could be bloody lethal in the right hands! What do ye say to that, ye preenin' little shite?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: An anima weapon!? That...that is absolute genius! A means not only to preserve created anima, but to employ it...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Anima weapons, eh? Aye, that'll sell.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Quite an interestin' proposition, Gerolt. One that could be quite lucrative. Why not help poor Ardashir here with his work an' see what you can make of it?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Help that spineless streak o' piss? Yer jokin', ain't ye? Why in the seven hells would I play nursemaid to a watery-eyed brat like him? I was just spoutin' shite! I didn't really mean none of it!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Is that right? Pity. Sounded like somethin' we could've made a good bit o' coin out of. Enough to make me forget your debts, like as not... Your debts that I won't be forgettin' otherwise. Changed your mind? Good.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Listen, Ardashir: he may be a drunken bloody fool, but he's also the finest blacksmith in all the realm. If anyone can forge a weapon capable o' holdin' your souls, it's him.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And our adventurin' friend here, my dear sweet Forename, is a well-known hero 'round these parts. I'm sure she'dhe'd love nothin' more than to try out your new weapon when it's finished─ain't that right?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Just think of it: you'd be the first in all of Eorzea to wield one o' these anima weapons─which ain't a bad name now that I come to think of it. “Anima weapon.” Aye, that'll do.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Now don't be so hasty, Forename. This here is fate! What else could've brought the three of you to me at the selfsame time, eh? And don't go tellin' me the thought of a weapon that learns and adapts to combat don't interest you, 'cos we both know it does.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Gerolt, was it? Pray forgive me my rudeness earlier. If you truly are the smith she claims, I would be honored to have your assistance.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And you, Forename. I gather you are the perfect candidate to test the weapon once it's complete.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph. Well, if this'll get me square with Rowena, then I s'pose me hammer's yours.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But don't think I'm gettin' roped into this alone. If I have to forge it, you have to wield it.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Thank you, both of you. I promise you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Nice to see you're all gettin' on. Now, you're goin' to need a place to work, and I know just the spot.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Azys Lla, the seat of Allagan science, floatin' on high over Abalathia's Spine.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Not that the equipment up there'll be any use to you, mind. Only the Twelve know how that stuff works. Still, it'll keep pryin' eyes away until the weapon's ready. I'll arrange for an airship to take you within the day.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The fabled Azys Lla... I look forward to seeing you there, Forename!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Today has provenToday is already provin'Today is provin' to be more productive than I thought. Gerolt's out o' my hair, and soon I'll have new merchandise for the House o' Splendors. Assumin' this ridiculous plan o' his works. I'm countin' on you, Forename.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We come all this way, and we can't even use the godsdamned equipment. D'ye know how heavy this anvil is? Too bloody heavy! Should've given it to his lordship to carry─that would've been good for a laugh.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, I know. I have to go and help that little shite with his godsdamned research. Still think we should've done the work here, but there's no arguin' with Rowena. <sigh> Just let me finish one more kettle.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Forename. Gerolt's sure to start gripin' and moanin' after a while, but you just remind him o' what he owes me. That should set him straight.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The fabled Azys Lla. I'd heard stories, but who would believe such a technological marvel could exist, and floating in the sky at that. If only my master could see me now.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But this is not the time for gawping. Come, let us begin our work on the anima weapon.

quest.name: 新たな武器の創造を
journal:
Ardashir seems eager to bring anima into being.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Ardashir hopes to begin work on the anima weapon as soon as possible. All the necessary elements are in place save two: astral and umbral nodules, the catalysts required to facilitate the process of channeling aether into the soulstone. Unsure of where to procure them, Ardashir suggests speaking with Rowena in Revenant's Toll. With any luck, she will know of a merchant who can provide what he needs.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Hearing of your need for crystals with unusual properties, Rowena suggests speaking with a merchant by the name of Syndony. She is a jeweler who also happens to be quite knowledgeable about crystals. You can find her on the terrace of the second floor in the House of Splendors.

Upon speaking with Syndony, it soon becomes clear that your reputation has preceded you. When you inquire about the nodules, she is taken aback by your outlandish request, but is not deterred from the challenge of producing what you seek. The process will require elementally aspected luminous crystals, and she insists you bring her one of every element. However, she also believes there may be one other way: bringing her a Zodiac Weapon of the highest order. Seeing your nonplussed expression, she concedes that such a legendary weapon may be no more than a rumor.

※Should you be unwilling or unable to offer a suitable Zodiac Weapon, luminous crystals can be obtained by participating in FATEs in the following regions:
- Sea of Clouds: luminous wind crystals
- Azys Lla: luminous fire crystals
- Churning Mists: luminous lightning crystals
- Coerthas western highlands: luminous ice crystals
- Dravanian forelands: luminous earth crystals
- Dravanian hinterlands: luminous water crystals

With the nodules in hand, Ardashir is at last ready to go through with Gerolt's plan. He duly completes the infusion of aether, and hands the pulsating soulstone to Gerolt, who immediately sets about affixing the radiant gem to your weapon. Some time later, the sweating smith finally lowers his hammer, a look of both exhaustion and satisfaction on his face. The plan has succeeded and you are the proud owner of an anima weapon. Now begins the journey to discover its full potential.
objectives: Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Syndony at Revenant's Toll.
Deliver the astral nodule and umbral nodule to Ardashir in Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Soul without Life,” you will receive an anima weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To further enhance the strength of this anima weapon, speak with Ardashir again to undertake the quest “Toughening Up.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To forge a different anima weapon, please change to your desired job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I take it you're ready to proceed? Excellent. Gerolt has already begun work on the weapon that will serve to contain the anima. The difficulty lies in sustaining the thing long enough for the transfer to take place.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But with the appropriate stabilizing materials, I believe it should be possible, provided we act quickly.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have brought several soulstones with me, so you needn't worry about that. I shall see that one is fitted to your weapon.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The only needful things I do not currently possess are crystals capable of handling the quantities of aether required for our work.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To be specific, we will need astral and umbral nodules.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Would that we were working in Radz–at–Han. I knew of a merchant there who sold them. Costly though they were, I was never wanting for supplies. Perhaps Mistress Rowena would know of someone willing to trade. Might you be willing to speak with her on my behalf?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: No doubt whoever she refers you to will not part with them readily, but I trust you will be able to come to some manner of arrangement.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In the meantime, Gerolt and I will finish preparations for the anima weapon. Safe travels, friend.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, come to create another anima weapon, have you? Needless to say, I should be only too happy to help! I trust you remember the required astral and umbral nodules?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Yes, well, I will need you to procure more of both. Syndony will doubtless be able to furnish you with a sufficiency, assuming her skills are as impressive as they seem. I do hope she is still where you last met. Perhaps you should speak with Mistress Rowena to know for certain.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Well if it isn't my favorite adventurer. How's that anima weapon comin' along?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Astral and umbral nodules? Hmmm, might be as Syndony will have what you're after.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: She's a jeweler by trade, but her work with crystals is somethin' to behold, let me tell you. They say she can strip 'em of elements, charge 'em with new ones, even make 'em out o' thin air, if you can believe such a thing. Can't vouch for the rumors myself, but her profits say plenty.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: She can be a bit picky about clients, but you bein' the Warrior o' Light and all, I'm sure your sparklin' reputation will catch her eye like the crystals she's so fond of.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: If you go upstairs, you'll find her out on the terrace.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. What brings you to the House o' Splendors?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Nodules for another anima weapon? You'll be wantin' to speak with Syndony, then. You can find her on the terrace upstairs.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Ah, the Warrior of Light. What a pleasant surprise. No need to be alarmed, my dear. It is my business to know all of Eorzea's treasures, be they material or mortal. But tell me, to what do I owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: ...Astral and umbral nodules? My, my... I see you are a womanman of unusual tastes. Might I ask what you plan to do with such curious crystals?

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: An essence akin to the soul. I suppose such peculiar work would call for crystals as equally peculiar. Well, you were wise to seek me out. I've dedicated my life to the study of crystals, and I cannot bear the thought of knowing there are crystals I could not procure.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Mind you, these are no mere baubles or trinkets you ask of me. Crystals of such purity are not easily come by, but to also be so rich in astral- and umbral–aspected energies...

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Still, with the proper materials I believe it can be done. It will require a great deal of aether, obviously, and of a specific persuasion.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
