dialogue.text: I am informed that when a man falls in battle, a residual energy hangs in the aether long after his spirit has returned to the Lifestream. This energy can infuse crystals in the vicinity with a purity not often seen in nature. A purity essential for what you desire.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: I can use these crystals, luminous crystals I call them, to imbue empty ones with the astral and umbral energies necessary to create what you seek. But I will require one crystal of every element.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: They will not be easy to come by, of that I can assure you. You will likely have to scour every ilm of Eorzea to find them.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: ...However, there may be one other way to acquire the aether we need. It requires something of the rarer sort─something much more precious than luminous crystals.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, it is my business to know all of Eorzea's treasures. And if the rumors are true, there exist certain weapons of legend said to have supped on the souls of countless enemies.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: In fact, a certain great hero who wields one of these weapons is supposedly working with a young researcher somewhere beyond the Sea of Clouds. Though this is only what I have heard. I will not hold you to ransom on the strength of mere hearsay.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Even so, the rumors of these weapons are not so easily dismissed. Embodiments of war, veritable reservoirs of soul energy...

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: If you were in possession of such a weapon, creating these astral and umbral nodules would be as child's play.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Or you could simply collect the requisite luminous crystals. I will assist you all the same.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: I leave the choice in your famously capable hands.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: The Warrior of Light. A welcome sight, shining brightly as always. What can I do for you today?

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Astral and umbral nodules again? I take it you put the others to good use, then.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: Well, far be it from me to turn away a fellow connoisseur of crystals. That is, of course, assuming you have what is required to make them. I would have either a Zodiac Weapon or a complete set of luminous crystals from you.

dialogue.name: SYNDONY
dialogue.text: In any case, I very much look forward to working with you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Players who possess a Zodiac Weapon Zeta may exchange it for both the astral and umbral nodules. Excalibur Zeta must be exchanged together with the Aegis Shield Zeta. Please note, however, that the Zodiac Weapon Zeta will be lost upon completing the exchange.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alternatively, players may acquire the astral and umbral nodules in exchange for elementally aspected luminous crystals. These crystals may be obtained, albeit at a low probability, by participating in FATEs in certain areas.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Luminous wind crystals may be obtained from FATEs in the Sea of Clouds.
Luminous fire crystals may be obtained from FATEs in Azys Lla.
Luminous lightning crystals may be obtained from FATEs in the Churning Mists.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Luminous ice crystals may be obtained from FATEs in the Coerthas western highlands.
Luminous earth crystals may be obtained from FATEs in the Dravanian forelands.
Luminous water crystals may be obtained from FATEs in the Dravanian hinterlands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Players will receive the astral nodule in exchange for a luminous wind, fire, and lightning crystal.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Players will receive the umbral nodule in exchange for a luminous ice, earth, and water crystal.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Luminous crystals may be obtained, albeit at a low probability, by participating in FATEs in the aforementioned regions with any Disciple of War or Magic, regardless of level.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This information can be reviewed in your journal or by speaking with Syndony at any time.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Were you able to acquire what we need?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Yes, these appear to be genuine. I dare not ask what this cost you, but you have my sincerest thanks. As promised, the soulstone is ready. All that remains now is the aether infusion.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And if the weapon Gerolt has forged is strong enough to contain the resulting anima, we shall soon be the proud parents of a living weapon!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Now then, let us begin.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The aether has taken hold in the soulstone, but it will not last long.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Quickly, Gerolt─seal it within the weapon before the aether fades!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> That... That should do it. That thing ain't goin' nowhere.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that there's a weapon worthy o' legends! Aye, an anima weapon: [Error]. Wield it with pride, lasslad.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now that there's a weapon worthy o' legends! Aye, an anima weapon: [Error], and its twin [Error]. Wield 'em with pride, lasslad.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Though I wouldn't say they're completeshe's the finished article just yet. A weapon fresh from the forge is one thing, but if it's life we're talkin' about, they're naught but sucklin' babesshe's naught but a sucklin' babe. They wantShe wants puttin' through theirher paces and toughenin' up.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I could pound 'emher with me hammer, o' course, but that ain't no substitute for real battle. If y'ask me, ye need to get out there and teach that anima what it means to be a warrior.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excuse me, Gerolt, but might I have a word with our friend here? It was, after all, my research that brought us this far.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Come, Forename, let us discuss the next step in developing the anima.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The anima weapon quests may be repeated at any time. However, please note that you may only undertake these quests for one job at a time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to restart these quests as a different job, select Duty from the main menu, followed by Journal. Next, select the quest from within the interface, followed by Abandon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have abandoned the quest, you may change to your desired job and speak with Ardashir to start over.

quest.name: 英雄の軌跡
journal:
Ardashir seems curious to see how the anima will develop.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

The anima now residing in your weapon is as a newborn babe in mortal terms. In order to foster this fledgling spirit, Gerolt suggests that you treat it to some good old-fashioned combat. Knowing that you have been involved in more than a few titanic battles over the years, he recommends revisiting the sites of some of your most memorable encounters. Hearing this, Ardashir asks to accompany you to ensure the anima's development does not go undocumented. When you subsequently look back upon your past exploits, the frost-rimed halls of Snowcloak spring to mind. Perhaps Coerthas would be a good place to begin the anima's education.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

With anima weapon in hand, you fight your way through Snowcloak's frozen chambers, and emerge none the worse for wear. While contemplating your next destination, a glinting fish in the half-frozen water nearby catches your eye, and in that moment you decide where to continue the anima's education: the Sastasha Seagrot.

※The prerequisite quests for Sastasha (Hard) must be completed before continuing with this quest.

The drowned Reavers of the Seagrot are no match for you and your new weapon. Soaked to the skin from your aquatic adventure, you elect to continue the anima's education in a warmer and dryer location. And where could be warmer or dryer than the Sunken Temple of Qarn?

※The prerequisite quests for The Sunken Temple of Qarn (Hard) must be completed before continuing with this quest.

You fight off the wildlife now roaming the halls of Qarn, avoiding the perils of still-lingering traps and snares along the way. While such feats are all in a day's work for the Warrior of Light, the same cannot be said of Ardashir, who has done well to follow you to this point. Trouble him for his thoughts on the journey thus far.

Ardashir asks if you have noticed any changes in the anima since the start of your journey, but you have nothing of note to report. Undiscouraged, you resolve to revisit the Keeper of the Lake, and drive off any Garlean forces that may be salvaging the wreckage there.

Unable to stay your advance, the Garleans retreat, and the Keeper of the Lake sleeps soundly once more. For the anima's next lesson, you decide to revisit the Wanderer's Palace, to ensure that the Mamool Ja pose no further threat to the tonberries.

※The prerequisite quests for The Wanderer's Palace (Hard) must be completed before continuing with this quest.

With the aid of the anima weapon, you drive the Mamool Ja out of the Wanderer's Palace, leaving the tonberries in peace. When you subsequently pause to consider a suitable venue for your next lesson, you are reminded of a malevolent force which once took hold of Amdapor Keep. Never quite convinced that the darkness had been truly banished, you resolve to make for the Shroud.

※The prerequisite quests for Amdapor Keep (Hard) must be completed before continuing with this quest.
Once more, Amdapor Keep has been purged of foul spirits. As you pause to catch your breath, you notice that Ardashir seems oddly distracted. Ask him what is occupying his thoughts.

Despite the ever-present danger of death, it would seem that Ardashir has been struck by the beauty of Eorzea. Plainly, her wonders are easier to appreciate when you are not the one doing the fighting. With nothing to report on the anima's development, you turn to leave, but pause to look back when you sense a familiar presence nearby. Seeing no one, you dismiss the feeling as a trick of the imagination, and ponder where to go next. In the end, you settle on the Dusk Vigil, that once-proud fortress left to the wild beasts of Coerthas.

※The prerequisite quests for the Dusk Vigil must be completed before continuing with this quest.

Wielding the anima weapon with consummate skill, you leave the living denizens of the Dusk Vigil dead, and the dead ones in pieces. Soon after, with the enemies of Ishgard still fresh in your mind, your thoughts turn to dragons. Perhaps some remnant of the Horde lingers on the slopes of Sohm Al...

On the slopes of Sohm Al, you lay low the minions of Nidhogg in what you hope to be an educational fashion. The threat of dragons still looms, however, and so you journey to the Aery to strike once more against Ishgard's greatest foe.

Though your visit to the Aery severely taxed your strength, it is not yet time to rest. Nevertheless, you bid Ardashir make for the safety of Ishgard, for where you mean to go, he cannot follow. Rather than face the enemies without, you choose to face the enemies within─your memories, that is. Using the power of your mind, you will relive your battle in the Vault.

Though your reenactment of the battle in the Vault only loosely corresponded to the actual event, you are hopeful that the experience was of some benefit. When you subsequently reflect on the lengths to which you have gone to nurture the anima, you suddenly recall a strange occurrence in the Black Shroud which you suspect may be significant. Speak with Ardashir and tell him what you saw.
Ardashir's eyes grow wide with wonder upon hearing your account of the anima. He leaves immediately for Azys Lla, and asks that you rejoin him there as soon as you are able.

Upon arriving, you find Ardashir abuzz with excitement, much to Gerolt's evident irritation. You interrupt the pair's bickering with the revelation that the anima can speak. While Ardashir is dumbstruck by the implications of this discovery, Gerolt wants nothing more than to go home, and asks for your weapon that he might make some final adjustments. The blacksmith duly gives the thing an exceedingly thorough pounding, his arm granted new strength by his thirst for ale, but even he is unprepared for what follows. Without warning, the weapon begins to glow as if alive. Though you sense the fledgling anima still has some way to go, you look forward to seeing it grow.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Toughening Up,” you will receive an anima weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.text: In order to undertake the quest “Toughening Up,” you must be equipped with [Error] and [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake the quest “Toughening Up,” you must be equipped with [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: So, Forename, the task of unlocking the anima's potential begins in earnest. I only wish I could offer some words of wisdom on the subject.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Alas, my original studies only went so far as the anima's creation. Now that we've given it a body in your weapon, I'm afraid we are entering unfamiliar territory.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As of now, the anima is not unlike a newborn babe. A lack of proper sensory stimulation could well cause it to stagnate or even disappear despite the measures we have taken. As such, it is imperative that we help it to mature and grow accustomed to its new form.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, an' there ain't no better place to test a weapon than on the front line.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' seein' as yer rarely off the front line, it shouldn't take ye long to whip that thing into shape.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Mayhap this is why my own trials always ended in failure... Without a proper body, the anima had no purpose─it could not be put to a task which would grant it the requisite stimulation.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If you are all Mistress Rowena claims you to be, I have no doubt you will find a suitable challenge for our young charge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If yer not sure where to go, just think back on some o' yer more bowel-loosenin' adventures. A stroll through a few o' them dark dank holes you lot like─say, ten or so─an' I bet me next round at the Druthers yer weapon'll've got into the swing o' things.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ahem. If it is not too much trouble, I should very much like to accompany you on your travels. As I said before, this is uncharted territory in the growth of anima, and I would be a disgrace to my profession if I let any developments pass unrecorded.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. For my part, I promise to stay out of harm's way, observing your progress from as safe a vantage point as possible.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That thing's like to need a few tweaks when ye come back, but you leave that to me. I'll work out any faults ye find in her, and pound her into a weapon worthy o' the House o' Splendors.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! I take it you are ready to resume our research. Excellent!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Like before, ye'll need to fight yer way 'round ten o' them hellholes ye like to get yer weapon into the swing o' things.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And I shall accompany you to gather data on the anima's progress.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' when ye come back, I'll hammer out any faults ye find in the weapon. You mark my words, Rowena will be beggin' to sell this one when I've finished with her!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I am glad to see you are still whole. But tell me, have you noticed any changes in the anima?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I see. It grows far more slowly than I had anticipated... No matter. Let us continue.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well fought, Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You know, these lands really are quite beautiful, dangerous though they may be. Were it not for my logbook, I would swear I was on some manner of sightseeing tour.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Of course, all that ghastly bloodletting does rather spoil the picture─but I digress.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: How is the anima? Still no changes?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: That is most unfortunate. Yet we must take solace in the fact that it has not yet faded from the weapon. I am certain it will quicken, 'tis but a question of when.

dialogue.name: ARDASHI
dialogue.text: Let us press on to our next destination. Lead the way, Forename!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. I am glad to see you are unhurt.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Pray forgive me. While waiting here, my eyes could not help but be drawn to the architecture. Breathtaking, is it not?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ahem. Back to the matter at hand. How fares the anima weapon? Surely by now it has shown some hint of life.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The anima took on a corporeal form!? Then it has quickened!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Gerolt must hear of this! I will return to Azys Lla and relay to him the good news.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The anima has taken on a corporeal form? Then it has finally quickened. Excellent.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I will return to Azys Lla and relay the news to Gerolt. No doubt he will be glad to hear of another success.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: When you are rested, meet with us there.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename! You are returned! Excellent!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Thank the bloody gods. Maybe now ye can stop gibberin' like a bleedin' opo-opo an' tell me what happened out there. I'm guessin' things went well.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Have you not listened to a word I've said? Forename believes the anima has achieved cognitive self-awareness, manifesting itself as a corporeal form independent of the receptacle you created!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Why is it that you invariably fail to comprehend my meaning whenever I expound upon matters of profoundest import? Forename here believes the anima has again achieved cognitive self-awareness, manifesting itself as a corporeal form independent of the receptacle you fashioned!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've had it up to here with yer bleedin' cogs an' corpses! Speak plain, boy!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Having experienced battle together with Forename, the anima has melded with your weapon. More than that, the anima may have taken on a unique physical form!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It spoke to you!? Remarkable! But what did it sound like? A-And what did it say!?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: So this anima spoke to you as well, did it? Fascinating! But tell me, what did it sound like? And what did it say?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What did you hear?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I thought I heard a woman whispering.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I thought I heard a man whispering.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Amazing! The anima is already learning how to communicate! Oh, if only my master were here.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I can hardly wait to see what else it is capable of!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Magnificent. The anima is making excellent progress. I look forward to seeing how this one will develop.

dialogue.name: GERILT
dialogue.text: An' I look forward to goin' home. Anyroad, give us the weapon, will ye? I'll bet there's still room fer improvement somewhere or other.

dialogue.name: GERILT
dialogue.text: Now don't go playin' silly buggers, Forename. I'm holdin' up me end o' the deal with Rowena, one way or another. Ain't as if it'll take long, neither.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> What did...I tell ye... Better than new. If that anima was sleepin' before, it sure as hells ain't sleepin' now! Heh heh! Never seen a weapon do that in all me years in the trade.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> What did...I tell ye... Better than new.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If that anima was sleepin' before, it sure as hells ain't sleepin' now! Heh heh! Never seen a sword an' shield do that in all me years in the trade.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What an exquisite glow! It's as if the anima could burst forth at any moment!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excellent work, Gerolt. I doubt any man could grow tired of gazing upon such exquisite work.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If so young an anima was able to take form of its own volition, imagine what it might become given time! A force that shines bright enough to make the very stars burn with envy!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If so young an anima was able to take form of its own volition, imagine what it might become given time! A force that shines bright enough to make the very stars burn with envy!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The anima weapon has awakened from its slumber, ascending to new heights of power!

quest.name: 煌めくアニマウェポン
journal:
Ardashir is concerned about the anima's growth.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

The anima has grown at a rattling pace, absorbing large amounts of aether in the process. Ardashir fears this rapid development may exceed the limits of the soulstone serving as its base. To ensure all your hard work is not wasted, he plans to fortify the soulstone, as well as have Gerolt forge a new weapon to hold it. This new weapon, however, will require four materials essential for conducting large quantities of aether: enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water. Gerolt suggests seeking out a merchant named Cristiana at the House of Splendors in Mor Dhona who may have what he requires.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Cristiana's wares are limited, but she does, in fact, have what you seek. If only it were as simple as paying her in gil. She demands several expertly exotic goods in exchange for the materials Gerolt asked for. Whether you fashion them, find them, or trade for them, you must acquire what Gerolt needs if you are to complete the anima weapon.

You acquire the materials necessary to affix the anima's soulstone to a new weapon. Gerolt takes up his hammer and once again puts his legendary skills to work. The familiar ring of his hammer fills the air, but the medley soon comes to a halt. His latest masterpiece is complete, and your weapon is born anew! You hold it aloft, basking in its light, when what appears to be a sprite takes shape before you and thanks you for all you have done. You smile and nod, knowing your journey together has only just begun.

dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Coming into Its Own,” you must be equipped with [Error] and [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Coming into Its Own,” you must be equipped with [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The anima's growth thus far is well beyond what I expected. By absorbing aether during our travels, it has matured enough to take on a form separate from the weapon, and even speak to Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To grow so quickly would have required a substantial amount of aether. However, the soulstone is not without its limits. As it continues to absorb aether and grow, I fear it may not bear the strain of further development.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer tellin' me after all the work I did, the anima could swell up like a Bombard an' burst!? Ye better have a plan to fix it, 'cause I sure as hells ain't startin' over.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Who exactly do you think you are talking to? This is my life's work, short a time as that may be. Of course I have a plan.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If we can reinforce the soulstone and increase its capacity for aetheric energies, it should remain stable. I will speak with Rowena and see to collecting what we require.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, ye had me fooled when you was beggin' and pleadin' to see those Sharlayan books before. Good to know yer incompetence was only fer show. Well, seein' as ye have everythin' under control, if ye don't mind I think I'll─

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Run off to some tavern to get deep in your cups? Sadly you haven't the time nor the coin for it. Not when you have a new weapon to make for our friend Forename here.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A new weapon!? I just finished fixin' the one shehe has now. Why the hells do ye need another?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Just as we develop and change over time, it is only fitting the anima should as well. Or do you mean to tell me you were always such a gentleman, even as a child?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> It never ends, does it? Fine, if it'll help settle me debt with Rowena, ye'll have yer bleedin' weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If we're attachin' the soulstone to a new weapon, we're gonna need materials fer conductin' aether. That's where you come in.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I need ye to go and fetch me some enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I know a lass in Mor Dhona what sells 'em─Cristiana's her name. Like as not, ye'll find her keepin' a corner somewhere at the House o' Splendors. They won't come cheap, but yer a resourceful sort. I'm sure ye'll think o' somethin'.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This anima has grown remarkably fast. Judging by the rise in its aetheric levels, we'll soon need to reinforce the soulstone for this one as well.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Meanin' I have to fire up the forge again, eh? Well, Forename, that means there's work for you as well.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We're gonna need another round of enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Go and speak with Cristiana at the House o' Splendors. She should be able to get you what we need.

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: A customer? A customer! You are a customer, aren't you? I mean, I realize this isn't a proper stall, but I do have wares to sell. That is, if, um, you're willing to buy them. Have you come to buy my wares?

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: Aether-conductive materials? I think I have what you're looking for, but it won't come cheap!

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I don't get buyers for these items all that often, but now that I have you─my new favorite customer─I'm sure to turn a profit, and then I can build a stall of my very own!

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: But I don't want your gil! No, dealing with gil is much too messy. What with all the counting, and sorting, and finding a place to─ Ahem. Bartering is much simpler, don't you think? There are a few things I'd be willing to trade for, if you're interested.

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: A customer? A customer! Oh, and a returning one at that! You did come to buy something, didn't you? I mean, I realize this isn't a proper stall, but I still have wares to sell. That is, if, um, you're willing to buy them. Have you come to buy my wares?

dialogue.name: CRISTIANA
dialogue.text: Is that not what you asked for last time? I mean, I think that's what you asked for. I recall something about rubber and water, and─ Ahem, excuse me. If that's what you're looking for, then you know what I'll need in exchange.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The goods requested by Cristiana can be obtained through various means including dungeons, tribal quests, and crafting.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with other players and share information to discover how to find them!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get everythin' we need? Good. Hand it all over─the weapon, too.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ardashir's ready to work on the soulstone, and he won't shut up about it. At least now it'll all be over.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, I thought ye said ye had everything we need!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's enchanted rubber, fast-drying carboncoat, fast-acting Allagan catalyst, and divine water. If yer missing somethin', hurry on back to Cristiana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Good on ye, lasslad. Now then, let's make us a weapon, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Can't say I've ever forged somethin' quite so extraordinary. A weapon fit for yer growin' anima. Nay, something more than that.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Almace, a sword without equal. Together with Ancile, the gods themselves'd be hard-pressed to lay a blow on ye.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Verethragna. The gods themselves'd be jealous o' knuckles so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Ukonvasara. The gods themselves'd be jealous of an axe so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Rhongomiant. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a lance so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Gandiva. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a bow so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Majestas. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a staff so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Hvergelmir. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a staff so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Draconomicon. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a tome so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Tetrabiblos. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a tome so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Kannagi. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a pair o' blades so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Nothung. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a blade so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Armageddon. The gods themselves'd be jealous of a firearm so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A beauty worthy o' ballads─Deneb. The gods themselves'd be jealous of an astrolabe so fine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Wait till Rowena takes a gander at this. We keep this up an' she'll be givin' me notes o' promise.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To be honest, I once questioned what use I had for a drunkard with a hammer. But you have proven yourself to be quite the competent blacksmith─when you're sober.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename, I am at a loss as to how to express my thanks. You looked danger in the eye, unflinching, risking life and limb to help me. I hope someday I can repay your kindness.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: (Tch. Sure shehe carried it around a bit, but I made the damned thing! Don't I deserve a little more than left-handed compliments?)

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What!? The anima manifested again? When?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But I didn't see anything. Are you certain?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Why is it that only you are able to see the anima when it chooses to present itself?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Maybe it's got no interest in the likes o' you.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I suppose the anima is not yet strong enough. Perhaps one day, after it has fully matured, we too will be able to behold its wonders.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This calls to mind Thavnairian literature on the Zodiac Braves, legendary heroes who wielded arms of unparalleled strength.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But soon they will tell tales of a new legend─of you and your anima weapon!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now don't be gettin' ahead o' yerself, lad. There's no denying it's a beauty, but there's still room for improvement.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye just said yerself the anima ain't fully matured yet.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I do not need you to remind me of such things.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have kept a rather comprehensive account of everything we have done thus far. With all the data I have collected, it is only a matter of time before the next step in fostering the anima is clear.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Which reminds me, Forename. If you would care to read over my notes on our work, you are more than welcome to pore over them at your leisure. They are on the table just over there.

dialogue.name: GEROL
dialogue.text: (Aye, that's the way, lad. Every step that brings us closer to finishin' this bleedin' weapon brings me a step closer to a life free from debt and that gil-swindlin' wench Rowena.)

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Again we have succeeded in creating an anima weapon! Excellent work.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You say the anima has manifested itself yet again? That is good to hear.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Much like the last, I look forward to the day I can behold its wonder with my own eyes.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: All the more reason I must continue my research! Our work is without precedent, 'tis true, but I will not be deterred.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your weapon has been forged anew, and the anima's strength blossoms!

quest.name: 人造精霊の声
journal:
Ardashir has made a breakthrough in his study of the anima.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Ardashir is determined to supplement the anima's aetheric energies so that it might relay its thoughts clearly and concisely. To that end, he proposes improving the aetherial conductivity of the weapon not only to give the anima the strength to converse, but to allow those without the Echo to comprehend that which is communicated. Gerolt begrudgingly agrees to assist. To work on the anima weapon, however, he must first insulate his tools with a soulglaze, and for that he requires five pots of aether oil. He bids you seek out Eorzea's traders of ancient antiquities to procure what he requires.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You return with pots of aether oil in hand to find Gerolt in unusually high spirits. He soon reveals the reason for his good mood, namely that he has, in fact, consumed a large volume of spirits. Deaf to Ardashir's plea to lower his hammer, Gerolt begins pounding away with surprising speed and precision. It is not long before his work is complete and you take up a weapon seemingly alive with aether. As you raise it high to bask in its warm glow, the anima suddenly manifests itself to you. It is thankful for its newfound strength, and vows to do what it can to aid you in your coming adventures. Though he cannot yet perceive the anima, Ardashir is glad to see you sharing such a lengthy exchange, and looks forward to seeing how the anima will take shape under your guidance.
objectives: With Almace and AncileVerethragnaUkonvasaraRhongomiantGandivaMajestasHvergelmirDraconomiconTetrabiblosKannagiArmageddonNothungDeneb in your inventory, deliver the pots of aether oil to Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Finding Your Voice,” you will receive an anima weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Finding Your Voice,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Finding Your Voice,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We have made remarkable progress, Forename, but our work is far from over.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If we are to create a truly freethinking weapon, we must empower the anima to do more than utter a few unintelligible words to its wielder.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text:
Moreover, it must be encouraged to recognize you not only as the rightful owner of the weapon, but also as a companion to whom it can turn for guidance.
...A companion who senses its presence where no other can.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Quite why that should be is a question which confounded me for some time.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It was only after spending countless days poring over my notes that the answer came to me. In my efforts to predict the anima's rate of growth, I realized that I had overlooked an important variable─you, my friend. Which is why I took the liberty of investigating you and your dealings in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You are possessed of a rare power known to some as the “Echo,” are you not?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have read that it conveys a preternatural sensitivity to the psyches of others. And what is the anima but a nascent psyche?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer sayin' ye've got to have special powers just to see the bloody thing?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Special powers what only a handful o' folks've got. Well, that's just great, that is. Even if Forename an' herhis Echo-sportin' mates buy ten weapons each, they ain't like to spend the sums Rowena's got in mind, meanin' me debts are set to go unpaid. Unless, o' course, ye've thought of a solution?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, I have!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Unlike the quasi-souls of golems and other constructs, the anima is unique in that it was created using the pure aetherial energies of astral and umbral nodules. As such, it bears no residual imprint of another psyche, and therefore possesses the potential for cognizance and growth.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Having no reason or desire to grow, golems can typically subsist almost indefinitely on the energy of their initial aetherial infusion.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The anima, however, is quite different. Being in a state of constant development, it requires a constant supply of aether. And while it is capable of sustaining itself by drawing upon the naturally occurring aether of its immediate surroundings, I have theorized that the cause of its marked growth to this point is, in fact, its close proximity with you, Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Your weapon serves as a conduit between you and the anima, feeding it energy at a steady, albeit slow, pace. If we could somehow improve the weapon's conductivity, I am certain it would promote faster growth, enhancing the anima's ability to communicate.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But that is not all. Should we improve the conductivity sufficiently, the resultant strengthening of the connection between anima and wielder could, in theory, facilitate communication even in the absence of the Echo─felling two birds with but a single stone.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Which is where you come in, Gerolt. Do you think you can improve the aetherial conductivity of our anima's lodgings?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph. I can't bloody well say no now, can I?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I reckon I should be able to get the aether flowin' a bit freer between Forename and the anima, but it'll come at a cost.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: By improvin' the weapon's conductivity, it'll become extra sensitive to anyone touchin' it, and that includes me when I'm poundin' on it with me hammer. My energies pourin' into the anima could muddle up whatever relations Forename's already got with it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I mean, if the bloody thing was to take after me instead of old Forename here...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, I will not deny that taking after a man of your...character could certainly prove problematic. But how would you go about preventing such contamination?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Contamination!? Cheeky little shite! Any anima'd be lucky to take after me! Just not this one, on account o' how it's Forename's. Don't go worryin' yer pretty little head, anyway, 'cause unlike you, I think my plans through.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's a matter o' makin' me tools impassible to aether, in case yer wonderin'. Luckily, I've done summat similar before. While I was workin' with another annoyin' scholarly type, we developed a little trick called “soulglazin'.” It's used to insulate weapons, but me tools shouldn't be no different.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...'Course, I didn't actually make the soulglaze meself, but I've got a fair idea what might stand in fer it. Accordin' to a glowin' ball I was talkin' to, the Allagans used summat called “aether oil” in their metalworkin', an' it did pretty much the same job.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's sure to be rare, expensive, or a bit o' both, but ye've got experience with this sort o' thing, don't ye lasslad?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So run along an' find us five pots of aether oil fer me hammer an' anvil, will ye? We're none of us gettin' any younger.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: ...I am, of course, grateful to you for identifying a solution. It is but a pity you did not think to ask this glowing ball of yours where to acquire it. Mayhap next time you could think your plan through a little more, yes?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I apologize for this gross imposition, but I fear we must have that aether oil if we are to proceed.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In the meantime, Gerolt and I will continue researching how best to foster the anima's development.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. I take it you are ready for the next step in nurturing yet another young anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Then we must apply another coating of soulglaze to Gerolt's tools that he may safely work on the anima's vessel.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As you may recall, the process calls for five pots of aether oil. I know not where you acquired them before, but I must ask that you do so again. We will have made the necessary preparations by the time you return.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We shall set to work as soon as you return with the aether oil. It is five pots we require, don't forget. Oh, and do remember to bring the weapon itself. We shall struggle to proceed without that!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must have [Error] and [Error] in your inventory to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must have [Error] in your inventory to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Was I not clear? If we are to improve the anima weapon's conductivity without exposing the poor thing to Gerolt's...character, we need five pots of aether oil.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well done, friend. While you were abroad acquiring these, we saw to the rather less onerous matter of our own preparations.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In the process, we happened upon an archive with a particularly riveting selection of texts on aetherochemical research that may well prove useful in the future.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Alas, I was only able to steal a few cursory glances at their contents as Gerolt was intent upon sneaking off to drown himself in ardent spirits. <sigh> Would that he were as keen to immerse himself in his work...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well done, friend. Preparations went fairly smoothly in your absence...despite Gerolt's best attempts to lose himself in his cups.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Pious little prick. A young'un like you wouldn't understand. It's me muse...me inspiration! All me best ideas come after downin' summat strong.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Is that right? Then what a pity you abstained for as long as you did. Had you only been a little more inebriated, mayhap you would have devised a plan which didn't involve putting Forename to such trouble.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Shut yer gob an' coat me anvil with that aether oil before I crack one o' them pots over yer head.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There. Applying the oil was much easier than I expected. How did you fare with your hammer?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She's oiled up an' ready fer action. There's no tellin' how long the coatin'll last, though. Time to get poundin'!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Please do be careful, Gerolt. Forename went to great lengths to procure that oil. I would not have herhim go to all that trouble again through any error on our part.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think yer forgettin' who yer talkin' to, lad. My only error's makin' weapons what're too good fer their owners─present company excepted o' course. Besides, I downed a bottle o' the good stuff not long ago. Never felt better!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well, I am glad to hear─

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Wait, did you say a bottle? A whole bottle!? Seven hells, man! I cannot in good conscience allow you to work in your condition!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah! Don't be so daft. It weren't bad stuff. 'Least I don't think it was. I found it when ye were readin'─hic!─all about them aether-comical wossnames.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, there's only one way to find out how good it really was. It's─hic!─hammerin' time!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now stand back, and let the─hic!─master get to work!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: How...how is that possible? Such swift, precise movements. And his eyes─never have I seen them so sharp. Is he quite certain it was alcohol he drank and not some manner of invigorating tonic?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: No matter how many times I see it, I fail to comprehend how alcohol can inspire a man to work with such vigor.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This is not the drunkard I imagined when Rowena introduced us. Mayhap...mayhap we should keep another bottle on hand. In case he should be required to craft something else, I mean.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Truly the realm's most peculiar blacksmith.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There! A taste o' me true talents. Next time, maybe ye'll believe old Gerolt when he tells ye about the redeemin' power of a stiff drink.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now then, Forename. Hold her up and see how she feels. Like an extension o' yer armsarm, I'll bet, what with the aether flowin' so free.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A genuine, bona fide bleedin' masterpiece fashioned for the realm's greatest adventurer by her greatest livin'─hic!─blacksmith...[Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Genuine, bona fide bleedin' masterpieces fashioned for the realm's greatest adventurer by her greatest livin'─hic!─blacksmith...[Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Magnificent! Simply magnificent! You can almost feel herhis aetherial energies coursing through themit. What effect do you suppose this will have on the anima?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: So warm...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I feel at peace. I feel...myself. You would share your aether─the very essence of your being─to lend me strength?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Then I, for my part, shall do all in my power to lend you strength in turn, and together we shall explore the realm as comrades. That is, if you will have me...?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: So warm...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: At last I feel...myself. You would share your aether─the very essence of your being─to support me?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Then I, in turn, shall do all that I can to support you, going wheresoever you go, even unto the farthest reaches of the realm. If, that is, you will take me as your companion...?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename...? I take it the anima has spoken with you once again?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: That was a comparatively lengthy exchange, was it not? Far longer, certainly, than the scant whispers you described before. This is progress, my friend! Tangible progress! Should our young charge continue to develop at this rate, it may not be long before Gerolt and I can converse with it! At last, our goal of a freethinking weapon is within reach!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impressed, are ye? Well, the anima weapon's just the start. Feast yer eyes on this little beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: While Forename was off lookin' fer aether oil, I went fer a little wander and this thing found me─I mean, I found it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, seein' as there ain't much these Allagan contraptions can't do, I gave it a recipe for makin' spirits. And let me tell ye, the thing's got a real knack for─hic!─followin' instructions.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With a bit o' work, I reckon we could probably teach it how to make weapons what look like the anima weapon by the bleedin' dozen!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: They won't be real anima weapons, o' course, on account o' there bein' no spirit inside, but ye can be sure they'll still sell. And seein' as how ye helped me get here, I'll even let you have one half-price. Can't say fairer than that, eh?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Have you no decency!? We did not come here to fashion trinkets. We came here to imbue weapons with life! Life that should be respected!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Respectin' life don't come into it. I came here to pay off me debts, remember. An' if that means makin' a few trinkets, I'll bloody well make 'em. Like it or not, where there's muck, there's money, an' I mean to─hic!─take it.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <sigh> Drinking may have served to steady your arm, but I see your moral compass remains as wayward as ever. Plainly, there are limits to even alcohol's miraculous powers.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But let us set aside Gerolt's scheming for the present. Today marks an important malmstone in our collective journey─and in your journey especially, Forename. The bond you share with the anima is stronger than ever. Teach it well, and one day soon the world will look upon the brilliance of our anima weapon and wonder!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Today marks an important malmstone in our collective journey─and in your journey especially, Forename. You have successfully strengthened your bond with another anima. Teach it well, and one day soon the world will look upon the brilliance of our anima weapons and wonder!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your anima weapon is now hyperconductive, fortifying your bond with the spirit within!

quest.name: ふたりの称号
journal: Something seems to be giving Jalzahn pause.

Jalzahn is perplexed as to why such a priceless resource as the Book of Netherdark never came to light alongside the other Trials of the Braves. He wishes to learn more of the tome's origins for his own erudition, and asks that you accompany him to question Gerolt. Speak with the blacksmith, and help the alchemist solve this lingering mystery.

Upon consulting Gerolt, you learn that it was Jalzahn's ancient forefather who penned the Book of Netherdark. Moreover, you discover that the author left as his legacy the title of “Starforger” to the person who could succeed in fully recreating a legendary arm of yore. Gerolt and Jalzahn, both desirous of this, allow their pride to tear them apart. Speak with Jalzahn now, to discover if the matter has been resolved.

Unable to decide who should be crowned “Starforger,” Jalzahn has decided to remain in Hyrstmill until Gerolt gives up his claim. However, the alchemist can now continue to aid you with your arm should the need arise. With a fondness in his voice, Jalzahn bids you to go forth, and use your Zodiac Weapon for good and so create your own legend.
objectives: Speak with Gerolt.
Speak with Jalzahn.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: My dear, dear girlboy! Thanks to you, I have developed my soul infusion methodology and seen a legendary arm reborn in all its glory. For all this and more, you have my eternal gratitude.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I had devoted my life to just these two goals, yet neither could I have accomplished alone. Though I risked life and limb, verily 'twas right I should come to Eorzea.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: One matter puzzles me still, however: why was the Book of Netherdark─a priceless resource─never completed nor circulated?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: If I have learned anything by now, 'tis that Gerolt can shed some light on the matter. Come, my friend, let us make one last journey across the village green─for the sake of knowledge itself!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “The Vital Title,” you must be equipped with a Zodiac Weapon Zeta replica. Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur Zeta replica and Aegis Shield Zeta replica.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “The Vital Title,” you must be equipped with a Zodiac Weapon Zeta replica. Paladins must be equipped with both Excalibur Zeta replica and Aegis Shield Zeta replica.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Might be as I had one too many earlierlast night, but aren't we done with the Zodiac Weapons? Why is it ye keep houndin' me like a pair o' bloody debt collectors?

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: We have merely come with a question about the Book of Netherdark, Gerolt. Where did you lay hands upon this unfinished tome, pray tell?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Eh? Well, Rowena's place, o' course. I came across it while I was pickin' up the rest o' the Trials of the Braves.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Rowena said she'd only sell the tome to a collector what'd pay a king's ransom fer it─till I threatened to wed her again, that is. Well, ye can bet she handed it over in a hurry after that, hehe.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I-Is that so?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Er...anyroad, there's prints aplenty o' the Trials, but I've heard nothin' about another copy o' the Book of Netherdark. Like as not, that's why ye never saw it in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: See, the Trials is a load o' scattered tales about the ancient heroes gathered an' bound up in a book. 'Tis admired as a work o' fancy jus' as much as an account o' the ancients.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But this Book of Netherdark, well, it's jus' raw facts. Seems like it were added to the set after everythin' else, an' ye can tell that no editor's pen ever touched it. 'Tis really jus' a treatise on the Zodiac Braves.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: So we owe our gratitude to a scholar... Was there aught by which to identify the author? I would remember him, and so learn by his example.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hells, Jalzahn, I don't... Well, now that ye mention it, there is a name written here. Looks like “Ulthalam”...

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: “Ulthalam,” you say!? He was the father of my line─an artisan famed for his pursuit of knowledge!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be thrice damned! If the man's yer ancestor, might be as ye'd like to hear what I found scrawled at the back o' the book. Jus' a moment...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: After years of careful study, I come to realize that I, Ulthalam, cannot recreate an arm of the Zodiac Braves. I record mine own findings here, that men with like ambition may follow in my footsteps.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To the one who succeeds in bringing forth a weapon of the ancient heroes, I leave my eternal admiration, and the title of “Starforger,” bringer of radiance.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Gods be good! Though I knew it not, I have dreamed the same dream as my forefather! Everything, from my encounter with tales of the Braves to my choice of studies, must have been written in the stars!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: <sniff> In sooth, 'twas right that I journeyed countless malms and weathered stormy seas to come to Eorzea. Hearken to me, spirit of Ulthalam! Rest well, knowing that I, Jalzahn, accept the title of Starforger from you!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi! Hold on fer one soddin' second!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Might be as yer the one what came with the tale o' the legendary weapons, but who was it what made the bloody thing?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Me, that's who! An' who was it what found the Book of Netherdark!? Poor ol' unthanked Gerolt! The title is mine, fair an' square─even if there ain't a single gil in it.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: G-Gil!? The title cannot be measured, not even in gold, sir! 'Tis a priceless honor, granted by my ancestor to the one who fulfilled his dream─me!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: The title is mine by blood and merit both!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Like hells it is! Do ye know what a smithy does? We work a bit of our soul into each blade an' kettle we forge!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've sacrificed a good slice o' me own bleedin' life to the Zodiac Weapon, an' I ain't about to jus' let you walk away with the title!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: You insolent cur! I had thought you were but rough around the edges, but I see now that I was right about you from the start! You are the greatest boor in all the lands!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah! Ye bleedin' coot, yer jus' stubborn in yer ol' age! The title should go to someone what's got a future, an' if ye can't see that, then yer the biggest arse around!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can ye believe the bleedin' nerve o' that ol' coot!? The hells take him─an' leave the title fer me!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Whew... That encounter has quite sapped my strength─though not my sense of outrage. I can scarce believe that boor would not yield so much as an ilm!

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: I simply cannot abide the thought of Gerolt taking that title. I had thought to journey homewards, but now I see I must stay and make him listen to reason.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: There are far worse places to call home than Hyrstmill, I suppose. And I have, after all, developed a taste for Eorzean cuisine.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Of course, my continued tenure here would be all the better if you visited now and again. I should like to learn of your adventures, and would be happy to enhance your arm through the power of materia.

dialogue.name: JALZAHN
dialogue.text: Now, Forename, go forth with your Zodiac Weapon, and with it create your own legends!

obj.n: 鍋が薬鑵を黒いと言った

quest.name: 人造精霊は開花する
journal:
Ardashir is lost in thought.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

The bond between you and the anima is stronger than ever. Though its development hereafter is but a matter of course, Ardashir believes he can hasten the process. He proposes a short voyage to Idyllshire to meet with an acquaintance, one Ulan. A fellow researcher and enthusiast of Carbuncles, she has devoted her life to the study of arcane entities and methods by which they can be enhanced. He is all but certain her work is the key to unlocking the anima's potential. And with that, you are off to Idyllshire.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Please note this quest cannot be abandoned via the journal. If you wish to abandon the quest, you may do so at any time by speaking with Ardashir.

The focus of Ulan's research, as she tells it, is the use of crystal sand to promote growth in arcane constructs. Normally one must strike a proper balance of elements for the procedure to work, a process which may take weeks or even months. Thankfully, she realizes you are not one to waste time. To that end she suggests the use of umbrite, an umbral-aspected stone that can strip the elements from crystal sand, eliminating the need to finely attune its elemental properties. With that knowledge she bids you gather the crystal sand and umbrite necessary to foster the anima's development to your liking.

Ulan's plan is a success. With the crystal sand lacking any elemental aspects, the anima readily consumes it, reaching new heights of strength. Both you and Ulan are impressed by the results, even more so when the anima insists on consuming greater quantities of the treated crystal sand. Though it is not without risk, Ardashir consents to the request, stating the anima is free to make its own choices. He suspects this will also require a new weapon better suited to the anima's burgeoning strength. As a preemptive measure, he returns to Azys Lla to make preparations with Gerolt. His suspicions are soon confirmed when, after several applications of crystal sand, the anima appears before you whimpering and in pain. Ulan bids you meet with Ardashir and see what can be done to help.

You arrive at Azys Lla to find Ardashir and Gerolt ready with a freshly forged weapon to house the anima's soulstone. After verifying the stone is still in one piece, they carefully transplant it into a new vessel. You raise the weapon high, admiring its beauty, when suddenly the anima appears before you. And at last, after years of research and countless failures, Ardashir is able to behold the anima in all its splendor. His dream finally realized, the fledgling researcher must now set his sights higher in his pursuits of cultivating artificial life.

※ The attributes of the anima weapon can be reallocated by speaking with Ulan in Idyllshire.
