With Hyperconductive Almace and Hyperconductive AncileHyperconductive VerethragnaHyperconductive UkonvasaraHyperconductive RhongomiantHyperconductive GandivaHyperconductive MajestasHyperconductive HvergelmirHyperconductive DraconomiconHyperconductive TetrabiblosHyperconductive KannagiHyperconductive ArmageddonHyperconductive NothungHyperconductive Deneb equipped, speak with Ulan to strengthen the anima.

With Hyperconductive Almace and Hyperconductive AncileHyperconductive VerethragnaHyperconductive UkonvasaraHyperconductive RhongomiantHyperconductive GandivaHyperconductive MajestasHyperconductive HvergelmirHyperconductive DraconomiconHyperconductive TetrabiblosHyperconductive KannagiHyperconductive ArmageddonHyperconductive NothungHyperconductive Deneb in your inventory, speak with Ardashir in Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “A Dream Fulfilled,” you will receive an anima weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure that you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “A Dream Fulfilled,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “A Dream Fulfilled,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Save yer breath lasslad. He's been sittin' there broodin' ever since ye left. “Surely,” I said. “Surely, if we just leave herhim be, swingin' the weapon about as shehe please, the anima'll grow on its own.”

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course there's no satisfyin' him. I dunno what's stirrin' in that loaf o' his, but I wish he'd pay a mind to stirrin's elsewhere. The boy could use a distraction. Hells, I could make use of a nice buxom distraction meself.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: For the last time, please do not speak of such things! Not everyone shares your deplorable appetites.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <sigh> But what you say of the anima weapon is true. In its hyperconductive state, 'tis only a matter of time before the anima shows new signs of growth. Yet what sort of researcher would I be if I did not search for a way to hasten the process?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Always so serious. So the little lord's found a way to bugger us some more, eh?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Indeed I have, though it will require a trip to Idyllshire. My quest to find Sharlayan researchers there bore no fruit, but I did meet with a young lady whose field of expertise is quite similar to mine own.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Her name is Ulan. She has a vast knowledge of arcane entities, and specializes in the study of Carbuncles. In fact, her research concerns the enhancement of these entities with crystals. While not quite as freethinking as Forename's anima, they are of a similar nature. Perhaps enough for her work to be of use.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: When last we spoke, she sought an apprenticeship from the selfsame Sharlayan researchers who refused me an audience. No doubt they have left her waiting in Idyllshire even now.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Come, Forename. Let us be off before she finds reason to conduct her research elsewhere.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ready to enhance another fledgling anima, are we? I am sure Ulan would be only too happy to put her research to further use. In fact, I spoke with her not long ago regarding the prospects of another venture.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: No doubt she will insist on more supplementary literature as compensation for her efforts. Pray go on ahead to Idyllshire without me. I shall join you anon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The quest “A Dream Fulfilled” cannot be abandoned via your journal. If you wish to abandon the quest, you may do so at any time by speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: ARNOTT
dialogue.text: What business do you have with Lady Ulan?

dialogue.name: ARNOTT
dialogue.text: Ah, good day to you madamsir. Lady Ulan is expecting you.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: What have we here? An admirer of the arcane? A connoisseur of Carbuncles? I have none for sale, mind you, but I would be more than willing to tell you about─

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Ardashir? Pray forgive me, madamsir. Had I known you were an acquaintance of his... Ahem. Allow me to start anew.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Forename, was it? I am Ulan, researcher of all matters arcane. Pleasure to make your acquaintance. My luminous companion here is Diamond. Now exactly how did you come to know my dear Ardashir?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, it would appear I have come late. My apologies.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I see you and Forename have already met. SheHe has been of invaluable assistance in my research on anima.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: I see. Before you left Idyllshire you spoke of your preliminary proposal for the Sharlayans. I would very much like to hear how your work has progressed thus far.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: You wish to borrow my techniques for crystal absorption and apply them to your anima? An intriguing idea.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Though there still remains one rather large obstacle.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Arcane entities like Diamond here are comprised almost entirely of aether, which is why I believe that the aetherial energy of crystals can be harnessed to further their growth. This is the basis of my research.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: This can only be accomplished, however, using crystals with a combination of differing elemental aspects. All arcane beings are unique, and thus require a balance of crystals tailored to their composition. Even the slightest error can disrupt their aetherial equilibrium, possibly destroying them in the process.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: It is rather delicate work. To undertake such a project on your own could take weeks, even months without intimate knowledge of my research.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Unless... Perhaps we can help one another.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Being a researcher yourself, I have no doubt you understand my work requires a great deal of documentation, supplies, and more importantly, test subjects.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: I might be persuaded to select your anima as a test subject should you and your companion choose to assist me. Or if you would rather spend weeks poring over my notes...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: N-No, no. I think that is more than fair.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Then we are agreed. You will supply me with literature to supplement my research, and your assistant here will bring me supplies. Here is a list of what I require.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It seems we have our work cut out for us, friend. I shall return as quickly as I am able.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Was time together with me truly such an unpleasant proposition?

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Now where were we? Ah yes, supplies for my work. I will not burden you with all that I have listed there. Even one of those items would be a boon.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: In exchange I will offer you crystal sand, a reagent of my own creation that should help facilitate the absorption of crystal energies. The process will no doubt require a great deal of sand, but I will happily give all that you require.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Be warned, however, you cannot haphazardly apply the sand as you please. Hmmm... I believe a demonstration would sooner explain my point. Would you be so kind as to call forth this anima of yours?

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: My, what a splendid thing you are.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: You seem surprised that I can see it. Come now, Forename. I have devoted my life to the study of arcane creatures of all sorts. As Ardashir explained it, the two of you have gone to great lengths to come this far. That I should be unable to see it would be far more surprising.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Now, come closer, little one. I have a gift for you.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Forename, this woman...means us harm. I can feel myself...fading... We must flee!

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Forename, this woman...means us harm. My body, it...it fades... We must flee!

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: My apologies. I did not mean to frighten it. Though I must say, your anima is more perceptive than I supposed. As I said before, every arcane creature is unique, and requires a certain balance of elements to absorb crystal sand. This sand, however, is at odds with its composition.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Rather than waste time probing your anima to ascertain a proper balance of elements, I propose we treat the crystal sand with umbrite, stripping it of its elemental properties. This is by far the safest and quickest way to prepare the sand for consumption.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: As luck would have it, I found a merchant right here in Idyllshire who sells it. Hismena, I believe is her name. A single stone and pouch of crystal sand is all we need to begin.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Ah, before I forget. You will need to have the anima's vessel close at hand when offering up the crystal sand. You mustn't forget it.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: I suppose this will also be of use. For your purposes, let us call it an anima glass. It allows me to more closely observe the aetherial balance of my dear Diamond. It should allow you to do the same for your anima.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: That should do for explanations. If you should have any questions, you are more than welcome to ask. When you have all we require, return to me and we shall make the anima grow as never before!

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: There you are. I was beginning to think Ardashir's proposal was but a cruel jest.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: As before you will require an ample supply of both crystal sand and umbrite. When you have collected what we require we can begin.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Ah, and you must not forget the anima's vessel. I cannot do my work without it.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: You can examine the anima using this anima glass. I trust you remember how to use it, yes? In any case, should anything happen to it, Arnott will supply you with another. I look forward to seeing what becomes of this new anima.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When requesting Ulan's assistance in developing the anima, you must first speak with her while equipped with your hyperconductive anima weapon, then select “Foster the anima's growth.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: She will then take the crystal sand and umbrite to create treated crystal sand. This process can be repeated so long as you have the requisite items in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Treated crystal sand can be used to raise the five attributes associated with your anima as you see fit.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The five attributes associated with your anima are critical hit rate, direct hit rate, determination, tenacity, and skill speed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The five attributes associated with your anima are critical hit rate, direct hit rate, determination, piety, and spell speed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can review the items to be exchanged for crystal sand at any time by accessing Ulan's note in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Moreover, you can view the progress of your anima at any time by accessing the anima glass in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Before selecting “Recondition the Anima,” your hyperconductive anima weapon must be discarded or entrusted to a retainer.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: There is little I can do for you without the anima weapon. I should hope you did not forget it somewhere.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: There is little I can do for you without the anima weapon and that shield of yours present. I should hope you did not forget them somewhere.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What would you like to do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Foster the anima's growth.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Exchange items for crystal sand.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Ask about developing the anima.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you ask?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: How exactly do we help the anima grow?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Where can I obtain the supplies we need?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Before the anima can consume my crystal sand, it must first be stripped of its elemental aspects. This requires umbrite.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: When you acquire both the crystal sand and umbrite, return here with the anima's vessel in hand and we can begin.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When requesting Ulan's assistance in developing the anima, you must first speak with her while equipped with your hyperconductive anima weapon, then select “Foster the anima's growth.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: She will then take the crystal sand and umbrite to create treated crystal sand. This process can be repeated so long as you have the requisite items in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Treated crystal sand can be used to raise the five attributes associated with your anima as you see fit.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The five attributes associated with your anima are critical hit rate, direct hit rate, determination, tenacity, and skill speed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The five attributes associated with your anima are critical hit rate, direct hit rate, determination, piety, and spell speed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can view the progress of your anima at any time by accessing the anima glass in your inventory. Consider the balance of attributes carefully to create a weapon best suited to your needs.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: As I explained earlier, in addition to my crystal sand, we require umbrite that we may strip the sand of its elemental aspects.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: The sand I will offer to you in exchange for the supplies listed in the catalog I gave you.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: I should hope you have not lost track of it since last we spoke. If for any reason you did misplace it, however, I have prepared another copy just over there.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: The umbrite, I am afraid, will require bartering with Hismena of the House of Splendors. As a renowned collector of rarities, I can only imagine what she will ask for in exchange.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: After we begin the process of augmenting the anima, you will need a way to track its growth. That is when you use the anima glass. Speak with my assistant Arnott if you should require another.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: It would seem the anima has grown quite strong, would you not agree Arnott?

dialogue.name: ARNOTT
dialogue.text: That crystal sand no longer aligned to any one element could be so effective is unprecedented. The data we have collected should prove quite useful to your research.

dialogue.name: ARNOTT
dialogue.text: I cannot say for certain if this anima is stronger than the last. Still, its growth rate is incredible. The data we have collected should prove quite useful to your research.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I... I wish to continue.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: For your sake and mine, that you should never want for strength in times of strife. I must become stronger.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I... I wish to continue.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: For your sake and mine, that you should never want for strength in times of strife. I will become stronger.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: An ambitious one, your anima. That it should strive so fiercely to exceed its own limitations is quite remarkable. Not even Diamond Carbuncle demonstrated such tenacity. The bond between you two is one to be envied, for certain.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Again the anima aims to surpass its limits of its own volition. This is worthy of further investigation. Hmmm, perhaps another time.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> The documents you requested. <pant> As promised.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Ah, Ardashir. Your timing is impeccable. The crystal sand was as effective as we expected. However, it would seem your aetherial companion wishes to pursue greater strength despite reaching what I have calculated to be the apex of its power.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Doubtless you are aware of the potential repercussions should we grant this request. So, what say you? Shall we cast caution to the wind, and see to what new heights the anima can attain?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But of course. If it is the anima's wish, who are we to deny it? Though should we succeed, there is still the matter of its vessel─the weapon. I fear it will not bear the strain of any new powers the anima will possess.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I will consult with our smith to forge a new vessel. One better suited to the anima's burgeoning strength.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: It would seem my stay here in Idyllshire will be much more interesting than I anticipated. When you are ready to begin anew, you need but say the word.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: My body... It aches...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: My body... It aches...

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: It is as Ardashir predicted. Its vessel can no longer bear the power that now courses through it.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: You must hurry back to him with the anima. I will see to it he is apprised of the situation by the time you arrive.

dialogue.name: ARNOTT
dialogue.text: Should he have need to examine the anima more closely, give him the anima glass.

dialogue.name: ULAN
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Forename. I pray the anima will be all right.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must have the anima glass in your inventory to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with Arnott in Idyllshire in order to obtain another.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename, thank goodness! We must act quickly, there's no telling how much longer the soulstone will last.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I would have the anima glass, along with the blade and shield serving as its vessel.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I would have the anima glass and the weapon serving as its vessel.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As I feared, the anima's vessel has reached its limit. We must remove the soulstone at once.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The soulstone appears to be still intact.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ready the new weapon, Gerolt. The soulstone must be set before it begins to degrade.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The anima's got a lot o' spine for bein' one so small, I'll grant you that. This new weapon ought to make for a fine reward.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> It's...it's done, lasslad. Hold her up an' see how she feels.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The pinnacle o' craftsmanship, courtesy o' yours truly, and the nodes what taught me the ins an' outs of Allagan technology─[Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The pinnacle o' craftsmanship, courtesy o' yours truly, and the nodes what taught me a few tricks about Allagan technology─[Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: My body. It feels...so light! Is this the work of some arcane magick?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: My body. It feels...so light! What manner of arcane magick caused this?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: A new vessel, designed by Ardashir and forged by Gerolt.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Thank you, both of you.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Can it be...? After years of research, of trials and failures...I can see the anima. I can see the anima, and I can hear it speak! Oh, if only my master could be here to witness this.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Forename, Ardashir does not seem well. Perhaps he too requires a new vessel.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Yes, a mighty new vessel like your weapon. Let us ask the blacksmith Gerolt.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Yes, a stalwart new vessel like your sword and shield. Let us ask the blacksmith Gerolt.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Forename, Ardashir does not seem well. Perhaps he too requires a new vessel.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Yes, something powerful like your new weapon. Might we ask Gerolt to build one?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Yes, something resilient like your sword and shield. Might we ask Gerolt to build one?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Hahaha, it would appear you have developed a sense of humor to match your new body. Unfortunately, my aetherial friend, we can not exchange ours quite so easily. Though the weapon that houses your soulstone is indeed exquisite, I very much doubt Gerolt would grant me anything quite so elegant.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Oh, but look at me standing here, talking to you. Never have I felt such joy.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Oh, but it is I who should be thanking you, my aetherial friend. That we can finally converse after all this time...it fills my heart with joy.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Joy...?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You must be tired after such a long day. Rest─you have earned it.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This marks a monumental breakthrough in our work. Though it still appears to want for knowledge, our goal is all but realized!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And I can think of none better suited to teaching our young charge of the world and its wonders.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye. You see to it yer anima doesn't turn into a snivelin' little shite like his lordship here. One is plenty.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I imagine an arrogant, pigheaded clod would be equally undesirable.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ahem. As I said before, it has been a terribly long day not only for the anima, but for you as well. Rest easy, Forename. I will do all in my power to determine our next course of action by the time you return.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've gone an' done it now, lasslad. I know he's tryin' to keep his composure, but as soon as ye leave the boy'll be prancin' around singin' about the anima. I wouldn't count on him bein' ready to work again any time soon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: At least we've got nothin' to worry about so long as the anima is with ye. Take good care o' that weapon, ye hear?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Another smashing success! How fortunate are we to be blessed with yet another anima so fine? There is much I wish to do that I might further my work, but for now I pray you rest. When the time comes, we shall begin anew in earnest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The anima has reached beyond its limits, the weapon housing its soulstone forged anew!

quest.name: 人造精霊の未来
journal:
Ardashir is contemplating the present state of the anima.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Ardashir is seemingly satisfied with the results of his research thus far─so much so, that he soon plans to return to Radz–at–Han where he will present his findings. Gerolt, on the other hand, is baffled by this presumption, and wastes no time reprimanding him. Ardashir reluctantly accepts the truth─that their work is not yet complete─and soon offers a means to temporarily fortify the anima weapon. For his plan to work, however, it requires a ceruleum solution which he has commissioned from a skilled distiller in Idyllshire. While he begins other preparations for the anima weapon, he asks you to meet with this artisan, one Blamprest, in Idyllshire.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Blamprest assures you work on Ardashir's order is well underway. He has been delayed, however, by a need for singing clusters. Though difficult to acquire, he has entrusted the task to a pair of sisters─skilled mages who agreed to help...for a price. No sooner does he mention the pair than they appear before you seeking compensation for their work. Much to your surprise─and dismay─he tells them that you have eagerly agreed to pay for them in his stead. They have yet to explain how you must pay them, but as your only alternative is to bargain at Rowena's Center for Cultural Promotion, you steel yourself to undertake trials of unknown peril.

After subjecting yourself to the peculiar whims of Amphelice and Angelet, you at last deliver the singing clusters to Blamprest, who then crafts for you the elixir needed for the anima weapon's fortifying potion. With your work complete and the elixir in hand, he bids you safe travels back to Azys Lla.

You return to Azys Lla, elixir in hand. The second bottle you place on Ardashir's workbench, however, leaves him perplexed. When you explain to him it was an order for spirits placed by Gerolt, he then comes to a sudden and startling realization─Gerolt squandered a portion of the money lent to them by Rowena to make the purchase. Though he is furious, he cannot deny the strange yet beneficial effects of alcohol on Gerolt's work. After regaining his composure, he completes his potion, and sets Gerolt to work on fortifying the anima weapon. Much to their delight, Ardashir's plan was a success. Moreover, he goes on to show you an Allagan droid that may be the key to ensuring the anima's longevity, assuming it can be repaired.

※ The attributes of the anima weapon can be reallocated by speaking with Ulan in Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Future Proof,” you will receive an anima weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure that you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Future Proof,” you must be equipped with [Error] and [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Future Proof,” you must be equipped with [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Now that the anima can maintain a form seen even by those without your abilities, it is fair to say my research is all but complete. Our last task being to refine any abilities it has gained thus far.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Once that is finished, I shall return to Radz–at–Han and make ready to present my findings. I daresay our work here shall forever change the study of arcane summoning as we know it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hells are you on about, boy? Now I understand bein' excited, what with us finally seein' the anima an' all, but I think yer losin' sight o' what our work is all about.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Preposterous! The goal of my work was to create a sentient being capable of independent thought, which could then serve to help others.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That right? An' ye really think ye've accomplished that? Bollocks! Ain't no way somethin' what's grown that much, that fast, can be in any kind o' stable condition.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've poked an' prodded the damn thing more times than I'd care to count, an' by the grace o' Rhalgr we've somehow managed not to mess things up. But tell me this: what happens when we're not around when a new weapon needs smithin', hm?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll tell ye what─it'll grow too big for its aetherial britches and keel over. What the anima needs now is a body what'll handle it no matter how strong it gets. Until we can figure that, yer work amounts to naught but piss in a kettle if ye ask me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, but what do I know. I'm just a know-nothin' sot with a hammer. No doubt a refined, scholarly lad such as yerself has already considered such complications.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Hmph! The only thing more insufferable than a drunkard...is when he is right. I was so blinded by its radiance, I did not stop to consider the future, putting my own desires before the needs of the anima.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, well, there'll be plenty o' time fer mopin' after we've finished, and I'm free from that witch Rowena. Fer now, we need to think up a way to give the anima a new, permanent home.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The weapon holdin' it now should be fine fer the time bein'. You just keep an eye on the anima while we figure out the rest.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Actually, I may already have a solution─albeit an interim one─thanks in part to Ulan and her studies.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We were working on a potion of sorts to fortify the anima weapon, that it might abide further growth. The difficulty proved in our need for ceruleum. It would need to be distilled to serve our purposes, and we simply had not the means to do so.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As fortune would have it, though, we caught word of a renowned distiller recently come to Idyllshire and immediately sought him out. After making our case he was all too happy to assist. Blamprest is his name. Would you pay him a visit and see how things are coming along?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There are other preparations to be made, of course, but Gerolt and I will see to them. Everything should be in order upon your return.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Blamprest, eh? That gives me an idea...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Prepared to enhance yet another anima, are we? There is still much to be done before we can craft a new soulstone and weapon, mind you, but for now another potion should ensure its safety until we are ready.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: For that, we will need to commission more distilled ceruleum from Blamprest.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have already placed an order for another bottle, so while we see to things here, I would have you go and speak with him. There is naught we can do for the anima without it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, and you tell Blamprest we'll settle fer nothin' less than his very best, ye hear?

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Welcome, friend. What can I do for you?

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: An order for whom? Oh, yes. That scholarly fellow. Ardashir, was it? Work on his order is well underway.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Working with ceruleum is no easy task, though. Distilling a substance so volatile demands a substantial concentration of aether, the only source potent enough being singing clusters. Quite the rarity, you know. And for an order like this, why, it would require fifty at the very least.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Procuring such oddities is beyond my abilities, but I have enlisted the aid of two fine young mages to see the job done. If only the price of their services was not so steep...

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: (-Brusque Businesswoman-)There you are. We've brought what you asked for. I trust you're prepared to hold up your end of the deal?

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: My, what fortuitous timing! This young ladygentleman here was just telling me how shehe would love nothing more than to offer you herhis services in my stead.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Ahem. These are the two lovely ladies I was telling you about, remember? The ones collecting the singing clusters you require?

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Pleasure to make your acquaintance. My name is Amphelice, and this is my sister, Angelet.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: I will keep matters brief. Blamprest agreed to undertake certain...tasks, in exchange for our help. If you would serve in his place, we will compensate you with the clusters you seek. Agreed?

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Splendid. Now that that's settled, I'll leave you to it. When you have what we need, come back and I shall see about distilling that elixir.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Ah, that reminds me. A merchant in Rowena's employ deals in singing clusters. I believe it was Hismena? Their names all sound alike. At any rate, if you find their tasks to be too much trouble, you can always try striking a deal with her.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Ah, well if it isn't my favorite customer. Come for another bottle of distilled ceruleum?

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Then I shall be expecting more stories in exchange for our clusters.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: As before, you'll need fifty in total. Any less and I cannot guarantee the quality of my work. When you have done all they require of you, return to me with the clusters. Everything should be ready by then.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Of course, if you feel their tasks are too demanding, you can always try haggling with Hismena. No doubt she would welcome the opportunity for more business.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A repeatable quest is now available from both Amphelice and Angelet.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By completing either of these repeatable quests, you will obtain singing clusters which can then be offered to Blamprest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Singing clusters may also be purchased from Hismena at Rowena's Center for Cultural Promotion.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Sorry, friend, but there's naught I can do without singing clusters.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Whether you acquire them through Amphelice and her sister, or by bargaining with Hismena, I shall leave that decision to you.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Judging by that smile I take it you have the clusters I require?

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, this will do nicely. Wait here just a moment.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: There we are. One order of distilled ceruleum. Before you go, though, I must ask: if you work with Ardashir, you must also know Gerolt, correct? He placed an order for a bottle of my finest ale. Now that we're finished with Ardashir's commission, I'd like to take care of his, if that's all right with you.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Haha, you needn't worry about compensation, friend. He paid in advance. I only ask that you take his package with you.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: It's been so long since he's come to see me. I was beginning to worry the moneylenders had finally done for him, or worse─he'd taken to a life of sobriety! In any event, I'm glad he seems back to his old self. Take care, and give them my regards.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: There we are. Ardashir will be quite pleased, as I'm sure Gerolt will be as well.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: Give them my best, and tell Gerolt I'm glad to see he's back to his old ways.

dialogue.name: BLAMPREST
dialogue.text: I imagine I will be staying here in Idyllshire for quite some time. If Ardashir should need more ceruleum, or Gerolt his spirits, you know where to find me.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. We have accomplished much while you were away. In fact, I am quite close to a more permanent solution to our troubles.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But first, let us do what we can to fortify the anima's current vessel. Might I have a look at the sword and shield in question? Oh, and the distilled ceruleum, of course.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But first, let us do what we can to fortify the anima's current vessel. Might I have a look at the weapon in question? Oh, and the distilled ceruleum, of course.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Right, then. Now to prepare the potion.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: ...Forename, why exactly did Blamprest prepare two bottles? Are they to be mixed together?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Gerolt ordered a bottle of ale? If he had money to spend, he would be carousing in some filthy tavern, not here working off his debts. The only way he could afford that would be...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Our funding! You selfish, beef-witted maltworm! You squandered our funds from Rowena on spirits!?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Aye, that I did. Consider it payment owed fer remindin' you about bein' selfish yerself, all that blitherin' about bein' done with the anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Another bottle of ale!? By the gods, how am I to explain this to Rowena?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Don't give me that look. Ye know I can't do me best work without me muse. Now hurry up with that potion. Forename's weapon ain't gonna hammer itself.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You truly are insufferable! When this is over you shall learn there are consequences for misspending others' money. Rowena's money.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Honestly, Gerolt, why could you not learn to forge weapons like an ordinary man. A sober man...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <sigh> Calm yourself, Ardashir. There is work to be done.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There, the potion is done. All that remains is applying it to the anima weapon.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I leave the rest to you.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine piece o' work, if I do say so meself.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A weapon made sharp with a brew o' pure ceruleum. Hm, I like the sound o' that─[Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A sword an' shield made sharp with a brew o' pure ceruleum. Hm, I like the sound o' that─[Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I feel a new strength welling within me. Does this mean, perhaps, I am reaching my full potential?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I feel a new strength shines brightly within me. Could this mean, perhaps, I am reaching my full potential?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You're almost there.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I think you still have room to improve.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: You think so? Truly? I shall do my best not to disappoint you.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: You really think so? Then I must do all I can not to disappoint you.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. I shall redouble my efforts to someday meet your expectations.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. I was too hasty to hope for so much, so soon. I will do my best to meet your expectations.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I cannot read your thoughts, but I think your silence makes the answer quite clear.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I will become stronger, Forename. Together we shall see what I am capable of.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Would that I could read your thoughts... Still, your silence tells me much.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I will become stronger, Forename. Together we shall discover my true potential.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: 'Tis good to see our work was a success. The anima seems stronger than before, yet its vessel remains sound.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. Speaking of the vessel, I must tell you of our soon-to-be permanent solution to handling the anima's growth!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We will forge not just a new weapon, but a new soulstone to house its essence.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In my quest to find a means to do so, I happened upon something quite interesting. Wait here a moment.

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Initializing synthesis protocols... Please insert materials.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What do you think? This Allagan droid was no doubt used for work requiring precision beyond what any man is capable of. Used being the operative word. Try as I might, whenever I initiate its production sequence...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Internal error. Unable to process.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <sigh> The system crashes...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It will take time, but mark my words: I shall repair this Allagan device.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Once repaired, I am confident I can fashion a new soulstone for the anima to last a thousand lifetimes.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And to my surprise, Gerolt has already taken the initiative to start work on a new weapon, one befitting the new heights to which our aetherial companion might climb. Rest assured we will contact you when preparations are complete.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Until next time, friend.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Another anima made safe. For now, at least. I look forward to the day it resides safely in its new vessel. I trust you will take good care of it until then.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your anima weapon has been sharpened, serving to harness the burgeoning strength within!
