quest.name: アンフェリスのお願い
journal: Amphelice looks ready for business.

No sooner do you nod your head in consent than Amphelice proceeds straight to the heart of the matter. You will only receive the singing clusters upon completing and presenting to her three deftly written tales of daring and adventure. Being no stranger to danger, and knowing where to find it, you set out to find inspiration for your writing.

※The key item can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.

You emerge from battle, your mind swimming with scenes of battle to chronicle in your journal. It takes you no time at all to compose your first masterpiece, but your work is not yet complete. To that end, you set out in search for your next story.

※The key item can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.

Though weary from battle, you lay down your arms to pick up a pen and record your most recent battle in painstaking detail. Your second story is complete. With only one tale of adventure left to write, you make haste to another place that danger might call home.

※The key item can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.

The battle was fierce, a dance of blades where death was all but promised. Yet you prove victorious, and duly inspired. With a flourish of your pen you write what could only be your magnum opus, completing the set of three stories promised to Amphelice. Heading to Idyllshire, you wonder if she will consider your work worthy of the singing clusters.

Amphelice pores over your work and is almost at a loss for words. More than impressed with your work, she explains that she is a writer sorely in need of new ideas for her poetry. Or rather, she was in need of new ideas. Your stories have set her mind to racing, and she is only too happy to reward you with singing clusters.

※This repeatable quest can be undertaken once weekly. Upon completing the quest, it will become available again the following [Reset]SundayMondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFridaySaturday at 12345678910111212 p.m.a.m. (Earth time).
objectives: Obtain volume one of An Adventurer's Life by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.
Obtain volume two of An Adventurer's Life by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.
Obtain volume three of An Adventurer's Life by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.
Deliver the three volumes of An Adventurer's Life to Amphelice in Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: You are prepared to work, then?

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Good. Very good. Now, if you are an adventurer of any merit or distinction, what I would ask of you is simple: a recounting of your travels, of your most spine-tingling, exhilarating battles. Only then shall you have your reward.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: But a single tale would scarcely be enough to even whet one's appetite, don't you think? That is why I must insist you write me three. Three gripping tales of derring-do, and the singing clusters are yours.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: I can only hope your skill with a pen matches that with a weapon.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Come for more singing clusters, I see. I am only too happy to oblige. That is, of course, provided you have more tales to share.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: As before, bring me three suspenseful stories of your adventures and the clusters are yours. I am very much looking forward to your work.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The key item An Adventurer's Life can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: I very much doubt your stories will write themselves while you stand about here. If you would have the singing clusters, I suggest you hurry and place pen to paper.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The key item An Adventurer's Life can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Leveling.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: And so the hero returns. With a set of enthralling stories, I should hope.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Oh my! Such carnage, such havoc... I can practically hear the screams of agony and despair from your enemies, cursing your name with their last breaths. Yes, this shall do quite nicely to set my creative juices to percolating.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: I am an artist, you see. A writer with a passion for poetry of the unexpected sort. While most prefer rhymes of light and love, I live for the dark and desolate, as do my readers. Whether to frighten themselves or their friends, it matters not. I find there is no greater joy than to see a man turn pale with horror upon reading my words.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: My first collection of poems was a smashing success, and so I immediately set to work on my next volume. Yet I found my writing lacked a certain spark. A barbarity that could only come from one who's experienced the butchery of true combat.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, however, my mind is now racing with thoughts of slaughter and mayhem. As promised, the singing clusters are yours. If you should need more, I would gladly accept another trilogy of terrifying tales.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: Marvelous. Simply marvelous. The first page alone has me quivering with anticipation. Here you are, my deargood sir. The singing clusters, as promised.

dialogue.name: AMPHELICE
dialogue.text: They say that artists must be sacrificed to their art, but today it is not I, but the fiends felled by your hand placed upon the altar. Now their pain and misery shall live on in my poetry for all time!

quest.name: アンジェレトのお願い
journal: Angelet looks at you expectantly.

You speak with Angelet, who makes a seemingly innocent request─with her magicked cloth in hand, she asks you to relive the fiercest battles of your past. The only condition, however, is that you do so at the scene of battle, as that is the only way to quicken the magicks of her fabric. Though the locales she insists upon are likely still teeming with danger, you are not one to balk at a challenge. And so you make haste to the sites of your past adventures.

※The key item can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Level 50/60/70/80 Dungeons.

Your stroll down memory lane was fraught with peril, but both you and Angelet's magicked cloth remain none the worse for wear, and surprisingly no different. Which seems peculiar since, according to Angelet, there should be some discernible difference in the cloth. Perhaps she can explain what, if any, change has taken place.

Angelet is beaming with excitement upon your return, and the reason for her elation gives you pause. As she explains it, her profession is the crafting of dolls using cursed materials. What was once an ostensibly normal bolt of fabric is now replete with the pain and suffering of your fallen enemies. As promised, she bequeaths to you the singing cluster you desire. In the event you cross paths with her again, you remind yourself not to ask after her merchandise.

※This repeatable quest can be undertaken once daily. Upon completing the quest, it will become available again the following day at [Reset]12345678910111212 p.m.a.m. (Earth time).
objectives: Obtain the cloth of disturbing memories by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Level 50/60/70/80 Dungeons.
Deliver the cloth of disturbing memories to Angelet in Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Have you come to help me? I'll gladly pay you with a singing cluster if you do. I promise.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: You will? Yay! Blamprest is so mean, isn't he? Forcing his work on others. But a brave adventurer like you should have no trouble with this task.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: My work requires the use of a very special fabric. I weave it myself, but before I can use it I need someone else to rouse the magicks sleeping inside. That's where you come in! I want to use the memories of your toughest battles to wake it up.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: But you can't do it in just any old place or it won't work. You'll have to take my fabric to where the fighting happened, so the memories are fresh in your mind. Now be careful, and try not to get it dirty.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The key item cloth of disturbing memories can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Level 50/60/70/80 Dungeons.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Ah, you're back! Come for another singing cluster? Or perhaps you fancy one of my dolls? Haha, I only jest.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Just like before, I'll need you to take this cloth and relive some of your past battles.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: I trust you can recall something truly gruesome? The bloodier the better, I always say. Their suffering makes my poppets look ever so pretty. Tee hee!

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Please, missmister, I can't finish my work without that cloth, and the magicks inside will never wake up if you're standing around here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The key item cloth of disturbing memories can be obtained by clearing a dungeon via Duty Roulette: Level 50/60/70/80 Dungeons.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: You're back! I was beginning to worry something awful had happened. How did you fare? Has the cloth changed at all?

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Don't be so mean. I had hoped you were different from the others. Always begging for help, yet never willing to offer it in return...

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Oh, it's perfect! I knew you could do it. Thank you, thank you!

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: Would you look at this. The texture is smooth with agony, the colors rich with hopelessness. It practically drips with the resentment of all the people you've slain.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: You see, I make poppets for a living, and my materials must be cursed before I can work. A curse on its own is only wishful thinking, but with a little death, misery, and a touch of magic, my dolls can become so much more. They will look so pretty dressed with this beshrewed fabric. Such tricks they will play.

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: I must say, the people you killed must have been really, really sad when they died. I've never had material so stained, so powerful... These will be my loveliest poppets ever!

dialogue.name: ANGELET
dialogue.text: As promised, the singing cluster is yours. Perhaps next time I'll include a poppet as thanks. Would you like that? Tee hee!

quest.name: 人造精霊は咲き誇る
journal:
Ardashir seems eager to tell you something.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Ardashir has good news to share with you─work on the processing node vital to his work is nearly complete. His elation is soon dampened, however, when Gerolt rebukes him for not lifting a finger to help. The young scholar soon insists on doing his fair share of the work, but never fear─there is plenty to go around. Ardashir wastes no time in splitting up his duties, tasking you with obtaining three oddities needed to forge the new anima weapon: a rare gemstone from Amdapor, a magicked doll from the Great Gubal Library, and molten rock from Sohm Al.
Braving the perils of Eorzea's darkest dungeons you emerge unscathed, and three rarities richer for the experience. You can only hope Ardashir will have completed his tasks by the time you get back.

You arrive in Azys Lla to find the processing node is fully operational. Not wanting to waste time, Ardashir insists Gerolt ignore his thirst for ale and begin work on the weapon. Meanwhile, he would have you activate the now-functioning node.

The node springs to life with a buzz and a whir, ready to fashion you a soulstone. Assuming you have the required materials, of course. When you are finished with the processing node, Ardashir asks that you activate the verification node in preparation for the anima's transfer.

Moving the anima to a new soulstone will incur great risk, as there is a chance the fledgling spirit will dissipate into the aether before the process is complete. After extensive research, however, Ardashir has discovered the means to ensure the anima's safety: increasing its aetheric density. As he explains it, the anima weapon's recent treatment of ceruleum has enhanced its aether-absorbing abilities, making now the opportune time to carry out his plan. He furnishes you with a monitoring device, and bids you continue your routine acts of heroism. When the anima has absorbed sufficient levels of aether, his most recent discovery─the verification node─will analyze the anima weapon and determine your chances of success. Ardashir is not one to gamble, however, and says he will not be satisfied until failure is a mathematical improbability.

※Should you misplace the anima glass, you may obtain a new one by speaking with Ardashir at Azys Lla.

You traverse the realm to fortify the anima through feats of heroism both great and small, from saving cats trapped on cold stone rooves to slaying beasts sent from the void. Confident that the anima is ready, you return to Azys Lla to have the anima weapon examined. The verification node begins its analysis, and after what seems an eternity, you are pleased to hear the chance of failure is nigh on impossible. All that remains is carrying out the transfer.

His plans have been perfect, his calculations impeccable, yet Ardashir cannot dismiss his impending sense of dread. His doubts are soon cast aside, however, when Gerolt surprises him with a few choice words reminiscent of encouragement. Duly inspired, they set to work, and it is not long before the anima is placed securely in its new soulstone and weapon...or so they think. You hold your freshly forged weapon aloft, but when you call forth the anima, the lack of response gives you pause. Just when Ardashir had begun to lose hope, the anima appears from a blinding flash of light, regaling you with talk of an otherworldly experience. The anima is safe, now and forevermore. But Ardashir mentions he has one last order of business to discuss with you. Whatever could it be?

※ The attributes of the anima weapon can be reallocated by speaking with Ulan in Idyllshire.
objectives: With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir equipped or in your inventory, obtain a magicked bauble from the Lost City of Amdapor (Hard).

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir equipped or in your inventory, obtain an ancient magicked poppet from the Great Gubal Library (Hard).

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir equipped or in your inventory, obtain spectral magma from Sohm Al (Hard).

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir equipped or in your inventory, deliver the forging materials to Gerolt in Azys Lla.

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir equipped or in your inventory, activate the processing node.

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir in your inventory, access the verification node.

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir equipped or in your inventory, access the verification node.

With Sharpened Sword of the Twin Thegns and Sharpened Shield of the Twin ThegnsSharpened Sultan's FistsSharpened Axe of the Blood EmperorSharpened Trident of the OverlordSharpened Bow of the AutarchSharpened Cane of the White TsarSharpened Rod of the Black KhanSharpened Book of the Mad QueenSharpened Word of the MagnateSharpened Spurs of the Thorn PrinceSharpened Flame of the DynastSharpened Guillotine of the TyrantSharpened Sphere of the Last Heir in your inventory, deliver the newborn soulstone to Gerolt in Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Born Again Anima,” you will receive an anima weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure that you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Born Again Anima,” you must be equipped with [Error] and [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Born Again Anima,” you must be equipped with [Error].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Ardashir again.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename! You come at a most opportune time, my friend. Repairs on the processing node are nearly complete.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: A pity, though, that such repairs are beyond my field of expertise. I have had no choice but to call on Gerolt for assistance.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph. An' when's the last time them dainty little hands o' yers touched a hammer? How about givin' credit where it's due for a change, eh? Or better yet, do some bloody work yerself!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What we do here calls for more than mere brawn. Though if truth be told, I have not the time to study the literature pertinent to such repairs.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Very well. If there is more work to be done, I shall see to it personally. It will not be said that Ardashir Balyk stood idly by while some toper fulfilled duties in his stead.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: You don't half have a mouth on ye, do ye? Alright, then. How about fetchin' me them materials for that new weapon ye asked for. And take Forename with ye. Not that I don't trust ye, mind. It's just too much work for one.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If you would insist shehe accompany me, then so be it.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ahem. Right then. Forename, there is work to be done.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I would have you handle the more, shall we say, exotic items he has requested─a rare gemstone from Amdapor, a magicked doll from the Great Gubal Library, and molten rock from Sohm Al.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Strange to think such a haphazard collection of items can be forged into a weapon. Then again, I once doubted the favorable effects of alcohol on his smithing.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: At any rate, I shall see to the remaining three oddities on his list. Hopefully I will not keep you waiting too long.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Eager to make safe another anima, I see. Well, let us split up the work that we might hasten the process.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As before, I would ask you procure the more obscure items Gerolt requires─a rare gemstone from Amdapor, a magicked doll from the Great Gubal Library, and molten rock from Sohm Al.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Revisiting these locales should prove no problem for one of your talents.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I, for my part, shall see to the remaining three oddities on his list. Hopefully I will not keep you waiting too long.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The quest “Born Again Anima” cannot be abandoned via your journal. If you wish to abandon the quest, you may do so at any time by speaking with Ardashir.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There you are. Did ye bring what I asked for?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Then what are ye dawdlin' about here for? Ye don't want that snotty scholar to beat ye back here, do ye? Now, go on, off with ye.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Good work, lasslad, and none the worse for wear. Which is more than can I say for His Highness here.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Hmph. If you have time to waste on insults, then I take it we may assume work on the processing node is finished?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Repairs like that I can do with me eyes closed. Finished 'em ages ago─just been waitin' for you two to show up.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excellent. At last, we can commence our work on the new soulstone.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I trust I can count on you for assistance once more?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Looks like ye'll be busy with yer toys for a bit. In that case, reckon I'll go put back a few.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Gerolt. I will not begrudge you a drink or two, as is your wont. Just promise me that the work will be done. With all the materials at hand, you could perform such a trifling task with your eyes closed, no?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <grumble> Cheeky little... Fine. But ye'd best hurry along with the soulstone, ye hear?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Now, then. Let me explain our next course of action.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: First and foremost, I will need your help with creating the new soulstone.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It is a rather involved process, but with your help I have no doubt everything will proceed swimmingly.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Once finished, we will also need to ensure the anima is duly prepared for the transfer. Though not a complex procedure, it is without question the most vital. My most recent discovery─an aetheric verification device─should prove quite useful here.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But further explanations regarding that can wait until later. When you are ready to begin work on the soulstone, pray activate the processing node.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Mighty fast work there, Forename. Wouldn't expect anythin' less.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I too managed to return in record time.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And now that you are here, let us begin work on the new soulstone.

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Initializing... Please set desired parameters.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well, well, it works. Give me a moment while I ready the node.

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Initializing... Please set desired parameters.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Sorry to keep you waiting. Now, let me ready the node.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There. All we require now are materials for the soulstone's creation. And for that, I turn to your unrivaled talent for procurement.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Now, now. If we are to preserve the anima, we cannot falter now.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: After all, there is yet another crucial step to be taken before the soulstone is complete.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: For that, we will require the verification node.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But let us not get ahead of ourselves; there is still much to do. You need not concern yourself with this device until we are finished with the processing node.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There we are. We need but gather the requisite materials and we shall have another soulstone. I trust you will have no difficulty in obtaining more pneumite?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Of course, there is also the matter of the anima's aetheric density, but we need not get ahead of ourselves. Pray activate the verification node when you are ready to examine the anima.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can now accept the quest “Some Assembly Required” from the processing node.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To continue progression in the quest “Born Again Anima,” you must complete the quest “Some Assembly Required” to obtain a new soulstone.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To continue progression in the quest “Born Again Anima,” you must complete the quest “Some Assembly Required” to obtain a new soulstone.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Please present specimen for analysis.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: So, Forename, what do you think? As fortune would have it, I happened upon this node when searching for salvageable materials to repair the processing node.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It has the ability to analyze the aetherial composition of any object placed before it─a function crucial to our work.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In order to transfer the anima's essence to the new soulstone, we must first sever the link to its present vessel. But this is not without incredible risk.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: For you see, in the instant it becomes unbound, there is a danger that it will dissipate into the aether. Its life would be extinguished in the blink of an eye.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: After much research into the manipulation of aether, I learned of the means to preserve the anima long enough to complete the process─aetheric condensation. The anima is, after all, a creature composed entirely of condensed aether. If it were to be condensed further, it should prove robust enough to survive the transfer.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Thanks to the anima weapon's treatment of ceruleum, I daresay its ability to absorb naturally occurring aether─thereby increasing the anima's density─is heightened. 'Tis only a matter of reaching levels needed for our purposes.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To that end, I would ask that you resume your feats of derring-do, and monitor the anima with this device. It should indicate when the anima has reached sufficient density levels based on my estimates.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: When the anima is ready, return here and place its vessel in the verification node. I have programmed it to run a simulation of the transfer process based on the anima's density.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: When the verification node has confirmed the chance of failure is all but eliminated, we can proceed to the next phase of our plan.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Good. You are ready, then. As before, you will need to increase the anima's aetheric density.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Here. You will need a new anima glass to monitor its progress.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: When the anima is sufficiently condensed, bring it back for analysis.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Completing certain activities while equipped with your anima weapon will increase its aetheric density.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Completing certain activities while equipped with your anima weapon and shield will increase their aetheric density.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that aetheric density cannot be increased when their durability is zero.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that aetheric density cannot be increased when its durability is zero.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By using the anima glass, it is possible to visually verify your progress.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<beep> Analyzing... Beginning simulation...
Insufficient density levels. <beep> Chance of failure estimated at 75%.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<beep> Analyzing... Beginning simulation...
Insufficient density levels. <beep> Chance of failure estimated at 62.5%.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<beep> Analyzing... Beginning simulation...
Density levels reaching acceptable parameters. <beep> Chance of failure estimated at 37.5%.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<beep> Analyzing... Beginning simulation...
Density levels reaching acceptable parameters. <beep> Chance of failure estimated at 12.5%.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Completing certain activities while equipped with your anima weapon will increase its aetheric density level.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Completing certain activities while equipped with your anima weapon and shield will increase their aetheric density levels.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that aetheric density cannot be increased when their durability is zero.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that aetheric density cannot be increased when its durability is zero.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By using the anima glass, it is possible to visually verify your progress.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEMT
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Please present specimen for analysis.

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEMT
dialogue.text: Analyzing... Beginning simulation...

dialogue.name: CERTIFYSYSTEMT
dialogue.text: Aetheric density exceeds prescribed parameters. <beep> Chance of failure estimated at 0.0000001%.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excellent! With readings like this, our work should be but a matter of course.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Take the anima weapon and the soulstone to Gerolt. At last we shall move the anima to its new, permanent vessel.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: All that remains is to complete work on the soulstone. Soon, my friend. Soon the anima will be safe, now and forevermore!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to create a newborn soulstone, use the processing node and complete the quest “Some Assembly Required.”

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Finish the soulstone? Let's have it, then. The weapon too.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What are you botherin' me for, then? Hurry up with that bloody soulstone!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Finish the soulstone? Let's have it, then. The weapon too.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What are you botherin' me for, then? Hurry up with that bloody soulstone!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to create a newborn soulstone, use the processing node and complete the quest “Some Assembly Required.”

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: You lost the anima glass? For the love o'... Go an' get another from Ardashir.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deleted

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deleted

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, let's get to it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, Ardashir!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You needn't yell─I can hear just fine. I just...I just needed a moment.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A moment? What the hells for? An' what's with the gloom all a sudden?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Wait a second. Ye ain't scared, are ye?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Scared? Scared?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I am absolutely terrified! What if something should go wrong!? Years of hard work and research would be squandered. More importantly, an innocent new life would be lost. I could never forgive myself should the unthinkable befall the anima.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So that's it, then? Ye just plan to run, with nothin' to show but a trail o' piss on yer way home? After all ye've done to get this far!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' what about Forename? SheHe fought to the seventh hell an' back to get the anima ready for this.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' me! Ye've held me hostage here hammerin' new weapons day after day, an' this one's me best yet. You'd be denyin' the world a masterpiece what puts all other smiths to shame.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' sure, ye might be a self-servin', preenin' little gobshite, but I've seen me fair share o' scholars, an' yer the cleverest little gobshite I've ever met. Should go without sayin' the soulstone ye made is perfect, so why get so bothered over nothin'?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Gerolt... I...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ahem. As you say, we have no reason to be concerned.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Let us begin by transferring the anima to the new soulstone.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I will require the anima glass, if you would be so kind.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: 'Tis done. Quickly now, Gerolt. The anima will not last long. Set the soulstone!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: How d'ye like that... The pinnacle o' perfection, forged from blood, sweat, an' tears!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And it is all yours, Forename. You have more than earned it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Aettir an' Priwen. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore these beauties!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Nyepels. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore these beauties!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Minos. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Areadbhar. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Terpander. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Sindri. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Kaladanda. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Mimesis. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Anabasis. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Sandungs. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore these beauties!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Cronus. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Deathlocke. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on Canopus. The gods 'emselves'd weep afore this beauty!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I should hope the anima is as pleased as we are. Care to summon it forth, Forename?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But where is the anima? Does it not answer your call?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: No, it cannot be! Did it...did it not survive the transfer!?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Good eveningGood morningGood day to you, Forename! Is something the matter? You seem concerned.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Oh, how wondrous it was! A great power welled up within me, the likes of which I had never felt before. For a fleeting moment, I was drifting, and then there was a burst of color and light...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: So warm, so comforting was the glow that I could feel myself nodding off to sleep. But then I heard your voice, and I woke with a start.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I've never felt so alive... It's as if I've been born anew!

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Good eveningGood morningGood day to you, Forename! Why do you look at me so? Have I done something wrong?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Oh, how wondrous it was! A great power welled up within me, the likes of which I had never felt before. For a fleeting moment, I was drifting, and then there was a burst of color and light...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: So warm, so comforting was the glow that I could feel myself nodding off to sleep. But then I heard your voice, and I woke with a start.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I've never felt so alive! It's as if I've been born anew!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Born anew... Yes, in a sense that is indeed what has happened. You've grown strong, and so much so that you need no longer rely on others.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Yes, now you are free. Free to go forth with Forename, to see distant lands and embark on all the adventures this realm has to offer!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In overcoming such trials and travails together, I daresay you two have become quite the pair. Less adventurer and herhis arm than...fast friends.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Fast...friends?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Though I am but a youth of seventeen summers, I know what it means to respect and care for another. This is the sort of true kinship I see in you.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: It gladdens me to hear such praise. My only aim now is to become stronger, and prove myself a faithful friend to Forename.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: It gladdens me to hear such praise. My only aim now is to become stronger, and prove myself a loyal friend to Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Your adventures with Forename will doubtless carry you to distant lands, where you will confront foes the likes of which I can scarce imagine.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But no matter the challenge, you must rise to overcome it. Together, as true friends do. When you return from such travels, I should very much like to hear your tales of triumph.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We have done it, Forename. The anima shall enjoy life in all its splendor, now and forevermore, thanks to your selfless dedication. Words fail to express my gratitude.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, Ardashir.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I've been meanin' to tell ye, but I've fixed up the wings on this little one, too. Just like ye asked.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Thank you, Gerolt. All that remains to do is to calibrate the joints and it will be complete.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. There is another matter I would discuss with you, but doubtless you are weary after such a long day. I bid you safe travels home, and a well-earned respite. Let us speak again when next you return to Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We did it, Forename! We have guaranteed the future of yet another life, another companion with whom you can explore the untraveled reaches of Eorzea. May your journeys together be ever fruitful!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your anima weapon has been reborn, the spirit within imbued with newfound power!

obj.n: 新生ソウルストーンの創造

quest.name: 新生ソウルストーンの創造
journal: The processing node floats idly, waiting for commands.

Ardashir offers a brief explanation of how the anima's new soulstone will be created, entrusting you with the task of obtaining pneumite─an obscure catalyst essential to the process. Though he is reluctant to admit it, he knows not where they can be purchased or crafted. Ardashir bids you pool all your resources to track down this elusive component.

You acquire the pneumite through means perhaps better left unspoken. After loading it into the node along with Ardashir's crystals, and completing an unexpected-but-necessary system update, you are the proud owner of a sparkling new soulstone. Once Gerolt is finished forging your weapon, it will not be long before the anima resides in its permanent new home.
objectives: Collect the pneumite. Load the pneumite into the processing node.

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<beep> <beep> Verifying system parameters...
System parameters verified. <beep> Please insert materials.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ready to begin work on the soulstone? Excellent. Let us begin by going over the requisite materials.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Now, it bears mentioning that mine is a new method of soulstone creation. Rather than taking an existing stone and enchanting it, we will fashion a composite of high-purity crystals.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: These crystals are common enough, and even I should be able to procure them.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The catalyst for this process, however, will prove more elusive.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: A peculiar fusion of crystal and dark matter known as pneumite. It is essential to this unique form of soulstone synthesis.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, I know not how or where one might obtain it. I have only seen a single specimen in my master's laboratory, and though it pains me to admit it, I never thought to inquire after its origins.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I am afraid I must turn to your adventurer's resourcefulness to acquire the pneumite we require.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: By my calculation, we will need no less than fifteen to ensure a successful fusion. It is no easy task, but it is the only way to make our soulstone.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I knew I could count on you. When you have the requisite pneumite, return here and load them into the processing node. Good luck, Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Eager to fashion another soulstone, I see. Then I shall procure more crystals.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I will leave the pneumite to you. When you have acquired fifteen, return here and load them into the processing node.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The pneumite requested by Ardashir can be obtained through various means.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with other players and share information to discover how to find it!

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text: System parameters verified. <beep> Please insert materials.

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Catalyst detected.
Analyzing... Analyzing...
Catalyst drive at full capacity... Mineral quality optimal...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, you have the pneumite! Excellent work.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I will ready the crystals at once.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The crystals are all accounted for. Now to load them into the processing node.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: That should do it. Now, processing node: initiate the soulstone synthesis protocol.

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<beep> Unable to initiate protocol. Version 10 of the operating system is required to proceed.
Do you wish to upgrade?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Upgrade...? I am not sure I want to─

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Upgrade requested.
Do you agree to the Terms and Conditions of Use as stipulated by the Allagan Research Council?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But I... <sigh> Yes, yes, I agree. Will you please just initiate the synthesis protocol?

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
...<beep> <beep> Update complete. Rebooting system...
<beep> Initiating synthesis protocol...

dialogue.name: PROCESSSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <beep> Initiating synthesis protocol.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <beep> <beep> Synthesis complete. Margin of error within acceptable parameters.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It worked! It worked!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We have our soulstone! Take it and the anima weapon to Gerolt. It is time to take the final step in securing the anima's future.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: All that remains is to sufficiently condense the anima in preparation for the transfer. Soon, my friend. Soon we shall be ready for the final step in securing the anima's future!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Pray keep that soulstone safe, my friend. We shall have need of it when you are ready to work with another anima.

quest.name: 研究の終わりに
journal: The inoperative automaton sits quietly, waiting to be given a purpose.

Ardashir is ready to present the results of his research to Rowena. Perhaps due to the strange weather in Azys Lla, however, he is unable to contact her using his linkpearl. He bids you travel to Idyllshire and request she come to Azys Lla while he makes final preparations for the anima's unveiling.
Rowena is pleased to hear work on the anima weapon is finally complete. Unfortunately, she has unfinished business keeping her in Idyllshire. She asks that you return to Azys Lla ahead of her.

There is still time before Rowena arrives, and Ardashir seizes the opportunity to present you with a gift. You use the strange device he gives you to summon the anima, and are astonished to see it has taken on a new physical form. Ardashir explains this is made possible using the anima's original soulstone. Rowena arrives soon after to behold the fruits of your hard work. She is pleased with what Ardashir has accomplished, and looks forward to seeing more. When he mentions his plans to seek out a new blacksmith to aid him, all eyes are on Gerolt, who makes clear his intentions to leave now that he is debt free. His liberation is short-lived, however, when Rowena reminds him of the vast sums of gil he has spent since they began work on the anima. Firmly back under Rowena's thumb, he implores Ardashir to accept his help. Meanwhile, the anima suggests you leave to seek out new adventures.
objectives: Speak with Rowena in Idyllshire.
With Aettir and PriwenNyepelsMinosAreadbharTerpanderSindriKaladandaMimesisAnabasisSandungsDeathlockeCronusCanopus equipped or in your inventory, speak with Ardashir in Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Body and Soul,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to receive the quest “Body and Soul,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: So good of you to come, Forename. Did you rest well?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Curious, are we? I am afraid you will have to wait a while longer. It is nearly ready, save for a few final adjustments.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: While I am finishing with this, I would ask you a favor.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As you might remember, I wished to discuss something with you. Now that our work on the anima is complete, I would have Mistress Rowena come and see the fruits of our labor. But try as I might, there is naught but static when I call via linkpearl.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Would you go and ask her to come here to Azys Lla?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I should be finished by the time you return. She is sure to be pleased with what I have to show her, as will you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There's no response. You should wait until Ardashir has finished his work.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Well, if it ain't my favorite customer and business partner. Any new developments with the anima weapon?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Finished, you say? That's the best news I've had all day. Would that I could leave now to see it, but it'd be bad for business to leave clients waitin'. You tell Ardashir he can expect a visit from me as soon as I'm done here.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. ...Erm, If I may ask, why did you not bring the anima weapon? There can be no unveiling of the anima to Mistress Rowena without it.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Please go and retrieve both the anima weapon and shield at once. Quickly, before she arrives.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Please go and retrieve the anima weapon at once. Quickly, before she arrives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance in the quest “Body and Soul,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to advance the quest “Body and Soul,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the event you discarded your anima weapon, you will be required to abandon the quest “Body and Soul” and create a new one.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the event you discarded your anima weapon and shield, you will be required to abandon the quest “Body and Soul” and create new ones.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: While we wait for Mistress Rowena to arrive, there is something I wish to give you.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It is a device to be used when summoning the anima. Care to give it a try?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Did you call, Forename? ...Oh my! My body is... Wh-What happened!?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Did you need something, Forename? ...Huh!? Wh-What happened to my body?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Despite all we have accomplished here, one thing still concerned me─the fact that your spirit is bound to the anima weapon, which is why you can only be summoned in its presence. What will happen, then, should shehe need your aid but not possess the weapon housing your spirit?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It is why I created that new body. It is linked to you through your original soulstone, which still bears your aetherial signature. So long as Forename keeps that device with herhim, your spirit can be channeled into this new, physical form.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Consider it my gift to you, that none may break the bond shared between you and Forename.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Thank you, Ardashir. I will never leave herhis side. You have my word.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Thank you, Ardashir. I will never leave herhis side. You have my word.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: What's this, then? You celebratin' without me?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Forename's told me everythin'. I take it this is the anima I've heard so much about.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: It's a pleasure to meet you.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: It's very nice to meet you.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Magnificent, is it not? A life created with our own hands, forged into a weapon─the anima weapon. The perfect companion to accompany adventurers like Forename.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You've impressed me, Ardashir. With proper rearin' these anima'll make obedient helpers.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (...An' me a tidy profit.)

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I can see my gil was well invested, an' I look forward to seein' more o' your work. Now that you've overcome the hurdle o' makin' the first, I'm sure a sharp lad like you can ready anima weapons for the masses in no time at all.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Indeed, I have learned a great many lessons in my time here, thanks in no small part to Forename, and even Gerolt. I daresay it will not be long before all the realm knows of the wonder that is anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But first I intend to return home. Fates permitting, I will find a capable smith to assist me in fashioning more anima weapons.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: You heard the boy. If he wants to go home, let him. I got better things to do than look after that streak o' piss while he makes more toys. With me debts repaid, I'm headin' to Costa del Sol for a well-earned─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Repaid? I never took you for the sort who jokes about money. You owe me plenty.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now hold on, Rowena. You promised to forget me debts once we were done with the anima weapon.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And I'm a woman of my word. What you owed before we started this little business venture's been forgiven. That just leaves the cost of comin' and goin' from Azys Lla, and a rather impressive bill for all that mead you drank.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I expect you to pay me back down to the last gil. O' course, I might be willin' to forgive an' forget again if you help our dear boy Ardashir.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Anyroad, I ought to be headin' back. Got business to tend to. Until next time, Forename, Ardashir.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, Ardashir... How's about I fire up the forge for another o' those anima weapons?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The offer is appreciated, but no thank you. As I said, what I seek is a smith committed to making weapons, not wasting his days in pursuit of drink.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right then─no more drinkin' until we're done. Glad we got that settled.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We have settled nothing! Even if I were to consent, you would never hold up your end of the agreement. Even now I can smell the foul odor of ale on your breath!

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Perhaps we should leave them to settle this on their own. Surely there are others who need our assistance.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I think we'd do well not to interfere. Mayhap we can find others who need our assistance.

quest.name: 新たな報せ
journal: Ardashir is curious as to the anima's present condition.

Ardashir's inquiry about the anima is suddenly interrupted by a linkpearl call from Rowena. As the young scholar explains it, he had sent documents outlining his research to a renowned authority of arcane magicks, who has seen fit to favor him with a response. Eager though he is to know what wisdom they have to share, he cannot neglect his present work. He asks that you precede him and meet with Rowena in Idyllshire.

Ardashir bursts onto the scene, breathless from an unexpected and hasty return to Azys Lla before finally arriving in Idyllshire. He quickly regains his composure, that he might pore over the sage words of the scholar─who is revealed to be none other than the legendary Matoya. Though her missive is marked with praise for his work, it is not without criticism. To wit, she has reason to believe that Ardashir's approach thus far may have failed to instill the anima with a sufficient sense of individuality. Based on his writings, she has offered a proposal to rectify this issue. And so he returns to Azys Lla to tell Gerolt of the good news.

Little to your surprise, Ardashir's unbridled enthusiasm to resume his work is matched only by Gerolt's loathing and desire for rest. One can only wonder what trials and tribulations are in store for you and the anima.
objectives: Speak with Rowena in Idyllshire.
Speak with Ardashir in Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. A pleasure as always. How fares the anima?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Sprightly as ever, I see. It puts my mind at ease to see you both well.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-Rowena-)Ardashir! You there, Ardashir? Just thought I'd check in. How are things comin' along?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Oh, Rowena. My research is progressing quite well, thank you. To what do I owe the pleasure of this unexpected call?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-Rowena-)It's those papers you had me send off a few moons ago. You got a letter back about them, and a rather comprehensive one, at least judgin' by the weight o' the envelope. Reckoned you might want to drop by an' pick it up.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: C-Could it be!? I mean, of course─I will make for Idyllshire at once!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: After finishing our work on the anima, I wrote a treatise on the various techniques we employed in its development. Thanks to Rowena, and her influential connections, I was able to deliver it to a renowned scholar who is the realm's foremost expert on arcane entities. I can scarcely believe it, but it would seem my observations were deemed worthy of a response.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Would you care to accompany me to Rowena's? I can but speculate as to the contents of the letter, but I daresay we may learn of something of benefit to your anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excellent! Pray go on ahead to Idyllshire. I have a few tests underway that must be finished before I can leave. I shall follow anon.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, there he is. What took you so long? To hear Forename here tell it, you were so bloody worked up about this letter you nearly broke your linkpearl.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: My apologies. No sooner had I arrived in the hinterlands than I realized the burners on my workbench were still lit! Ahem. But that is neither here nor there. Oh, to think this moment would come! May I see the envelope, Rowena?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: After all, 'tis not every day one receives a personal missive from the illustrious Mistress Matoya.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Hmmm...hmm? Why, yes... Yes, of course! How could I have not seen! Why, it's all so clear now!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I had the highest of expectations, but her analysis of my work was even more comprehensive and enlightening than I could have even imagined!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What's more, she praised my methods for development as innovative! Can you believe it? The incomparable Mistress Matoya, master of all matters arcane, was impressed by my intellect and ingenuity.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: She went on to surmise that, considering the anima in its capacity as a sentient weapon, its sense of individuality was lacking. But fear not! In her benevolence, she saw fit to offer counsel as to how we might address this very issue!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The fledgling scholar I once was would have been elated simply to receive counsel I could scarcely understand, but I have learned much in my time together with you and Gerolt.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Together, I am confident we can put Mistress Matoya's teachings to good use. What say you, Forename. Shall we set to work on instilling your anima with a keener sense of self-awareness?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Glad to hear it! Doubtless Gerolt, too, will be pleased to hear of this most exciting turn of events. Let us return to Azys Lla and deliver the good news.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Our product's gettin' a little more polish, eh? Well, if you an' Ardashir need anythin'─anythin' at all─you can trust ol' Rowena to take care of it.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...Provided the price is right, 'course. This ain't a charity I'm runnin' here, after all. Good luck to you, Forename.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Remember, Forename: if you need anythin', just say the word. We can figure out how much you'll be owin' me after the fact.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, I heard─though between you and me, I wish I hadn't. <sigh> Just when I thought I could finally enjoy a moment's peace...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, at last you are returned! I can scarcely wait to see what wonders will come of Mistress Matoya's counsel.

quest.name: 人造精霊の相棒
journal:
Ardashir is eager to put Matoya's sage counsel into practice.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Having carefully pored over Matoya's missive, Ardashir explains that the primals are the key to the anima's enlightenment. He asks that you relive your fiercest battles with these celestial beings─not on the battlefield, but within your mind. Linked as you are to the anima, he posits that it would be as if your aetherial companion experienced these epic battles firsthand. Heeding his request, you take a deep breath, still your mind, and think back to your first encounter with the godlike beings known as primals.

You awake with a start, your heart still racing from your vivid recollections of your confrontations with Ifrit, Garuda, and Titan. Yet there is still much for you to share with the anima. You close your eyes once more and prepare to summon from the depths of your memory yet another harrowing battle with the primals.

You open your eyes again for a short reprieve from reliving the more arduous experiences of your past. With the memories of combat still fresh in your mind, you check─perhaps out of habit─to be certain your garb is neither soaked nor singed from battle. Alas, there is no rest for the weary, for many tales of derring-do remain untold. Again you clear your mind, and summon forth a vision of strife and struggle against the unbridled fury of the primals.

The ring of steel echoes in your ears as you stir back to consciousness. Though the confrontations have taken place entirely within your mind's eye, your muscles are strangely sore, your body stiff as if from great physical exertion. And yet, there is still one tale to tell─of three gods locked in perpetual conflict, and the brave soul that dared to bring them low.

You return to your senses in a cold sweat, a sigh of relief escaping from your lips as you realize the battles were all in your mind. Though it was not in the flesh that you faced these encounters anew, your sharp and stirring memories of your great deeds will doubtless prove of great value to the anima. Having exhausted your repository of grueling memories of your confrontations with the primals, you seek out Ardashir, that together you might awaken the anima's newfound knowledge.

Ardashir would proceed with the next stage of Matoya's plan: namely, to employ an enchantment to ingrain the anima's newly gained knowledge into the core of its being. There is, however, a rub─all the materials needed for the procedure are readily available save one─an ancient variety of enchanted ink said to be made only in the lands of Sharlayan. Knowing of no merchants who might deal in such exotic goods, Ardashir defers to your unequaled talent for procurement.

Through means available only to one of your experience and expertise, you procure a bottle of archaic enchanted ink and deliver it to Ardashir. He follows Matoya's instructions to the letter, outlining an arcane circle for the spell and gently placing the anima weapon in its center. As your aether flows into the circle, you focus your thoughts on the anima, which soon manifests before you. Your hearts and minds are as one now, the anima acutely aware of your faith and aspirations for the journey to come. The deep attachment you feel toward the anima has cast away its fears, leaving only hope and an unshakable resolve. After myriad trials and tribulations, your aetherial companion has truly come into its own. Though you know not what the future may hold, you take comfort in knowing that whatever perils you may face, you will not face them alone. Indeed, your foes must now stand against the might of the anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have pored over Mistress Matoya's instructions─twenty times over, in fact─and I do believe I have settled on our next course of action. Allow me to elaborate.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As she explains it, the primals are the key to developing the anima's sense of self. I will grant that the idea may seem far-fetched, but bear with me. As you are well aware, they are beings of aether─much like the anima─summoned forth using crystals, and driven by the faith of their followers.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But to what ends do their followers summon them so? How do they fight once made manifest? This is the knowledge I would have you share with the anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: To do so, I ask that you take the anima weapon in hand, and call to mind your encounters with the primals as vividly as you can muster, as if you were fighting these great battles anew within the confines of your own mind.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are! No doubt you are here to work on another anima. Good, good. I was just reading over Mistress Matoya's letter again for good measure, but putting her methods to practice is infinitely more enlightening.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As before, you must conjure within your mind the fiercest of your battles with the primals. Remember: your recollection must be as clear and detailed as possible─as if you were reliving your first encounter with these gods.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This plan may seem peculiar, but every success─and failure─a man experiences grants him strength. Having overcome untold dangers and countless hardships, your spirit is no doubt an inexhaustible reservoir of energies. You must tap into that strength, and share it with the anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: When you are finished revisiting your harrowing experiences with the primals, come speak with me, and we shall set the next step of the plan into motion.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned! I can scarcely imagine what terrible trials you contrived within the recesses of your mind. I trust you have revisited all the primals?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excellent! With the anima now possessed of knowledge of the primals in all their forms, and the strong desires that spurred them into action, we need only reinforce what it has learned.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: For that, we must use the magicks that gave birth to Mistress Matoya's amphibian familiars. Though they began as ordinary frogs, she transformed them into what we know as poroggo by means of an enchantment that served to awaken knowledge previously imparted to them.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: She posits that, by using that same spell, what the anima has learned from reliving at your side your confrontations with the primals can be ingrained into the very core of its being.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The spell requires a few unorthodox ingredients, however. I can procure them all myself, save for one...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: A form of enchanted ink used in days of yore, whose recipe has been lost to time. ...Or so it is generally believed.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There are those, however, who insist it is still being manufactured to the present day...in secret, deep in the heart of the Sharlayan motherland. Would that I were acquainted with a merchant who trades in exotic goods! Or perhaps there is another way...?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have not the faintest idea of where to begin, but an adventurer as well traveled as yourself might fare better. Do you think it possible you could procure this ink?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: A single bottle will more than suffice. As for the remaining ingredients, worry not. I will see to their procurement. Good luck, Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: For that, we must once again turn to Mistress Matoya's enchantment to firmly cement the anima's newly gained knowledge into the very core of its being.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Which means that I fear I must again burden you to procure a bottle of that most elusive ink.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: A small price to pay, I should think, considering the resounding success of your last anima weapon. At any rate, rest assured all other preparations will be complete on your return.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with other players and share information to discover how to find the archaic enchanted ink!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Were you able to procure the elusive variety of enchanted ink that we require? If so, I would prepare the weapon for enchantment straightaway.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Hm? Perhaps my words were not clear, but I fear we require both your anima weapon and the enchanted ink.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with other players and share information to discover how to find the archaic enchanted ink!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Excellent work! Long have I been curious to see the splendor of Mistress Matoya's wisdom firsthand. With all of the reagents now accounted for, my curiosity will at last be sated. Let us begin!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Behold! The color has changed just as Mistress Matoya said it would. Splendid, splendid!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Next is the more delicate step of the process─inscribing the arcane circle needed for the spell using this magicked brew.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And...there! I believe that should do it!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Phew. I was all but certain the trembling of my hands would make a mess of the inscription. As the final step, we need but place the anima weapon within the circle, and hope that the desired effect is achieved.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The spell is ready, but its magicks must be invoked by your hand, Forename. In doing so, you will shape the anima's sense of self and purpose in the world. Now, close your eyes. Envision the path your anima will take, and allow your aether to flow into the arcane circle.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you wish for the anima?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: To freely choose its own destiny.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: To fight faithfully at my side.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Forename...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Your memories of battle were quite evocative. I feel as though I truly was there at your side, supporting your every blow against the primals. I have reflected deeply on all that I have seen. About the primals, and the dreams and desires that spurred them into action.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I realize now that even a simple wish─no matter how pure, how innocent─can at times be used to bring about calamity.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: All I ever wished for was the strength to protect you. But am I not unlike the primals? An aetherial being seeking ever greater strength to fulfill my desires? If that power should come to cause you harm... The mere thought of it chilled me to my core.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: ...But no longer! Now, I have felt the warmth of your aether. Your earnest plea has banished my fears and filled my heart with unwavering courage.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Freedom...this is what you did wish for me. Indeed, the world is vast and full of wonders, and I would see them all. By your side, as your companion and ally. This is the path I choose of my own free will.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: A faithful ally in combat... I feel our minds are already as one, for I would wish the same of you. The realm is rife with innumerable dangers, but we will face them together.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: You did not express your desire in words, but your heart spoke volumes. Know that I have heard your wish, and will do all within my power to see it granted.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Your memories of battle were quite evocative. I feel as though I truly was there at your side, supporting your every blow against the primals. I have reflected deeply on all that I have seen. About the primals, and the dreams and desires that spurred them into action.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I realize now that even a simple wish─no matter how pure, how innocent─can at times be used to bring about calamity.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: All I ever wished for was the strength to protect you. But am I not unlike the primals? An aetherial being seeking ever greater strength to fulfill my desires? If that power should come to cause you harm... The mere thought of it chilled me to my core.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: ...But no longer! Now, I have felt the warmth of your aether. Your earnest plea has banished my fears and filled my heart with unwavering courage.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Freedom...this is what you did wish for me. Indeed, the world is vast and full of wonders, and I would see them all. By your side, as your companion and ally. This is the path I choose of my own free will.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: A faithful ally in combat... I feel our minds are already as one, for I would wish the same of you. The realm is rife with innumerable dangers, but we will face them together.

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: You did not express your desire in words, but your heart spoke volumes. Know that I have heard your wish, and will do all within my power to see it granted.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi! The anima weapon's lit up somethin' fierce! I reckon it's gained more than a new sense o' self, if ye get my meanin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Look at that! Ain't it a beauty? Reminds me o' the last one, but it's got somethin' special about it I can't put me finger on.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Could it truly be...?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: What are you waiting for, Forename? Take the anima weapon in hand!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: My word! Have you ever seen anything so exquisite? This, my friend, is the power of your wish made manifest─a form befitting the anima's newfound resolve.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And I daresay it deserves a name to match its resplendence. I hereby dub you [Error]!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: And I daresay it deserves a name to match its resplendence. I hereby dub you [Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You have raised a fine ally in the anima, Forename. And thanks to Mistress Matoya's magicks, we have sparked a new sense of self within the anima through a joining of your minds.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Indeed, this marks a significant malmstone in my research─one that would not have been possible without your efforts. You have my sincerest thanks.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: With that said, this method for developing anima is far from efficient. I very much doubt there are many adventurers with such prodigious experiences to draw upon. No, to devise a means for the greater populace to nurture anima as robust as yours will require further research.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Mark my words: from the lowly fishermen of La Noscea to the Temple Knights of Ishgard─I will not rest until anyone and everyone in our fair realm can reap the rewards of anima!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hold yer chocobos there, Ardashir! Just how many o' these bloody things do ye plan on makin'!?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I did say anyone and everyone, did I not? There is much work to be done, and I would be most appreciative if you could honor your end of our agreement. Of course, you are free to leave, if that is your wont. Though I suspect Rowena would be...disappointed.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: You no-good, stinkin' sack o'... Yer lucky me sellin' kettles ain't as gainful as it used to be.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But when all this research o' yers is finally finished, I'm draggin' yer scrawny arse to Rowena meself, and we're gonna settle me debts right then and there. Got it?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Wonderful! I knew you would come to see things my way. I look forward to a long and fruitful partnership.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Words fail to express my gratitude. Now go forth, explore, and share the realm's myriad wonders with the anima. When next you return, I look forward to hearing your grand stories of adventure.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Words fail to express my gratitude. Now go forth, and protect the realm as only you can, fighting together as one. When next you return, I look forward to hearing your grand stories of adventure.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Words fail to express my gratitude. Now go forth, explore, and fulfill your dreams together with the anima. When next you return, I look forward to hearing your grand stories of adventure.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The anima spirit has gained unyielding resolve, the weapon it inhabits now the pinnacle of martial perfection.

quest.name: 未知なる島、その名はエウレカ
journal: Galiena is reasonably sure you are the adventurer she is looking for.

In Rhalgr's Reach you are approached by Galiena, who has been instructed by “Aunt Rowena” to request your assistance with the exploration of a recently discovered island. The island in question is apparently somewhere in the Far East, and if you are interested in learning more, you will have no choice but to journey once more to distant Kugane and speak with Kotokaze, the esteemed proprietress of the Shiokaze Hostelry.

After being shown to a private table, you are joined by Krile, as well as Rowena and Hancock, who have recently become partners after a fashion.
