The pair explain that they have joined forces in an effort to develop the aforementioned island, which could serve as a new port of call for trading vessels seeking to circumvent the high tariffs of Kugane. Alas, this will not be a simple endeavor, as the previous expedition met with failure at the hands─rather, the claws and teeth─of the innumerable savage beasts that inhabit the island. Warriors of consummate skill are needed, and you stand above all others in their minds. Krile, for her part, has a personal stake in the expedition, though she begs leave to say no more unless her suspicions regarding the island prove true.

Duly advised to go on ahead to the waiting expedition vessel, you come upon Gerolt Blackthorne, by all accounts the finest weaponsmith in all of Eorzea─and an accomplished drunkard besides─locked in a bitter dispute with a belligerent scholar who you soon learn is Ejika Tsunjika of the Students of Baldesion. A contemporary of Krile, he demands to take part in the expedition, having learned of Krile's interest in the island. Krile consents, and Ejika boards without further comment─for the time being. All that remains is to journey to the mysterious island dubbed “Eureka” and see what mysteries await...
objectives: Speak with Kotokaze in Kugane.
Rendezvous with the craftsman at Pier #1.

dialogue.name: GALIENA
dialogue.text: Forename Surname─of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, if I'm not mistaken?

dialogue.name: GALIENA
dialogue.text: Very good. I've a message for you from Aunt Rowena. Well, it's more of a request, I suppose, though I don't have any details of consequence...

dialogue.name: GALIENA
dialogue.text: She'd like you to assist with the exploration of a recently discovered island. Surely you'd be interested in that sort of thing, being an adventurer?

dialogue.name: GALIENA
dialogue.text: If you are, then you should head to Kugane and see Kotokaze, the proprietress of the Shiokaze Hostelry. It's a long way to go, I know, but the island's out that way anyway, so...

dialogue.name: GALIENA
dialogue.text: I'd tell you all about Aunt Rowena's proposition if I could, but I honestly don't know anything else. You'll need to head to Kugane to learn more.

dialogue.name: KOTOKAZE
dialogue.text: I see you decided to accept the invitation of the House of Splendors. Rowena will be pleased. Come─I will show you to your table.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: It's good to see a familiar face in these parts─particularly that o' the womanman who might well be my most valued customer.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I gather you were not expecting Krile or myself to be attending this little tête-à-tête. As you will see, however, this is a matter which concerns us all.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: It all began when a vessel of the East Aldenard Trading Company happened upon an island in the Glass Ocean. A deserted island which was not recorded on our charts and, quite frankly, had no business being there.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say, we were surprised. Pleasantly so, in fact. An unclaimed, undeveloped island in such a location would be a boon to our trading concerns in this corner of the world.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Kugane's bleedin' us both dry with its tariffs. Dependin' on the goods, we're paying more than ten times what we'd owe in Limsa or Ul'dah─which is already too damn much, believe you me.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: What my dear Rowena is trying to say is that having an additional port of call in this region─one more amenable to free trade─would be in the best interests of a great many parties.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Which is why, upon learning of this island, I immediately authorized an exploratory expedition. The team was large and well funded─I spared no expense. Alas, only a handful returned.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: The survivors reported “irregularities” with the island's aether, which we believe gave rise to a number of strange and monstrous beasts─beasts which set upon them not long after they arrived.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: This regrettable turn of events forced us to reevaluate our assessment of the island and put our plans on hold for a time. If development was to proceed, it would require a great deal more capital than originally anticipated...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: So he came to me and mine for a handout, and I obliged. But before you scoff, know that some of my regular customers were members o' that failed expedition, and what they told me was enough to justify the expense.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Tales o' treasure, of untold wealth and riches and gods know what else. Aye, we'll have to wade through all 'em beasties, but with great risk comes great reward, as they say.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Spoken like a born entrepreneur! Your ambition and ruthlessness are admirable, my lady. I daresay I could stand to learn a thing or two from you.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: ...In any event, having formed our partnership, we wish to dispatch a second joint expeditionary force to the island. That said, if we were to send just anyone, their fate is like to be the same as that of the first.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: So this time, we've a mind to send a dab hand. A veteran of a thousand thousand battles. A tried-and-true killer. You see where I'm goin' with this?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: While I lack your aptitude for warcraft, I will be joining the expedition as a researcher. The Scions have an interest in this island─

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...How perceptive of you. You are right─this is not the sort of affair that would normally concern us. However, after speaking with the others, they have consented to my participation, on account of my personal interest...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You will forgive me if I say no more at this time. If my suspicions prove true, then I will tell you everything. I promise.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Right, then. I believe that covers everything! The company ship that will deliver you to the island is waiting to receive you. You may proceed to the pier whenever you are ready to depart.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Oh, and so you're not surprised─you'll have company. A craftsman whose help I reckoned we ought to have. He should be at the pier already.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Rowena and I still have a few things to discuss, so why don't you go on ahead? I'll catch up to you later.

dialogue.name: EJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: No matter how many times you say it, I refuse to take no for an answer! I am getting on that ship, and that is the end of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...And no matter how many times you say it, ye whiny little shite, I ain't about to let a bloody stranger waltz up and deign to tell me which way my bread is buttered! Now piss off!

dialogue.name: EJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: (-Incorrigible Youth-)Does your Eorzean stubbornness know no end!? I have urgent business on that island, and I demand you take me there at once!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I could hear the shouting half a malm away...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Gerolt, what is all the fuss about?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, Miss Krile. Sorry about that. It's this here bastard what's causing trouble.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Ejika!? What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: EJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Did you really think I wouldn't find out about your letter? The nerve of you, trying to get a head start on your own! Well─sorry to spoil your plans.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Don't be difficult. I had every intention of requesting your assistance if and when I confirmed my hypothesis was correct...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Forgive me. You must be completely at a loss.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This gentleman on the right is Gerolt Blackthorne, by all accounts the finest weaponsmith in all of Eorzea. He will be lending his considerable expertise to our expedition.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: This gentleman on the right is─ Wait, you already know each other, do you not? Well, as you may have guessed, Gerolt will be lending his considerable expertise to our expedition.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And on the left, we have─

dialogue.name: EJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Ejika Tsunjika, of the Students of Baldesion. And you must be the so-called Warrior of Light. Charmed, I'm sure. I'll thank you not to get underfoot.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Manners, Ejika! If you intend to accompany us on this expedition─

dialogue.name: EJIKATSUNJIKA
dialogue.text: Of course I do! If you think I'm about to let a by-the-book traditionalist like you conduct an independent investigation, you've got another think coming!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...I should be glad to welcome the assistance of a preeminent scholar such as yourself. Now, if you would be so kind as to stop badgering poor Gerolt and board the ship, we can get underway.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Ejika is one of the few surviving Students of Baldesion. While his expertise in aetherology is impressive by any measure, alas, so is his ego...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: But enough about him! We have an island to explore! If you've no matters left to attend to, speak with Rodney. He will show you aboard.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Hmm... It occurs to me that no one bothered to tell you the name of the island we mean to explore. Am I correct?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: It's a bit grandiose and melodramatic, but we've tentatively named it for a place from Allagan legend. A forbidden land where fearsome weapons were hidden away for safekeeping...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We call it...Eureka.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to the Forbidden Land, Eureka Anemos. Anemos can be explored in parties of up to eight players, or solo.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To embark on your journey to Anemos, speak with Rodney at Pier #1 in Kugane.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that all excursions into the Forbidden Land, Eureka, are item level synced. For Anemos, gear exceeding an item level of [#1] will be adjusted.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: While exploring Anemos, you will have the opportunity to create Eureka gear and weapons. If you wish to do so, it would be prudent to acquire level 70 antiquated items in advance.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you wish to know more about Eureka Anemos and what it has to offer, you may speak with Rodney for further details.

quest.name: 失われた聖遺物
journal: Judging by the look of relief on Keiten's face, you have saved him a great deal of time.

Walking the streets of Kugane you happen across Keiten, who seems rather relieved to see you. As he explains it, Hancock has been searching for you, and asks that you come to the Ruby Bazaar to discuss an urgent matter.

Hancock speaks with you of the state of affairs in the Empire, and of the disarray that has allowed resistance groups to rise up and fight back. One such group, unfortunately, lacks the means to do so, and has beseeched Lord Hien for assistance. He, in turn, would seek your aid. Unfortunately, Hien can prove difficult to find even at the best of times, which is why Hancock suggests speaking with his attendants at the House of the Fierce.
You arrive at the House of the Fierce, but, as expected, Lord Hien is nowhere to be found. Thankfully, one of his attendants is at the ready, wasting no time in escorting you to him.

Lord Hien introduces you to Marsak, a member of the Bozjan Resistance. To hearten his people, and give them the strength to overcome their Garlean suppressors, he intends to reforge the weapons belonging to Gunnhildr's Blades, the legendary guard of Bozja's ruler from the Third Astral Era. Such an ambitious plan requires great minds and still greater heroes to bring it to fruition, which is why Lord Hien sought you out. Never one to turn away those in need, you agree to help.
Marsak is ready to return to Bozja, and would have you accompany him. He bids you prepare before meeting him at the airship docked at the Doman Enclave.
objectives: Speak with Hancock.
Speak with the Doman attendant at the House of the Fierce in Yanxia.
Speak with the Doman attendant.
Speak with Marsak.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: MiladyMilord! My, what auspicious timing. I intended to send a missive to the Rising Stones, but it seems that is no longer necessary.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Master Hancock wishes to speak with you regarding a matter of grave import. I can but imagine what other duties yet demand your attention. Still, he would request you meet him at the Ruby Bazaar at your earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Master Hancock requests your presence at the Ruby Bazaar at your earliest convenience. Though he would not elaborate, it seems to be a rather pressing matter.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And so shehe returns at last. From what Tataru has told me, you've come rather a long way, to put it mildly.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And while the Scions remained locked in slumber, she sought aid from all corners of the realm. In fact, it was I to whom she first turned when searching for a champion to assist her in your absence.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Though as you have no doubt surmised, I did not call you here to discuss such matters.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I have received word from Lord Hien that the Bozjan Resistance, our comrades in the Eastern alliance, seek the aid of distinguished heroes in their fight against the Empire, and naturally, your name immediately sprang to mind.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The Bozjan Resistance, you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I didn't realize they were part of the Eastern alliance.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Indeed, from a small nation found in the southern reaches of Ilsabard, to the west of Dalmasca. They were no doubt among the first to fall to the Empire.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Yet it would seem their hearts have yet to give way to despair. And with the Empire now in disarray, they would seize the opportunity to fight back.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Indeed. Though the city-state has long since fallen to Garlean machinations, the remnants have agreed to join the cause.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And with the Empire now in disarray, they would seize the opportunity to fight back.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: If you would know the details in full, I think it best you speak with Lord Hien. His endless list of commitments makes him a hard man to find, however, so perhaps you can have one of his attendants at the House of the Fierce track him down for you.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Those at the House of the Fierce familiar with Lord Hien's busy schedule may be able to help locate him.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: Greetings, my ladygood sir. Lord Hien has been expecting you.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: When word reached us from the Bozjan Resistance, Lord Hien knew at once there was but one womanman to whom he could turn.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: He left to the Coattails not long ago─the view of Doma Castle helps to calm his mind. This way, if you please.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: This way, atop the broken bridge. He will be most glad for your arrival.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Do you remember when first we shared a view of this castle together? Still under the Garleans' control, perhaps, yet for all their wickedness, its beauty would not be so easily sullied.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: It is good to see you, my friend. You must forgive me for forgoing pleasantries, but our guest here is in dire need of your help.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Marsak, of the Bozjan Resistance. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: As you have no doubt already heard from Lord Hien, my people seek to reclaim our homeland from the Empire.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Under his auspices, and that of the Eorzean Alliance, we aim to do just that.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: However, we recently received word that the IVth Imperial Legion has been making plans of their own.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: It has long held the provinces of Nagxia, Dalmasca, and Bozja in an iron grip, using its Dalmascan headquarters to house the bulk of its forces.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Until recently, that is.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: They appear to be diverting resources and manpower to their forces stationed in Bozja. In fact, three battalions are en route as we speak.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We thought perhaps to strike before they can fully assemble, but the Bozjan Resistance lacks the means to drive them off on its own.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Aid from the Dalmascan resistance groups may have sufficed. Sadly, even Fran of Lente's Tears has been unable to bring an end to their infighting.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: All hope is not lost, however, for Lord Hien has made a most intriguing proposal.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: An idea not my own, I must confess. We have our old friend Gosetsu to thank.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: As the Empire tightened its grip on Doma, our people were at a crossroads. Would they lay down and surrender, or stand up and fight?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: You sought me out, that I could become the spark that lit the fire of rebellion.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The same must be done for the Bozjans.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: They require a standard under which they can rally. A symbol of hope to steel them for what is to come.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Lacking a living figurehead such as Lord Hien, my comrades and I looked to our nation's past for inspiration. There, we found the answer we sought: Gunnhildr's Blades.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: They were the elite guard of Queen Gunnhildr, possessed of weapons blessed by the gods. Their exploits would become legend after defending our peoples against the Allagans in the Third Astral Era.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The strength of their steel was matched only by their dedication to the queen. Should one lose their life in her service, their holy blade was then passed on to a successor.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: In time, their title would lend itself to the most renowned of their weaponry─the gunblade. But in truth, each member of her guard was master of a unique weapon.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Though these sacred relics have been lost to time, I would see them forged anew! Armed thus, our people would know no fear, and drive back our oppressors just as Queen Gunnhildr did the Allagans.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: An admittedly lofty and otherwise unattainable goal for one such as I. Which is why I have traveled far and wide in search of great minds and greater heroes who might lend us their aid. We would be honored to have one of your renown at our side.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We value the Bozjans' commitment to the cause, and I would see their plans come to fruition.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, duty demands that I remain here. I could not in good conscience leave knowing the Empire yet threatens the border to Ala Mhigo. Should you choose to accompany him to Bozja, might I ask you also act as a representative of the Eastern alliance in my stead?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Leave it to me.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'll do what I can.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. If there is aught else you require of the Eastern alliance, you need only ask. Safe travels to you both.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: An airship to our base has been prepared for us at the enclave's dock. I hope to see you there soon.

obj.n: 楽欲の僧院 オーボンヌ
グンヒルドの剣と「紡ぎ手」

quest.name: グンヒルドの剣と「紡ぎ手」
journal: Marsak is ready to depart.

You agree to lend your strength to the Bozjan Resistance, and Marsak wastes no time in preparing a ship to ferry you to their base of operations. He bids you meet him at the Doman Enclave when you are ready to embark.
You find Marsak waiting for you patiently at the dock. Prepared to depart, you speak with the ferryman who ushers the two of you onto his airship.

No sooner do you arrive at the Resistance camp than you find yourself face-to-face with Bajsaljen, leader of the Bozjan Resistance. He and his comrades explain to you their plan─to reforge the legendary weapons of Gunnhildr's Blades. Despite the scarcity of recordings relating to Queen Gunnhildr and her guard, they have made great strides in reproducing their vaunted arms. The key to their completion is a holy inscription engraved upon them, any traces of which were lost when Bozja Citadel fell many years ago. For their plans to move forward, they have enlisted the aid of an old friend─Mikoto.

In perhaps a few too many words, and a demonstration assisted by Gerolt, Mikoto expounds further on their plans. Borrowing the long-forgotten techniques of Bozjan seers, you must use a special crystal focus to enter the memories of those who may have seen the holy inscription required to reforge Gunnhildr's weapons. The problem, however, is that anyone who had glimpsed the inscription perished when Bozja Citadel was destroyed. Or so they thought. While contemplating the possibility of survivors, Mikoto is struck by a vision of the future. In it, she sees Cid Garlond, convincing her that he is the eyewitness you are searching for.

While strangely reluctant, Bajsaljen understands that Cid Garlond is likely your only hope of forging Gunnhildr's weapons. And so he bids you go to Rhalgr's Reach and speak with the Ironworks engineers there to find him.

Speaking with a fledgling engineer in Rhalgr's Reach, it seems as though Cid is too preoccupied to help. Thankfully, Jessie happens to overhear your conversation and clears up any misconceptions regarding his present commitments. Before taking her leave, Jessie asks that you proceed with caution, fearful of what horrors may be unearthed from Cid's past.
Arrangements have been made for Cid to meet you at the Doman Enclave. As you make your way to meet him, you cannot help but wonder what secrets his memories may hold.
objectives: Speak with the airship pilot at the Doman Enclave.
Speak with Mikoto.
Speak with Bajsaljen.
Speak with the Ironworks engineer at Rhalgr's Reach.
Speak with the Ironworks engineer.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: When you have finished your preparations, meet me at the dock and we can be on our way.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our destination is Gangos, the Resistance's present base of operations. To ensure we remain unnoticed by the Empire, this ship is one of the few permitted to travel 'twixt Doma and the other provinces. Should you have need to travel to Gangos in the future, I ask you come here to do so.

dialogue.name: AIRSHIPGUIDE
dialogue.text: Coming aboard, misssir?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Travel to Gangos?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)That we should play host to the liberator of Doma and Ala Mhigo herselfhimself. I did not think you could be persuaded to help us.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Bajsaljen, leader of the Bozjan Resistance. Not the best choice for the job, if I'm to be frank, but I will bear the title all the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Bloody hells, man! Ye won't inspire much confidence speakin' like that!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Haha, you're quite right, Master Gerolt! While you're here, won't you come and welcome our guest?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Huh...? What in the seven hells are you doin' here!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't I know ye from somewhere? ...Ah, I know! Yer that lassbloke what saved Eorzea from the Garleans or some such. Forename, was it? What's the matter? Ye look like someone pissed in yer porridge.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Eorzea's greatest hero and her finest blacksmith. With the two of you here, our plan is sure to succeed. Would that Queen Gunnhildr were here to witness this.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, Forename... Just between us? I'm only here to pay off me debts to that black–hearted snake Rowena.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She's been sellin' supplies to the Resistance, and they happened to mention they were in need of a smithy. So she went and told 'em I'm the greatest bleedin' smithy in the realm, with skills that'd put Byregot Himself to shame.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can't rightly say I'm even half o' what she claimed, but I'll do me damndest. They're happy to ply me with good grub and even better booze, so play along, will ye?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Now that you're both here, I believe it time our plans be made clear. Misija?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. Our goal is to reforge the weapons wielded by Gunnhildr's Blades. Simple in principle, less so in execution.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The weapons themselves and most of the texts denoting the history of Her Majesty and her guard were lost to the devastation of the Fourth Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: That said, we have managed to obtain certain pieces of information, and coupled with Master Gerolt's knowledge and expertise, we have made great strides in reproducing these vaunted blades of eld.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've worked out the manner o' weapons they wielded, their shape an' weight─even the materials needed for me forge. But we've learned bugger all about what gives 'em spirit.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It is said Queen Gunnhildr etched a holy inscription into each blade, thus granting them the power of the gods. Unfortunately, no records of any such engravings remain, but there is still hope.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Though naught but pale imitations, there once existed replicas which may very well have borne these inscriptions. Alas, they were lost when Bozja Citadel fell.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Do you know of the Bozja incident?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It sounds vaguely familiar...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes, I do. Though admittedly I do not recall it in detail.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: A bitter chapter in our history, for it would mark the end of Bozja as we knew it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: That a worldly adventurer such as yourself would know of this is of no surprise. If I may, I would share the tragic tale of our homeland.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Fifteen summers past, the Garleans were conducting experiments, seeking a means to make contact with the lesser moon, Dalamud.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: They believed the satellite to be possessed of immense power, and a lunar transmitter was erected in the hopes of harnessing it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But when the transmitter was activated and the signal sent, Dalamud responded with an immense blast of raw energy. The destruction wrought defied reckoning.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The citadel, the relics of Queen Gunnhildr's kingdom... Naught was left but smoke and ash.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hope ain't lost yet, though. The citadel's been wiped off the bloody map, aye, but there's still a way for us to find those inscriptions. Or so I've been told.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: An explanation better left to one far more knowledgeable than I.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I reckon I'll leave the lass over there to you. Scholarly types like her have a knack for rubbin' me the wrong way, an' I can't hardly understand half o' what they say in the first place.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: 'Tis good to see you again, Forename. Though I had hoped to accomplish more before your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Wait, don't tell me. Your name is...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm sure your help will be as invaluable now as it was aboard the Prima Vista.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Have I truly left so little an impression? It is I, Mikoto, of House Jinba. Do you not recall our journey together to Rabanastre?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: You are far too kind. If not for your heroism, Ramza and Alma would have...would have...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: From the onset of our endeavor, it was abundantly clear that one versed in aetherology would be essential. We relayed this to the alliance, who then introduced us to Mikoto. She is said to be one of the most brilliant minds among the Students of Baldesion.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And yet it is my ineptitude that demands your presence here. <sigh> I was all but certain that Gerolt and I alone would suffice in this, alas...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Ahem. The matter she speaks of concerns a long-forgotten practice of the holy men who once inhabited these lands. Utilizing uniquely aspected crystals, these seers were able to provide succor for those with ailments of the mind.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: They possessed the ability to shape their very memories, removing those deemed harmful and replacing them, that the patient may find some semblance of peace.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I too dismissed the notion that such practices could exist. That is, until a recent excavation unearthed compelling evidence of their work: the crystals we believe were used in their healing.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, we were unable to discern how they are meant to be used. It was at this juncture that we petitioned for Mikoto's assistance.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, lass? Made any progress?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: My initial analysis suggests the crystals were artificially created at some point in the distant past. The materials used suggest they were most likely produced by the ancestral peoples of this area.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: What's more, their aetherial signature is strikingly similar to the oscillatory activity of brain waves which, when made to resonate with the distinct-frequency NRR–type harmonic vibrations of an individual's─ Ah. I've done it again, haven't I?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I think...a simpler approach is in order. Ahem. Every living being is comprised of corporeal aether of the flesh, incorporeal aether of the soul, and the aetherial residue of their memories.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Were one to be possessed of only corporeal aether, they would be but a walking corpse. Conversely, entities comprised of only incorporeal aether are referred to in layman's terms as ghosts. In either case, they may also retain some of their residual memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, zombies and ghosts. I follow.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: These crystals are able to isolate and resonate with the aetherial signature of memories. This allowed the seers to probe the minds of their patients.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's all well an' good, lass, but what if their mind ain't what it used to be? Or they was too deep in their cups to remember what yer lookin' for?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: An excellent question, Master Gerolt. We are all possessed of two types of memory─explicit and implicit.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As their names suggest, explicit memories refer to an active remembrance of previous experiences, while implicit memories are acquired and stored passively.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: For example, when making a new acquaintance, their appearance will become part of your explicit memory, allowing you to recall that information. Should a great deal of time pass without meeting, however, such recollection can prove difficult.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Yet in that moment, your mind also takes record of the sounds and smells of the location, the temperature, and so on.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Hmm... Perhaps a demonstration would better explain this phenomenon.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Without a seer?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Don't we need some sort of spell?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Thankfully, that will not be necessary.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: When I was first told of the seers and their practices, I was immediately reminded of your ability to peer into the past.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I believe these people were blessed with a similar gift, and it is for that reason they were chosen to serve as seers.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Though I too am possessed of the Echo, I lack the ability to peer into the past as you do, and thus have been unable to wield the power of these crystals.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's why we called ye here.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Until now I could do naught but posit theories. With your help, however, I may now put them to the proof.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And you, Master Gerolt, shall be my first test subject.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text:
Forename, I would like you to recall the last time you experienced the Echo. Concentrate on that feeling.
Master Gerolt, I need you to recall a memory of the past. It may be anything you like.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye better not go pokin' around in there, diggin' up somethin' unsavory like, ye hear, lass?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Please, Master Gerolt. Focus!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: This is...most unexpected. For reasons I cannot yet explain, it appears the Echo has allowed me to accompany you into his memory.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You're a skilled smith, Gerolt, there's no denyin' that. But you hold money about as well as your liquor.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well what bloody good is money if ye can't spend it? A man has to live a little, Rowena.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye, and it wouldn't hurt for a man to use his head, neither. With all that talent o' yours, I reckon you could've amassed a small fortune by now. Could've been you sittin' on the Syndicate instead o' Godbert.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As if I'd ever want to be anythin' like that dodderin' old, half-dressed─

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Didn't realize me memory was so sharp.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As you can see, implicit memory is surprisingly comprehensive. From the clear skies and ocean waves, down to the exact words of your conversation─everything appears to have been perfectly preserved.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye...ye weren't listenin' to that, were ye?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Every time someone gives you good advice, you turn around and do the complete soddin' opposite! I used to like that rebellious streak of yours, but now I see you're just a bloody idiot. <sigh> Honestly, I don't know what I ever saw in you.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Whatever it is ye think ye saw, it ain't as if I've changed since then.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And ye haven't neither... Still as beautiful as the day we met.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Whoa, hold on a minute! I ain't never said anythin' like that! I swear on me last mug of ale!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Implicit memories, while quite comprehensive, are not always true to fact. In the case of painful or otherwise undesirable experiences, they can be obfuscated to protect oneself from hard truths.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Our perception of reality can also distort them as well, even when first committed to the mind. Then, as time passes, such distortions can grow. Happy memories become more joyous, sad ones all the more bitter.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Explicit memory is particularly sensitive to such misrepresentations of events, for man is wont to remember what is most convenient for his worldview. That is why we seek the implicit, for there we are most like to find the truth.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The truth!? Rowena and me were only here a week ago! Don't tell me my memory's that bleedin' unreliable!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: A self-imposed delusion, perhaps. As I said before, the mind has ways of concealing painful memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I, er... I ain't feelin' so well. If you'll excuse me.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As you can see, these crystals allow us to choose specific points in a person's past to observe at will. Unlike the Echo, however, what we see will not always be as it really was.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Yet there still remains the matter of finding one who has seen the replica weapons and their inscriptions.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: At this present juncture, we might as well be looking for a ghost.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: After the Garlean invasion of Bozja, it was all but cut off from the world. None were allowed in or out, meaning all of its residents─and likely any who may have glimpsed the weapons─died when the citadel was destroyed.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: ...Hmm. What about soldiers stationed there who were away at the time of the incident? Bah, even if we were able to find them, I doubt they could be persuaded to cooperate.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Ahh!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: No, please! Lord Varis... Nooo!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: You...saw it too? My visions, they...they are not of what has come to pass...but what is yet to be.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Could it be the crystal allowed us to share my vision as well?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Mikoto, Forename. Are you two all right?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Cid...? Cid Garlond? Son of the monster behind the Meteor project?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, Yugiri mentioned that Doma and the Eorzean Alliance have been receiving support from Garlond Ironworks.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I thought that the company should use such a moniker mere happenstance, but... You mean to say Cid Garlond owns this company?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The son of Midas nan Garlond...lives...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: He must be summoned at once. If he was at the citadel prior to its destruction, it's quite possible he may have seen the replicas.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Fate is indeed a cruel mistress. Pinning our hopes on a Garlean─the get of that bastard Midas, no less. Is there truly no other way?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Bajsaljen, please!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...Very well. I only hope our fallen comrades can forgive us.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Please, bring us this Cid Garlond. For the people of Bozja. For all of Ilsabard.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If it ain't about me forge, it'll have to wait, lasslad. I...I need to think.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I do not imagine he sympathizes with our plight, but from what I gather, he has no love for the Empire, either. If that will suffice in persuading him to aid us, then so be it.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I hear there are engineers stationed at Rhalgr's Reach. Perhaps you can begin your search for Garlond there.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: Say, aren't you Forename? Savior of Eorzea, liberator of Ala Mhigo, so on and so forth? The name's Lilja, newest recruit to the Ironworks. What can I do for you?

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: The chief? Too busy by half, according to Jessie. Between you and me, though, I think it's a load of─

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Oh, do go on. A load of what?

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: I was saying what a load off your shoulders it must be, knowing the chief is back from whatever he was doing. Speaking of whom, Forename said shehe wanted to speak with him about...what was it again?

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, Lilja. You might hear better than most, but you're a terrible listener.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: <sigh> ...Would you mind starting again from the beginning?

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: I see. Well, you just missed him. Seiryu's Wall is due for maintenance, and he had a mind to oversee it personally. That said, any matters concerning you are top priority. I'll see if I can reach him.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: I take it this is an average day for you? Must be hard. Always having to put on a brave face as you're thrust into danger, people tugging you this way and that like some sort of errand girlboy.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: N-Not that we don't appreciate what you do for us. Goodness knows I do. In fact, well, you see...

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: I'm something of a fan. I knew the Ironworks worked with you on occasion, but I didn't think I'd have the chance to meet you in person. Can I...can I shake your hand?

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Lilja! Cid being back took a load off of my shoulders, not yours. Don't you have work to do?

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: Oh, right! Work. Duty calls, but hopefully, we'll meet again soon!

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Chief says he'll meet you at the Doman Enclave. Not the most convenient of locations, but it'll have to do, I'm afraid.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: One more thing. The Bozja incident is something of a sore spot for the chief.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: Even if it was an accident, most people outside of the Empire remember it as a massacre.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: The chief tried to put a stop to his father's experiment, but his pleas fell on deaf ears. Even now he still blames himself for it all.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: “I should've tried harder,” he'd say. “I could've saved him. I could've saved all of them.” All that genius, and the man can't find a way to forgive himself.

dialogue.name: JESSIE
dialogue.text: So if you're aiming to go digging through his past, be careful. I dread to think what demons he's got locked away in that brain of his...

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: She's tough as magitek armor plating when she wants to be, but her heart's in the right place. A shame she's always so busy.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: As are you, if I'm not mistaken. I won't keep you any longer. Best of luck!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I believe Mikoto would be better suited to explaining the latter half of our plan.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Unless...there is something else you wished to discuss?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I do not imagine he sympathizes with our plight, but from what I gather, he has no love for the Empire, either. If that will suffice in persuading him to aid us, then so be it.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I hear there are engineers stationed at Rhalgr's Reach. Perhaps you can begin your search for Garlond there.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Unless...there is something else you wish to discuss?

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Tell me about Bozja and the Resistance.

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Tell me about Gangos.

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Tell me about the Bozja incident.

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Tell me about yourself.

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Our home rests in the southern reaches of Ilsabard, to the west of Dalmasca.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Our earliest records─or at least those we have been able to recover─suggest Bozja was founded at some point during the Third Astral Era. The Allagan Empire had reached the height of its power, and several tribes of the Hrothgar came here seeking refuge from their supremacy.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It was Queen Gunnhildr who would keep the Allagans at bay. Her radiance would light our path to prosperity, and by her grace was the nation of Bozja founded.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Alas, the Fourth Umbral Calamity would see the end of her kingdom. But those who survived slowly rebuilt, and Bozja was reborn as a city-state that would coexist with neighboring nations for centuries to come.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The Garlean Empire's rise to power changed everything. None could oppose the sheer strength and versatility of their military.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Their campaign began some fifty years ago, and now an entire generation of our people has been raised knowing only oppression. But now they would know freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: When word reached us that Ala Mhigo and Doma had risen up to defy the Empire, we seized the opportunity to flee and form pockets of resistance.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: With Lord Hien's assistance, the several groups that had formed were merged into a single, cohesive force, and I was chosen as its leader.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If the IVth Imperial Legion is able to consolidate its forces in Bozja, however, our efforts will be for naught. We have to strike back, and soon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: For the present, this is our base of operations, to the southeast of what remains of Bozja Citadel. When the fighting begins, we will hold the line here.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: For a blessing, the surrounding wetlands and the fog that persists year-round have served to conceal our operation. That is not to say, of course, we have not taken additional measures to remain hidden.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: In the unlikely event that their scouts should approach the perimeter, our mages have cast a cloaking spell around the area to keep us from sight.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Havens such as this are plentiful along the southern coast of Ilsabard. Our facilities are rather modest, I confess, but I would like to think we have made great strides in providing for our soldiers here.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Thanks to the generosity of our allies here in the East, as well as the Eorzean Alliance, we do not want for provisions or arms. All that remains is to secure the blades of Gunnhildr.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It was roughly twenty years ago, if I'm not mistaken. The Empire, fearful of the threat posed by primals and the tribes who summoned them, devised a plan to wipe them out.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The Meteor project. Through the use of magitek, they intended to recreate ancient sorcery capable of calling down meteors.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: At the helm of the project was their chief engineer, Midas nan Garlond. In time, every last one of their research facilities was involved in its development.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The project would take a perilous turn when it was discovered that the lesser moon Dalamud was, in fact, a satellite of Allagan design. They were determined to make it part of their plans.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And so they erected a colossal transmission tower, designed to control Dalamud. Its first test would also prove to be its last...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: For lack of eyewitnesses, what happened next is difficult to describe. It is often described as an explosion, but the ruins showed no signs of gunpowder or magic. We only know that a terrible light shone from the heavens that night.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: In an instant, the citadel was gone. Its citizens and soldiers...my family...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: No one is certain why Dalamud responded with such destructive force, but all work on the Meteor project was halted immediately.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Five years later, however, Nael van Darnus set the wheels of the project back into motion. His devotion was rewarded with the coming of the Seventh Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The world has already paid too great a cost for the Garleans' ambition... They must be stopped.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I was born in Bozja, though I have never known a life free from the Empire's rule.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Following in my late father's footsteps, I studied to become a doctor. Much to my surprise, and dismay, my academic accomplishments did not go unnoticed. I was taken to the capital, where I received a formal education in medicinal sciences. Deployment as a medic in their military soon followed.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: My service was ultimately rewarded with citizenship, after which I met my wife, and we started a family together. If their goal was for me to grow content and complacent, it failed, for not a day went by that I did not think about the liberation of my homeland.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But I would need to bide my time a while longer, for I was assigned to the IVth Imperial Legion. There was an uprising in Nagxia, and it fell to us to quell their insurrection. It was not until after our mission was complete that I learned of what happened to Bozja. To my family...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We returned as fast as we were able, but there was nothing left of the citadel.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I was ordered to return to the capital, but I had to find my wife and children. I covered every ilm of that barren wasteland...and nothing.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Chains and a prison cell greeted me back in Garlemald, but in spite of my confinement, whispers of what happened in Bozja eventually reached me. Of their failed experiments to control Dalamud.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Stripped of my citizenship, I expected to remain under lock and key until the end of my days. Fortunately for me, they had need of more medics for their next campaign.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But I would never reach the battlefield, for I escaped with a number of other soldiers to join the Resistance.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Many years of service to the Resistance then molded me into the man who now stands before you. And I will continue to serve for as long as it takes to see our homeland safe from the Empire.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We've enlisted the aid of a scholar from Sharlayan who would be better suited to explaining the intricacies of our plan.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Unless, of course, you have another question for me?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: That you should know Cid Garlond is hardly surprising. I only hope he is not so engrossed in his work that he cannot find time to assist us.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I will not keep you. Unless, of course, there is something you wish to ask me?

dialogue.name: Q20
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A20
dialogue.text: Tell me about the IVth Imperial Legion.

dialogue.name: A20
dialogue.text: Tell me about Legatus Noah van Gabranth.

dialogue.name: A20
dialogue.text: Tell me about Castrum Lacus Litore.

dialogue.name: A20
dialogue.text: Tell me about yourself.

dialogue.name: A20
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The initial invasion of Bozja was led by Basch van Gabranth. There would be a change of commander not long after, however.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Thirty years ago, during the invasion of Dalmasca, his health took an unexpected turn for the worse, and his son, Noah van Gabranth, oversaw the conquest to its completion. He was a mere twenty years old when he assumed full command.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The IVth Imperial Legion itself is rather unique compared to most, for the bulk of their forces are not native Garleans, their present leader included.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Both Noah and his father were quite quick to bend the knee to Emperor Solus, from what I have been told. Perhaps it was that ardent loyalty that helped them rise to such prominence.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But not all were such fervent followers of the Empire. Quite the contrary, I would hazard the greater part of their soldiers were like us, seeing little recourse but to serve lest they be put to the sword.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Though I suppose the unwavering loyalty of the IVth Imperial Legion is what serves to set it apart from the rest. Or to be more precise, its loyalty to Noah van Gabranth.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: What's more, you will come to find they are not wont to rely on magitek armaments like most imperial soldiers.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Indeed, they seem to prefer fighting the old-fashioned way, employing arcane magicks, techniques akin to summoning, and all manner of feral beasts rather than depending on heavy artillery.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Though if recent reports are to be believed, these will be the least of our concerns. The battalions en route to Bozja are said to be led by Lyon sas Helsos.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: He is a strategist whose cunning is matched only by his renown as a tamer of beasts, and it is rumored that he alone is worth more than a thousand rank-and-file troops. One might say he has history with the Resistance.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Ah yes, the leader of the IVth Imperial Legion, one of the youngest to ever take such a position. His father, Basch van Gabranth, served as legatus before him, claiming many a victory in the name of the Empire.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Basch was a knight of the Republic of Landis, which, like so many other nations, was fast to fall at the hands of the Empire. Rather than die with dignity, he was quite quick to bend the knee to their conquerors, ingratiating himself with the Emperor and earning his place as a legatus.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: This was quite a feat, given that he was not of Garlean blood. One can but imagine the lengths to which he went to earn their trust, but it is clear he labored hard to keep it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: His health took an unexpected turn for the worse during the invasion of Dalmasca, which afforded Noah the opportunity he needed to rise to prominence. And it was under Noah's leadership that Rabanastre would fall.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Then, when his father passed two years later, he was named the next legatus of the IVth Imperial Legion.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Many believe it was the conquest of Dalmasca that earned him the position, but some argue he was appointed on the recommendation of the Emperor, perhaps in recognition of his father's service to the Empire.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Regardless of the reason, Noah would continue in his father's footsteps. The IVth Imperial Legion would continue to be comprised primarily of foreign soldiers, and their loyalty to the newly appointed legatus was unfaltering.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: One might expect such a legion to remain within the Emperor's good graces, but it would not be so when Varis took the throne. For several years he appointed them to the quelling of uprisings in remote provinces, as if to keep them at arm's length.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Perhaps he suspected an ulterior motive to the Gabranths seeking to gain such fervent adoration from the IVth Imperial Legion. I have no proof, of course, but one cannot help but wonder...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: It was once known as Alermuc Fortress, erected in the hopes of deterring the Garleans. After the Bozja incident, it would be rebuilt and given a new name─Castrum Lacus Litore.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Its position to the north of Bozja will make it a critical strategic point in the battles to come. If we are to have any hope of reclaiming Bozja, we must first gain control of the castrum.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The location was originally chosen for its natural defenses. Being surrounded on all sides by steep cliffs made Alermuc Fortress all but impregnable. Assuming, of course, one had the wherewithal to defend it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: When the Garleans came, their magitek weaponry was unlike anything we had ever seen. A great many lives were lost in our struggle to hold the fortress, and in the end we were simply outmatched.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: At present, the castrum is held by Legatus Gabranth's second-in-command, Menenius rem Lanatus. An interesting choice, to say the least.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Lanatus is a well-known family with a long and august lineage. That is, until they incurred the ire of the Emperor, tarnishing their name and robbing them of their position in Garlean society.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: And yet Basch van Gabranth would choose members of their family to serve under him. Mayhap he sensed their desperation to redeem their honor. If that is the case, the road to redemption is long indeed, for two generations of Lanatus have served under the Gabranths.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Imagine the recognition they would receive for thwarting our attempts to take the fortress. You can be sure he will do all in his power to stop us.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I serve primarily as liaison 'twixt the Bozjan Resistance and our allies. I'll not deny there is still much for me to learn, but I will do everything within my power to see Bozja free of the Empire. If that should mean my life, then so be it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: You...wish to know of my past? It is no different than most, I would imagine─conscription by the Empire, which is the only reason I was not present in the citadel to die alongside my kin in the Bozja incident.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Some would call it a massacre planned by the Empire, but I am not ready to believe they would willingly kill so many of their own soldiers and engineers.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Having been raised under the Garlean doctrine, I realize that not all of them are the bloodthirsty monsters many of us would paint them to be. Though the Empire would seek to oppress us, I do not share the same animosity towards its citizens as my Resistance comrades.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But these are musings better left between the two of us, yes? I would not have the others think me a coward or a traitor to our cause.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Are you and Mikoto acquaintances by any chance? Her explanations can be...convoluted at times, but I trust she can make clear our plans.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: ...Is there anything else you wish to ask me?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The son of Midas nan Garlond. An imperial deserter... My, what curious company we keep.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Ahem. Forgive me. Is there aught you need?

dialogue.name: Q30
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A30
dialogue.text: Tell me about Queen Gunnhildr.

dialogue.name: A30
dialogue.text: Tell me about Gunnhildr's Blades.

dialogue.name: A30
dialogue.text: Tell me about the weapons you plan to forge.

dialogue.name: A30
dialogue.text: Tell me about yourself.

dialogue.name: A30
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: During the Third Astral Era, Queen Gunnhildr united the fragmented tribes of the Hrothgar to rise up and drove off the Allagans, eventually going on to found the nation of Bozja.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It should be noted that Gunnhildr was not her name, but rather a title bestowed to the current monarch of any given age. The common thread connecting all rulers of Bozja is their ability to read the stars. There were others who shared in this ability, but they were said to be the greatest seers of their respective ages.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: They were also said to be great warriors. When doing battle with the Allagans or any other would-be invaders, the queen could always be found commanding from the front lines.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Alas, Bozja would fall in the wake of the Fourth Umbral Calamity. By some miracle, some few survived and were able to build what we knew as the city-state of Bozja.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: They were the elite guard of the queen, masters of myriad arms and magicks, said to be the greatest warriors of their age.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Their combat prowess was matched only by their devotion to Queen Gunnhildr. They would not hesitate to give their lives in her service. And, should one of these warriors fall in battle, their holy blade would be passed on to a suitable successor.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Over time, their title as Gunnhildr's Blades would become synonymous with the gunblade, which gained great renown during the war against the Allagans.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: There is not a Bozjan alive who does not know the tales of their heroism. I have no doubt reforging these weapons will lend us both the strength and resolve we need to succeed.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: With Master Gerolt's help, we have nearly all that is required to reforge the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's guard.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: While it is true the legends of their might are duly inspiring, to simply call them the blades of Gunnhildr would do little to differentiate these new armaments from the weapons of eld. After all, we do not wish to give the impression that the originals have been recovered.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: After much thought, Master Gerolt offered a simple and surprisingly satisfactory suggestion of “Resistance weapons.”

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: He also went on to make a rather curious remark about the steps to be taken in their forging: that these weapons can be enhanced further in accordance with the enemies one faces.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: By the sounds of it, these weapons are never truly complete until their purpose is fulfilled.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It has been two years since I joined the Resistance. Before then I lived as all Bozjans did─under the harsh rule of the Empire.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It is the only life I have ever known, though my parents often spoke to me of what they remembered from the days of Bozja's independence.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Though it was under the auspices of our Garlean oppressors, I was educated in prehistoric archaeology.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: While I am thankful for the opportunities it afforded me, I could not turn a blind eye to the suffering of my people. And so I left to join the Resistance.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It was I who proposed to reforge the fabled weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's guard, and Bajsaljen has chosen to place his faith in my plan. I take heart in knowing all I learned from the Empire will be put to good use.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Our exploration of Master Gerolt's memories was a success. Largely in part to his trust in you, I suspect.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And how fortunate for us that you should also be a good acquaintance of Cid's. I'm sure there is much you must do to prepare, so I will not keep you.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: ...Was there something else?

dialogue.name: Q40
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A40
dialogue.text: Tell me about the seers.

dialogue.name: A40
dialogue.text: Tell me about the crystal focus.

dialogue.name: A40
dialogue.text: Tell me about memory exploration.

dialogue.name: A40
dialogue.text: Tell me about your gift.

dialogue.name: A40
dialogue.text: Tell me about yourself.

dialogue.name: A40
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Scant though they are, the records we have uncovered thus far suggest the practices of seers date back as far as the Fourth Astral Era.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: The region was plagued with all manner of natural disasters in those days, inciting great unrest not only amongst the Bozjans, but neighboring nations as well.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: It was during these tumultuous times seers first appeared. In fact, I have reason to believe they possessed the Echo.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Using a crystal focus, they were able to delve into the minds of the downcast and the heartsick, seeking out their darkest memories and altering them to ease the peoples' burdens.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Perhaps they saw the altering of minds as a necessity for their survival, but we must consider the ethical implications of such methods in this day and age. I have no doubt my betters in Sharlayan would consider it to be reprehensible.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: My initial analysis of the crystals suggests they are man-made. Nothing in my data can prove the materials are unique to this region, which leads me to believe the Bozjans─or rather, the seers─created them.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: However, given the intricate lattices found in these crystals, it seems highly improbable that the Bozjans could have produced them, considering the methods available to them in the Fourth Astral Era.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: In fact, on closer inspection, it became clear that its structure is quite similar to that found in Allagan constructs.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Which then begs the question: who were the seers, and whence did they come? This is but a working theory, but I suspect their roots can be traced back to the Allagans themselves─perhaps survivors of the Fourth Umbral Calamity who wished to atone for the sins of their forebears.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: They came to these lands seeking a means to help the Bozjans, and in doing so created these crystal foci.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. As I said, 'tis but a working theory. Though I understand if it sounds more like a flight of fancy.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Perhaps I should start with a simple explanation, as I did before. Let us consider the composition of a person's aether, shall we? There is corporeal aether of the flesh, incorporeal aether of the soul, and the aetherial residue of an individual's memories.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Were one to be possessed of only corporeal aether, they would be but a walking corpse. Conversely, entities comprised of only incorporeal aether are referred to in layman's terms as ghosts. Of course, a ghost that possesses residual memories could likely recall its past and retain self-awareness.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Using a crystal focus, we can isolate the aetherial signature of memories, much in the same way the seers did. We can then delve into and explore specific memories conjured by the subject.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: We must be careful of what we observe, however, for while the information stored in a person's memories can be quite comprehensive, it is not always true to fact. They can be distorted due to the passage of time, or even when first committed to the mind as a result of personal bias.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: That is why it is important to mark the distinction between explicit and implicit memories.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Explicit memories are those consciously stored and recalled, while implicit memories are more passively accumulated by our subconscious.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: When meeting someone for the first time, their appearance will be kept as part of our explicit memory, though this may fade with the passing of time. Should a great deal of time pass without meeting, however, such recollection can prove difficult.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Yet in that moment, your mind also takes record of everything experienced by your sensory nervous system.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, information called from explicit memory is quite sensitive to misrepresentations of events. After all, if an individual is actively choosing to recall an event, who is to say they will not make alterations to better suit their liking?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: That is why we seek information from implicit memory, which is more likely to be preserved free of the bias of an individual's worldview.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: The Echo can manifest itself in myriad ways dependent on the individual. I was gifted with the ability to peer into the future.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: It is a power much like prophetic dreams and divinations, and yet quite different, for such visions only tell of the future's potential.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: The Echo does not show me what may happen, but what will happen.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Scholars speculate Mezaya Thousand Eyes too shared this gift, hence the alarming accuracy of the passages writ in her Divine Chronicles.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: These visions are a decidedly rare occurrence, usually containing some crucial insight into matters presently unfolding before me. For better or worse, I have never had visions of an impending threat on my life or those around me.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Not that I would want to see such things, of course. Could you imagine, knowing of certain doom that cannot be avoided?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I once spoke of my visions to an acquaintance─a relatively harmless glimpse of the future─and it resulted in a terrible argument. I fear I could not bear the weight of grimmer tidings...

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: But that is neither here nor there. My gift is but a trivial thing. Nothing you should think to rely upon.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: About me!? Oh, there really isn't much to tell, I assure you!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Well, if you must know... Due to advanced placement I found myself attending the Studium much earlier than most. My research in the field of aetherology would eventually earn me the title of Archon. When I am not conducting research in the field, I conduct lectures at the Studium.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Moenbryda is, er...was...my mentor. I would not be the scholar I am today if not for her. I have fond memories of the many nights we toiled together working on her original plans for the aetheric siphon. She was like a sister to me.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, I do have a sister, actually. An identical twin, in fact. Though we have not spoken since she too was named an Archon.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: She was my better in all aspects of academia, but she often disagreed with the views of the Forum. I can but assume that is why she took her leave of the Studium.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: She was always so strong-willed and quite critical of those around her. Sadly, we never got along very well growing up. I often wonder if that is why Moenbryda was so quick to take me under her wing.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I still see her, in my dreams. Always offering a warm smile and words of encouragement.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: If we were to use the crystal focus, perhaps there would be a way to speak with her again. A tempting prospect, but in the end, I know it would not truly be her...

obj.n: ガーロンド社の事務員
信力のエクスマテリジャ
剛柔のエクスマテリジャ
戦技のエクスマテリジャ
詠唱のエクスマテリジャ
シタデル・ボズヤ蒸発事変

quest.name: シタデル・ボズヤ蒸発事変
journal: The Ironworks engineer is confused as to why you are still here and not at the Doman Enclave.

You begin to strike up another conversation with Lilja who, perhaps fearing the ire of her superiors, quickly directs you to the Doman Enclave. Rather than engage her with more friendly banter, you set your sights on the enclave to meet with Cid.

You arrive at the Doman Enclave to find Cid preoccupied with the calm and quiet of the settlement, but his stern expression makes clear he understands why he has come. Though apprehensive of what awaits him at Gangos, Cid reaffirms his commitment to helping the Bozjan Resistance. Together you board the airship which bears the two of you to Gangos.

Together with Mikoto you delve into Cid's memories of Bozja Citadel. An arduous journey through his mind eventually leads you to a massive transmission tower, wherein you confront a manifestation of Cid's trauma in the form of Lord Varis.

The phantom of Cid's past is laid low, but something about this glimpse into the past still appears amiss. Realizing Lord Varis had no reason to be present at the citadel, he strains to remember who was the source of this anguished memory. In an instant his mind becomes clear, and the visage of Lord Varis is replaced by the man who shot him so many years ago─his own father, Midas nan Garlond. What's more, a closer inspection reveals he is in fact a thrall of the dreadwyrm Bahamut. With the mystery of Cid's past brought to light, you return to the waking world with the inscriptions of the blades of Gunnhildr, as well as an onerous truth.

Gerolt has begun work on reforging the blades of Gunnhildr, bringing the people of Bozja one step closer to reclaiming their homeland. There is much to do in preparation for their encounter with the Empire, and Marsak bids you speak with Gerolt to learn what part you yet have to play.
objectives: Ask after Cid at the Doman Enclave.
Speak with Mikoto.
Speak with Marsak.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If it ain't about me forge, it'll have to wait, lasslad. I...I need to think.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: The chief said he'd be meeting you at the Doman Enclave, didn't he? Well, best not keep him waiting.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSCLERK
dialogue.text: As much as I enjoy your company, I understand duty calls. Hopefully we'll have the chance to talk another time.

dialogue.name: AIRSHIPGUIDE
dialogue.text: Master Garlond? Yes, I've seen him restlessly pacing about the enclave. If you wait here, I'm sure he'll come by before long.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's hard to believe this place was, until recently, occupied by the Garleans. Doma has a long way to go before it regains its former glory, but they're off to a good start.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: So I've heard. If the Bozjans wish to follow the Domans' lead, I plan to do what I can to help them.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: In fact, I've already spoken to Lord Hien and agreed to divert part of the Ironworks' resources to assist in Doma's reconstruction.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The offer seemed to have taken him by surprise, but I assured him that in addition to the Ironworks' commitment to freedom through technology, I have my own reasons to reverse the destruction wrought by the Empire.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: While it's true that I eventually defected, I played no small part in the development of magitek now used by their military.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: <sigh> Sometimes it's the threads you can't see that have the strongest ties. Would that I could cut them.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: And how did Lord Hien take your response?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The Empire's sins aren't yours to bear.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Our talks were focused mainly on the reconstruction, as we thought it best to wait for your arrival to discuss how I might help the Bozjans.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Even so, not a day goes by that I don't think about the part I played in the atrocities they committed.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: <sigh> If I could have made my father see reason, there would have been no Bozja incident.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...But I was powerless to stop him.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Yes, you're right. There's a time for wallowing in self-pity and a time for action. I plan to do whatever I can for the Bozjan Resistance, but they're up against the IVth Legion...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If they're to stand a chance, their allies here in the East won't be enough. They're going to need all the help they can muster.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I'm not entirely sure what part I'll have to play in all this, and I doubt anything I do now will be enough to atone for my past mistakes.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But if it means throwing a spanner in the Empire's works, then count me in.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: He can fashion all manner o' magitek gadgets and whatnot, I'll give him that, but if it's a kettle yer after, that's where ol' Gerolt really shines.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon speaking with Mikoto, several cutscenes will play in sequence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 80 or above to proceed.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed and speak with Mikoto?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: If you are ready, I would begin our exploration. Think back to your time at Bozja Citadel. You needn't focus on a specific memory, if that helps.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: All right. Just promise me you'll be careful in there.

dialogue.name: SOLUSZOSGALVUS
dialogue.text: (-Solus zos Galvus-)Know your place, whelp. The Meteor project cannot─will not─be stopped. Certainly not by the likes of you.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: No... No, this is wrong. Emperor Solus couldn't have been there.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: No, please! Lord Varis... Nooo!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Cid! Cid, you mustn't forget─this is only a memory!

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: Cid Garlond, bringer of ruin. Herald of ash. Your father must be proud.

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: How does it feel to know such calamity follows in your wake? That your failings bring death to all you hold dear?

dialogue.name: VARIS
dialogue.text: And now you would set this filth against me. Very well...

dialogue.name: VARIS
