dialogue.text: That's where these beauties come in─the defluxion aether manipulators, Mark II and Mark III! What sets them apart from the first model, you may ask...? Well, apart from the name, not a lot, but they are newer, if that counts for anything!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Though we both wish we could go with you, I fear we would only slow you down. Please, be safe out there.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)You have reached the designated location, yes? Readying transmission protocols.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)So far, so good. Has the D.A.M. burrowed into the ground?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Excellent. Proceed to the next site, and stay vigilant─there is no telling when you may encounter imperial forces.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Excellent. Return to the outpost and we shall handle the rest.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Imperials? They didn't get the better of you, did they? No... I suppose you wouldn't be contacting me if they did. <sigh> I really must learn not to jump to conclusions... Ahem.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)The D.A.M. appears to be fully operational. How are things there?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Excellent. Proceed to the next site, and stay vigilant─there is no telling when you may encounter imperial forces.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Excellent. Return to the outpost and we shall handle the rest.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Welcome back. Our sensors detect steady streams of aether flowing toward the site of the new outpost.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Now it is up to the Resistance to drive away the imperials. Once they have, a substantial confluence of energy should be available to power a new barrier.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Well, everything seems to be under control here, so I'd better get going.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Oh, right. Mikoto's gathered some promising data to help the chief deal with the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: It pertains to my findings on the inner workings of the crystal foci. I believe it may be of use to him.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: The chief said he'd be heading back to Doma after finishing maintenance on Seiryu's Wall. Rather than drag him all the way back here, it seems quicker if I take the data to him myself. But don't worry─I'll be back before you know it.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Ah, before I go... Mikoto. Is there anything else you'd like me to pass on to Cid?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: It's not good to keep your emotions bottled up like that, you know. Why don't you tell him how you feel?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text:
How I f─ <gasp> Lilja! That is wholly and utterly unprofessional! I-I would never... He would never! And even if we did, we...
This is neither the time nor the place to discuss such matters!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I think it is. I've seen far too many people live to regret words left unspoken.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Just think on it, will you? And try not to miss me while I'm away!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Um... Is there any chance you could forget that entire conversation?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I was only joking, but thank you for trying!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: To tell the truth, since entering the Studium, my life has had but one singular purpose─the pursuit of knowledge. Yet for all my research and scholarly works, I never learned what it truly means to live.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: At least, that is what Moenbryda would tell me. She would often admonish me, always insisting I spend time with the other students, or at the very least step away from my dusty tomes for some fresh air.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Perhaps she hoped I might find someone I cherished more than my books, though sadly she never had the chance to see it.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Cid is truly a remarkable man, and I'll not deny our shared interest in the sciences. During the short time we've worked together, we've become good friends.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And as his friend, I understand the great burdens of his mind. Even now, he struggles to break free from his ties to the Empire and his father's terrible legacy...

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Which is why I wish to do all within my power to support him. As a friend, mind you. My feelings toward Cid are similar to those I felt for Moenbryda─respect and admiration.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As much as I hate to disappoint Lilja, that is the way of things. So please, don't read too deeply into it.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: M-Master Gerolt! What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Better question'd be what are you doin' here? Should be you payin' the visit to Cid in Doma.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Nothin' to be embarrassed about, lass. All romances have to start somewhere, and I agree the two o' ye make a good match.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But you need to act quick. Even I can see the man's a fine glass of ale, and I reckon it won't be long afore some pretty thing snatches him up to take a swig.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Well? Is it ready?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: The modifications will require more time.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: You can't be serious! It's been ages since the damn thing was excavated. Have the engineers been sitting around with their thumbs up their arses all this time!?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Far from it. Given that this is unexplored territory, we must proceed with caution.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Tell that to the Resistance soldiers a stone's throw from our bloody front door. It won't be long before they tear it down.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Why not withdraw to Dalmasca? Surely they can finish their modifications on the way back?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Withdraw? You would abandon everything we have labored for here in Bozja? And that is not all we stand to lose... Surely, you have not forgotten the events of Castrum Meridianum?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: I only know what I've heard, that Gaius's pet ended up biting the hand that fed it before turning the place upside down.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Not quite the wording used in the reports, but accurate enough... Knowing his plans would soon be thwarted, he deployed an anti-eikon warmachina in a final attempt to drive back the Eorzean forces. He could not contain its power, and because of his hubris, the castrum was wiped off the map.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: In short, the relics of the Allagans are not to be trifled with. It takes but one mistake for our plans to fall to ruin.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: And yet Sicinius has seen fit to scurry off to some far-flung hole when he's needed most. This was his scheme, not ours. He should be the one overseeing all this.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: ...Perhaps you should put this pent-up frustration of yours to use outside. After all, in light of Misija's recent failure, it now falls to us to rout the Resistance.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Really? You're asking me to go out there? Hah, it's about damn time!

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Hmph. Somehow I knew you would relish the opportunity to get your hands dirty.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Oh, I assure you they'll be absolutely filthy by the time I return.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: It seems the Resistance already has their sights set on another potential outpost site. I can only hope they secure the location without heavy losses.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Dmitar after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.

quest.name: シドの切り札
journal: Bajsaljen's furrowed brow suggests the tide of battle may be turning for the worse.
objectives: Speak with Lilja.
Investigate the designated location.
Speak with Lilja.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. We have urgent tidings from the field.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Our spies dispatched to the enemy encampment have at last uncovered the reason for the IVth Legion relocating to Zadnor.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: This plateau is home to a number of Allagan ruins, which are what drew Menenius here.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)This isn't the first time the Empire has shown an interest in such relics...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Ah, I am glad you could join us. May I ask to what you are referring?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: This is all reminiscent to the XIVth Legion's excavation of the Allagan ruins in Ala Mhigo. It was there that they discovered the Ultima Weapon...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: By the gods... The similarities are striking.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our scouts report that the imperials have unearthed a vast relic. They describe it as “monstrous to behold.”

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: So we do have another Allagan abomination to contend with. Wonderful...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Its excavation was completed some time ago, but they have yet to finish loading it onto the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Perhaps they have something else in mind. It's more likely Menenius is testing it first. Or maybe...he's planning to test it on us.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Knowing the imperials, I daresay you are right. All the more reason we must break through the enemy lines and bring their schemes to an end.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Cid, can we assume your unexpected return means you have found a way to combat the Dalriada?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Yes, I believe so.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: After analyzing the data Mikoto provided on the crystal focus, we should be able to put its energies to good use. Hopefully with explosive results.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: You...wish to make a bomb of the crystal focus?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Not exactly. After reading over your analysis of its unique aetherial signature, we thought it warranted an investigation of practical applications.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: We found that with a little help from us, the focus is able to attune to the wavelength of ceruleum and cause it to destabilize.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Ceruleum has ever been known to be a volatile substance. If it can be agitated by energy emitted from the crystal focus, then...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Precisely. We can ignite the very lifeblood of the warship, destroying it from within!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That's our theory, at any rate. Unfortunately, the crystal focus doesn't possess the energy we require for that level of destabilization.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Don't worry, though. The chief's already thought of a solution, and it's right here in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Luckily for us, the aether that permeated the land at the time of the Bozja incident is at our disposal.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If we can use that residual energy to momentarily overcharge the crystal focus, it should release a pulse potent enough to detonate the ceruleum.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Even if we can't destroy the warship, the engines would at least be severely damaged.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Should your plan succeed, it would cease to be a threat, if only for a short while.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hopefully, this will give us the opening we need. The aetherwave amplifier I designed for the task should have arrived in Doma by now, but we still have to find a way of transporting it and the crystal focus behind enemy lines.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: You'll not find an airship faster than Ba'Gamnan's pride and joy, the Ia'sar. Rinok can have it here in no time at all.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Perfect. Once it arrives, I'll see to shielding its engine against the crystal focus.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: For our part, we will launch a diversionary assault on a nearby camp to draw their attention away from the Ia'sar. If, by some chance, we are able to advance on the Dalriada's position, all the better.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I like the way you think, Bajsaljen.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I've a job for you as well, Forename. We're going to need to place another D.A.M. near the aether current closest to the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I've made a few modifications to allow for manual redirection of the aether it collects. When the Ia'sar passes overhead, I want you to channel it directly to us.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: So you mean to fly into enemy territory and release this burst of energy from the sky? But any number of things could go wrong, not to mention how dangerous it is!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Which is why I intend to pilot the Ia'sar myself. I need to be on board to trigger the pulse, and lest you forget, I don't just build airships, I pilot them, too.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I am sorry, Cid, but I cannot allow it. If anything should happen to you...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I have to, Bajsaljen. For you, and for the people of Bozja. To make amends for what happened all those years ago.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: I should warn you, Ia'sar means “tornado” in the Dalmascan tongue, and like its namesake, our ship is wild and unforgiving. Luckily for you, Rinok is one of a select few ever to have mastered her. She will take the helm.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: ...I would accompany you as well.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There's no need to put yourself in harm's way, Mikoto. Your place is here, helping the others.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Well, the truth is, I... I had another vision. Of the two of us aboard the Ia'sar.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: We were successful in overcharging the crystal focus and, as you predicted, it rendered the imperials' warship inoperable. Forename too bore witness to this vision.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Is that so?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's true.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: (Give the gravest of nods.)

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: In that case, you'll be coming with us.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If Mikoto has foreseen it, our victory is assured... I will have our soldiers make ready at once!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Mikoto, would you mind accompanying me to Doma? The aetherwave amplifier still needs a little fine-tuning, and I could do with a touch of your scholarly knowledge.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: There you are! I've tried locating a current close to the imperials' warship, but there's nothing in range of the spectrometer. If we're to have any chance of finding one, I'm going to need you to place a sensor out there.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Oh, and so you know, we've asked Bwagi to operate the D.A.M. once it's in place. With the fighting on the southern front dying down, he thought his time would be better spent helping us here.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I've marked an ideal spot on your map. When the sensor is set, contact me via linkpearl and I'll fire up the spectrometer.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Soldiers, eh? By the sounds of it, they didn't put up much of a fight. Well, whenever you're ready, I'm standing by.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Signal detected. Everything seems to be working as it should. You're clear to head back, Forename.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Thanks again for your help. It shouldn't be long before the analysis is complete.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: While we wait for the results, I have to ask...

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: That vision you and Mikoto saw. She's hiding something, isn't she?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I know Mikoto would never lie to us, but I can't help but think she's not telling us the whole truth.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Mikoto is not the only one withholding information. Whatever you are hiding, I suggest you spit it out.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Surely we should consult Bajsaljen and the others, no? There must be something we can do to prevent Mikoto from falling.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Mikoto said her visions of the future aren't something that might happen, but will happen. One way or another, she's going to fall.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: And don't forget─we were all there in her vision, preoccupied with one thing or another. <sigh> It's hopeless...

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Nonsense! Our fates are only decided when we let others decide them for us. Cheer up, lass. We will find a way to save her.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Right... <sniffle> Of course. There's still hope.

dialogue.name: QUEENGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text:
You forget yourself... You forget the duty of Gunnhildr.
There can be no Bozja without her children.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I don't know what I'd do if something were to happen to any of you.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: So you can be damn sure I'll do my part to keep everyone safe. I promise!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Bajsaljen after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.

obj.n: マーチ・オブ・ザ・ブラッディ・クイーン

quest.name: マーチ・オブ・ザ・ブラッディ・クイーン
journal: The look of steely resolve in Bajsaljen's eyes suggests the hour of battle draws nigh.

The Resistance stands ready to march against the IVth Legion in the hopes of distracting them long enough for Cid to carry out his plan. If all goes well, the Dalriada will be disabled, perhaps giving Bajsaljen and his troops the edge needed to rout the imperials once and for all.

Lilja has finished work on the D.A.M., and has even found the ideal location at which to set it. However, a number of final adjustments have to be made on-site, meaning that she must accompany you out onto the battlefield.

While seeking a suitable spot to set the D.A.M., you are assaulted by a small unit of IVth Legion soldiers. They prove no match for your martial prowess, and it is not long before you and Lilja resume preparing the D.A.M.

With the D.A.M. in place, the Resistance is ready to set their plan in motion. What they were not expecting, however, was for the Dalriada to roar to life. Undeterred by the not-so-small setback of the imperial warship entering the fray, Cid succeeds in activating the aetherwave amplifier, and the Dalriada is forced to make an emergency landing. The sight of this emboldens the Resistance, and so they prepare to press forward.

The Dalriada has been rendered inoperable, but it remains to be seen what armaments yet remain within. Even so, there may never come a finer opportunity for the Resistance to strike, and Bajsaljen intends to seize it. He asks that you accompany his troops into the warship, and at last put an end to the IVth Legion's schemes to control Bozja.

※Players may enter the Dalriada via the associated critical engagement.

With Lyon and Menenius defeated, the IVth Legion's plans appear to have fallen to ruin. There is no time to revel in your victory, however, for the Allagan weapon, which lay dormant in the ship, breaks free from its confines. It takes to the sky and begins amassing energy to release in an attack of cataclysmic proportions. Before delivering its fatal blow to the people of Bozja, however, Queen Gunnhildr appears, her holy blade in hand. The two entities clash overhead, the ensuing explosion claiming both the Allagan weapon and the queen.

The threat of the IVth Legion and their Allagan weapon is no more. You thought to speak with Bajsaljen, but Marsak informs you he has already returned to Gangos. After your many travails together, the Resistance leader would no doubt welcome you to reflect on this historic victory.

You expect to find Bajsaljen in the midst of merrymaking, but instead he is already hard at work setting the foundation for a new Bozja. The myriad factions that comprised the Resistance originally came together out of necessity, but if all goes to plan, the dream of a united Bozja may very well soon become a reality.

The fight for freedom is won, and now work to rebuild may begin in earnest. Only time will tell what manner of nation Bozja will become, but you have every confidence it will prove a beacon of peace and prosperity to which others will aspire.
objectives: Speak with Lilja.
Investigate the designated location.
Speak with Bajsaljen.
Enter the Dalriada.
Speak with Marsak.
Return to Gangos.
Speak with Marsak.
Speak with Bajsaljen.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. We have finished preparations for a full-scale assault. We will keep the imperials occupied, while Cid executes his plan to disable the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Our work on the aetherwave amplifier is complete, and the crystal focus has been mounted on board the Ia'sar. That said, it's hard to gauge the range of the pulse it will generate. In the event things don't go to plan, have your men ready to disperse.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: You have nothing to worry about, Cid. The amplifier will work. I have seen it.

dialogue.name: RINOK
dialogue.text: Forename, it's been far too long. A pity our meeting is under such dire circumstances. But never fear, Cid and Mikoto'll be in good hands aboard the Ia'sar.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: The amplifier has been loaded onto the ship, and the engine has been insulated against the blast.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: That's not all. The Mark IV D.A.M. is ready to go, and I've found just the place to put it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our plan for the upcoming battle is twofold. First and foremost, we must draw the enemy's attention on the ground, affording the crew of the Ia'sar the opportunity to disable the warship.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: This will throw their forces into disarray, granting us the opportunity to press forward and, gods willing, remove the head of their detachment here in Bozja.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We speak, of course, of their commander Menenius sas Lanatus. It will be no easy endeavor, however, for we must also contend with the likes of Lyon rem Helsos and his entourage of beasts. Nevertheless, we mustn't lose heart. Remain vigilant, remember your training, and I have faith the day will be ours.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: For Bozja!!!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Well, I guess we'd better get to work too, eh? First things first: setting up the D.A.M.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: The location is right there, on your map. Trouble is, there are a few final adjustments that have to be made on-site, meaning I'll have to come along. You can handle any imperials that show up...right?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Everything's set, Chief. Sending the coordinates now.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text:
(-Cid-)We'll be there as soon as we can.
Rinok, Mikoto, it's time to head out.
Did you get all that, Bajsaljen?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: (-Bajsaljen-)We will hold their attention for as long as we can. Godsspeed.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: <gasp> Oh, no! The warship...!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Damn it! Are we too late?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Sir, look!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The Ia'sar... Gods, please let his plan work.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Ahhh!!!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells was that!?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Could it be the Allagan weapon is operational?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERA04088
dialogue.text: Sir, the target is too small to score a direct hit!

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: They won't be so lucky a second time. Fire again!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERB04088
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, sir! Energy levels at 45%...

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Bad news, I'm afraid. The amplifier has been damaged and we've lost the coordinates of the D.A.M!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Of all the rotten luck!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Cid-)Did you catch that, Lilja? We've lost the coordinates!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Cid-)Quickly, send up a flare!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Understood, Chief!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Now! Activate the D.A.M!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Come on, don't fail me now!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERA04088
dialogue.text: The engines─they've shut down! Preparing for emergency landing!

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Mikoto, nooo!!!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Take us down. Now!

dialogue.name: RINOK
dialogue.text: Right!

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your Sharlayan companion is safe, though I cannot say the same for you at present. It would behoove you to retreat.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What? Who is this?

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Fran. General of the Dalmascan resistance. We may save the pleasantries for when you are returned to Camp Vrdelnis.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text:
(-Cid-)Fran...? Right, Jenomis has told me about you.
All right, heading back now.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Forename. Bwagi said I would find you here. From what I gather, you are no stranger to conflict with the imperials.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Should they be defeated here, it will deal a heavy blow to the IVth Legion, who yet occupy my homeland of Dalmasca. One by one, we will reclaim those lands that were stolen from us.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: And be it the Empire or any other would-be tyrant, we will never surrender to those who would deny us our freedom.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: I suspect we are of a similar mind on such matters, and I am honored to have the opportunity to fight at your side.

dialogue.name: ROSTIK
dialogue.text: Soon it will all be over. Oh Father... Would that you could have lived to see this day.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Our plan worked, Blade Surname! The Dalriada was forced to make an abrupt landing after the amplifier released its pulse, just as Cid predicted.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We did not all emerge from the encounter unscathed, however. Lilja was badly wounded. We have done what we can for her, but she needs proper medical attention.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I've already spoken with Lord Hien, and his chirurgeons are ready and awaiting her arrival in Doma.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Could I trouble you for use of the Ia'sar?

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Yes, we'd be glad to help.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I would accompany her to Doma as well, if that's all right.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: This wouldn't have happened if not for me...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You may have glimpsed the future, but you didn't see everything. There was no way of knowing for certain what would happen to any of us.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Using the amplifier was my plan, but we all knew the risks involved, including Lilja. This is a war we're fighting, after all.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But this is hardly the time to discuss such matters. We have a long journey ahead of us, and I daresay your healing magicks will be of great comfort to her until we reach Doma.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: While they tend to our wounded comrade, let us deliver the final blow to the enemy. With the Dalriada disabled, and reinforcements newly arrived from Dalmasca, we may never have a finer opportunity to strike.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: We will offer whatever assistance we can if it means defeating the IVth Imperial Legion.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Though we can offer little in the way of materiel, I have brought several vehicles which I believe will prove helpful in this final endeavor.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: General Fran, you have our gratitude. I will see they are put to good use.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It is time we make ready. The coming battle will decide the fate of Bozja.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But as we have seen, our enemy is willing to employ any means at their disposal, no matter how reckless or deplorable. We have reason to believe they have obtained a deadly new weapon, and we must be prepared to adapt our strategy as the situation warrants.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. May we count on your assistance one last time?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We will free Bozja. Together!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: One way or another, we're putting an end to this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And there you have it! Time and again shehe has fought at our side, and we have overcome many a foe. Now, we stride into battle once more, and by the grace of the gods, victory will be ours!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: 'Tis true the imperials' presence in the sky is greatly diminished, but Menenius has yet to reveal this Allagan weapon of his. And that is to say nothing of Lyon and his beasts.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Our victory will not be easily won, but I have faith that, together, we will prevail in the end.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: For godssake, boy. What did I tell you about bowing out with a bit of grace? It's over, Menenius. We've lost.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Even so, the relic cannot...must not fall into the hands of the Bozjans. I will have it jettisoned from the Dalriada into the ruins whence it came. Once our troops have been evacuated, I will engage the ship's self-destruct sequence and seal the entrance, keeping the relic beyond the reach of those savages.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, you are to take the rest of our detachment back to Dalmasca and crush the resistance. Then─and only then─are you to return here and reclaim Gabranth's weapon. Am I understood?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: So it's the coward's way out, is it? Not man enough to face him after your resounding failure?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: It was I Gabranth entrusted with the Dalriada, his final hope of claiming these lands as his own. If that hope is to die here, then I would perish with it. I have naught but my life to offer to make amends for all we have lost.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Look, Menenius, everyone's bound to have a spot of bad luck eventually, even you. Now isn't the time for drastic measures.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: As much as I'd enjoy seeing an arrogant, forked-tongued prig such as yourself go down in a fiery ball of ruin, I know Gabranth still has a part for you to play.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: If you want to bury the relic, fine─I'll even help you. But when we're done, we go and speak with him together and explain what happened. All right?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Your stubbornness never ceases to confound me.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Good. If that's what it takes to get through to you, I'll be as stubborn as I like.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Hmph. And you would call me the arrogant one.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now access the critical engagement “the Dalriada.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This critical engagement will be initiated when a sufficient number of players with access to the Dalriada are present in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, by completing other skirmishes and critical engagements, the time required before the Dalriada can be initiated again will be reduced.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be sure to prepare lost actions from the lost finds cache, as they may prove key to turning the tide of battle.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I know not what Menenius has unearthed in the ruins, but I would rather not afford him time to employ it.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Let us be swift, Blade Surname, and put an end to him and the IVth Legion.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname! Thank goodness you are unharmed.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: What is this place...?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Lyon!? Menenius!?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Everyone! Fall back, now!

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Menenius, you fool! ...It's not supposed to end like this!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: This is the Allagan relic!?

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: By the gods... It will destroy us all!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: In the name of Queen Gunnhildr, I will not allow you to harm these children of Bozja.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Queen Gunnhildr, she...she saved us.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Oh Misija...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: No... Leave me be...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Please, Misija, you must hold on. I promised you we will rebuild Bozja, and I want you to see it for yourself.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: For...what purpose...? Remorse? Repentance?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Do not...misunderstand, Bajsaljen...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text:
I...care not...for forgiveness.
Today...I fulfilled my duty...to the queen... Nothing more.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I am a Bozjan, yes. But also an imperial... A traitor...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Justice...must be served. The people...demand it.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Fulfill your duty... As I have mine... Please...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Grant her request.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Leave her be.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Grant her request.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Leave her be.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Thank you...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: No, Blade Surname. She is gone.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If it must be done, I will do it.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Farewell, Misija. Until we meet again...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: No, Blade Surname. This is not your burden to bear.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your sacrifice will not be forgotten, Misija. And I pray it need never again be repeated.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Please, Blade Surname. Let me grant her this final mercy.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Good-bye, Misija. May the queen bless you and keep you...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: At long last, victory is ours. There are still remnants of the IVth Legion to contend with, but I believe it is safe to say the war for Bozja is over.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Many of our brothers and sisters were lost on our path to freedom, but I take heart in knowing that their sacrifices were not in vain. That our dream of a new Bozja will finally come true.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Bajsaljen has returned to Gangos, and I have no doubt he would be glad for your company.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: ...Misija? We thought it best if her remains were not returned to Gangos. To some, she was naught more than a hated enemy, and even in death, she would be an object of their scorn. But rest assured, I will see to it personally that she is given a proper burial.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. Words can scarcely convey my gratitude for all you have done for the people of Bozja.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though the fight for Bozja is over, our work is far from done. When faced with the IVth Legion, the Bozjan Resistance stood as a united, cohesive unit. But I now foresee disputes between its various factions as they seek to pursue their individual aims.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: For that reason, I wish to first create a council of leaders, that we might discuss and establish laws to govern our people.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I have already begun drafting documents that may one day serve as our constitution, though it remains to be seen if they will meet with the others' approval.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: You see, I have chosen to base a number of my writings on the principles of the IVth Legion.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: With all due respect, sir, I do not think it wise to openly admit to borrowing from the imperial doctrine of all things. The people would be up in arms!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: They deserve to know the truth, Marsak, and I have my reasons for choosing such an approach.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: While many of us dedicated ourselves to the Resistance, there are those who would rather live in peace, even if that means submitting to imperial rule. Some, like Misija, saw the Empire's ways as preferable to our own.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: To discard everything that came as a result of the occupation would cause more harm than good. There are many things introduced by the imperials from which we stand to benefit, and it would be foolish to dismiss them simply because they came from the enemy.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Make no mistake─the Bozja I intend to build will be free of discrimination and poverty. A nation of the people, by the people, and for the people. As such, it will require the understanding and cooperation of all.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A great deal of blood has been shed that we might come this far, and I pray we never forget, that we may never again have to endure such tragedy.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Well, I for one have every confidence that you will lead Bozja to a bright and prosperous future. If Ala Mhigo and Doma are able to thrive, I see no reason why Bozja can't do the same.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Cid. Mikoto. Welcome back.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And here I thought you might actually take a moment to enjoy your hard-earned victory. Such steadfast dedication to rebuilding Bozja is proof enough the people are in good hands.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Did Lilja not return with you? Has she yet to recover?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It was touch and go at first, extracting the shrapnel from her stomach, but she's doing much better now. You should have seen her protesting when we insisted she stay behind to rest.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Forename! I was worried sick about you. Right when you needed me most, I let my guard down... Sorry I couldn't be there with you to the end.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You did your best, and that's all I could ask for.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Never mind that. How are your wounds?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)That... That means a lot coming from you. <sniffle> More than you know...

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)I've never felt better! As a matter of fact, I was about to gather my things and head back to─gah! My stomach!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Sounds like the chirurgeons are taking good care of you, Lilja, and I trust you won't be giving them any trouble. It'd be a shame if I had to send Jessie to keep an eye on you.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Jessie!? ...I think I'd prefer the shrapnel.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What in the─ <hic> Why're ye all standin' about like a bunch o' prissy─ <hic> prissy ol' maids? Ye won, didn't ye? Relax! Come an' have a pint or two! Or three! <hic>

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Wheresoever your path may lead, it seems fortune sees fit to smile upon you. Not only have you led the Resistance to rout the IVth Legion, by some miracle the weapon they unearthed from these lands was also vanquished. On behalf of the people of Dalmasca, you have my sincerest thanks.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Of course, the war is not truly over until we have dealt with Gabranth. He is no doubt planning his next move, and I intend to be prepared for our next encounter with the imperials. When that time comes, I daresay we would benefit from your assistance.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Until the next time. Perhaps in Dalmasca.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Another nation freed, following in the footsteps of Doma and Ala Mhigo. A dream realized thanks in part to one troubled soul whom I shall never forget for all my days.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: In the eyes of the people she will forever remain a criminal. A traitor. Yet it was she who delivered us from certain destruction.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Her crimes were said to be unforgivable, but what of ours? Was it not our callousness, our animus, that fueled her hatred?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I squandered every opportunity to guide her, ignored every unspoken plea for help. Her loss is a scar on my heart that will never heal. A ceaseless reminder of my inadequacy and shame.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Can you sense anything?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Then it is as I thought. The last of the blade's residual aether is spent. The queen is no more...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Who could have foreseen that Misija would carry on Queen Gunnhildr's duty? Protecting her people to the very last.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Did she believe her final act could effect change in the world? Or, perhaps, did she at last find the means to do so within herself? An arduous task in either case. <sigh> A pity we will never know.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The lady of blades, Save the Queen, was returned to us. Devoid of the queen's grace, perhaps, but not of her hopes for a brighter tomorrow, nor Misija's for a better Bozja.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Indeed, their hopes shall live on. In me, in Marsak, in all of our people. The lives lost for our freedom will not have done so in vain, this I swear. Bozja will rise again. A land of peace and prosperity they would be proud to call home.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text:
From the Chronicles of the Bozjan Revolution
Bajsaljen Ulgasch

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: If you are looking for Mikoto and the others, they have all returned to their homes. I expect you, too, will be leaving us before long. Though if I may be frank, I believe I speak for many when I say we are reluctant to see you go.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Were it possible, I would ask you to stay and help us in the rebuilding of Bozja, but I understand there are other worldly matters that require your attention.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We shall forever be in your debt, Blade Surname. Wherever duty demands you go, know that you always have allies here in Bozja. Farewell.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, at Valnain in Dalmasca...

dialogue.name: GABRANTH
dialogue.text: ...Thank you, Lyon. You are dismissed.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: That's all? Menenius is dead and that's all you have to say?

dialogue.name: GABRANTH
dialogue.text: What would you have me say, then?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: You could at least acknowledge one of your most loyal followers gave his life for the sake of your ambitions.

dialogue.name: GABRANTH
dialogue.text: Menenius understood such sacrifice was inevitable, and by all accounts he did not waver when faced with his demise. Such strength is needed if we are to succeed.

dialogue.name: GABRANTH
dialogue.text: Time is short, Lyon... My time is short...

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: So...it finally caught up with you. A damned shame.

dialogue.name: GABRANTH
dialogue.text: Lest the soldiers begin to believe failure may go without consequence, I would have you sent to the gaols in Menenius's stead. I trust this will not pose a problem for you?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: ...Fine.

dialogue.name: SICINIUS
dialogue.text: (-Sicinius mal Vellutus-)Legatus Gabranth, sir.

dialogue.name: SICINIUS
dialogue.text: (-Sicinius mal Vellutus-)We have recovered the relics Menenius unearthed in the Bozjan ruins.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Certain Field Record entries have been updated under Collection in the Duty section of the main menu.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New gear can now be purchased from the Resistance supplier at Camp Vrdelnis.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This new gear can be purchased in exchange for Bozjan platinum coins.

obj.n: 「レジスタンス勲章」をあなたに
紛れていた白金の輝き

quest.name: 荒鷲よ、翔び上がれ
journal: Dmitar has glad tidings to share from the battlefield.
objectives: Speak with Dmitar at the southern plateau.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Blade Surname! It's good to see you. As always, news of your contributions to the Resistance precedes you. We've just received word that the barrier over our new outpost is complete.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: At last, our front line can finally move forward. An unattainable feat without your assistance, and that of the Ironworks.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: If you are ready, I've been asked to escort you to our newest encampment.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: I would also strongly advise you to attune to the aetheryte here if you have yet to do so. Now if you'll follow me, the camp is due west of here.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: You'll find all the essential facilities are in place, including an aetheryte for ease of travel.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Bajsaljen intends to seize yet another outpost as we continue to push the front line forward. Of course, this will likely require more work securing aether currents to power yet another protective barrier.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Even so, with you here to aid us, I have faith the Resistance will prevail in the end.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Resistance front line advances, allowing you to participate in new skirmishes and critical engagements.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Mikoto after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:月光
未鑑定ロストシャード:奇跡
未鑑定ロストシャード:美技

quest.name: 荒鷲よ、天を翔けよ
journal: The Resistance has secured yet another outpost, and Dmitar would guide you there.
objectives: Speak with Dmitar at the western plateau.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Well come, Blade Surname. I see you've not been resting on your laurels since last we met.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: We've secured a new outpost, and a barrier was erected over the site not long ago.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: If you would follow me, I'll show you to our newest encampment. We've drawn perilously close to the Dalriada now, so be on your guard.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: We are but a stone's throw from the Dalriada, much to the dismay of the IVth Legion, I would assume.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: That their plans yet remain a mystery is concerning, but Master Garlond is confident in his countermeasures for any aerial assaults they may be plotting.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Victory is nearly at hand, Blade Surname, I can feel it!

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: There is no telling what manner of magitek weaponry the IVth Legion will employ in their desperation, but I have faith we will prevail in the end.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Resistance front line advances, allowing you to participate in new skirmishes and critical engagements.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Bajsaljen after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:死守
未鑑定ロストシャード:頑強
未鑑定ロストシャード:推進

quest.name: 紛れていた白金の輝き
journal: Merlzirn is in need of an adventurer not afraid to go digging behind enemy lines.
objectives: Clear the critical engagement “the Battle of Castrum Lacus Litore.”
Clear the critical engagement “the Dalriada.”
Deliver the ancient Bozjan raiments and ancient Bozjan armor to Merlzirn.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must have amassed  mettle.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have currently amassed  mettle.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: As I live and breathe, Blade Surname! It's an honor, ma'amsir.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: My name is Merlzirn, researcher and curator of ancient Bozjan artifacts. I have been working to recreate the attire and arms of our ancestors, and if you might humor me, I believe we both stand to benefit from a little mutual cooperation...

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: At great personal risk, I have braved the battlefield to explore what ruins I could find for relics, but circumstances have changed in recent days.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Something has drawn the IVth Legion's attention to the ruins, and they've been searching, excavating for something. Whatever it is, I cannot continue my work so long as they linger about the place.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: But you have spent your fair share behind enemy lines, have you not? I would be ever so grateful if you could bring back any relics you find on your next foray.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: With but a few of these artifacts, I am quite confident I can recreate the arms of our ancestors, and I promise to make it worth your while.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This quest can be completed once per week, with completion status being reset every [Reset]SundayMondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFridaySaturday at 12345678910111212 p.m.a.m. (Earth time).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon completing the critical engagements “the Battle of Castrum Lacus Litore” or “the Dalriada,” you will receive special artifacts.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These artifacts must be delivered to Merlzirn to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To participate in the aforementioned duties, first speak with Sjeros in Gangos to travel to either the Bozjan southern front or Zadnor, after which you may register for the appropriate critical engagement when available.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Good to see you, Blade Surname. My research proceeds apace thanks in no small part to your contributions.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Though I would be lying if I said more relics would not hasten my progress.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Might I prevail upon you to recover more artifacts? Naturally, anything irrelevant to my work is yours to keep.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Thank you again for your help, Blade Surname. I very much look forward to seeing what relics you might procure.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Were you able to find anything out there?

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: My, my, what an extraordinary find! Master Gerolt will no doubt be excited to examine this as well.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: And what have we here...? Why, this appears to be some sort of currency!

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: A valuable find to be sure, but alas, my work has no use for it. I think it only fair that you keep it, Blade Surname. Perhaps you can find some use for it.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: As for the rest, this will go a long way to completing my recreations of ancient Bozjan armaments. If I should have need of further contributions, I hope I may call on you again in the future.

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: Another fantastic find. Thank you, Blade Surname. Ah, and what is this...?

dialogue.name: MERLZIRN
dialogue.text: More ancient coinage. As agreed, you may do with it as you will. I look forward to working with you again.

obj.n: マーチ・オブ・ザ・ブラッディ・クイーン

quest.name: 古代ボズヤが思い描きし姿
journal: Gerolt would test his forge in ways the ancient Bozjans only dreamed of.

According to Zlatan, one of the surviving members of Gunnhildr's Blades recently discovered on the battlefield a new variety of crystal that contains not memories, but raw emotions. Gerolt suspects that, with a little effort, these fascinating specimens can be used to reforge the Resistance weapons into the pinnacle of martial perfection.

Regana has agreed to call upon her colleagues in the House of Splendors, and will be instructing them to deliver the necessary materials to Gangos. As one would expect of dealings with the much-maligned organization, this service will come at a cost, however, and it falls to you to procure the goods they request as payment─whatever they may be.
objectives: Speak with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, well, didn't think I'd see you traipsin' about here. They told me ye've been keepin' busy givin' the IVth Legion what for on the front lines. I'm sure yer itchin' to get back, but afore ye go, we've some interestin' news to share.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, well, if it ain't the hero o' the hour. Hope you had yer fill durin' the celebration─gods know I did. What a night that was!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Yes, well... The night has passed, and now a new day dawns for Bozja, thanks in no small part to Blade Surname's selflessness. Though the battle for Bozja is over, we received a rather interesting report from the field.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: One of the surviving members of Gunnhildr's Blades has found more crystals on the battlefield, but far different from those we have seen before.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, they ain't formed from the memories o' the dyin'. More like a concentration o' raw emotion.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And I'd wager me last mug of ale─well, maybe not me last mug─that Gunnhildr's Blades would've used crystals just like these to give their weapons more bite. If they knew how, that is.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems like when the last queen unleashed the power of the sword, the prayers o' her people added to her strength. These crystals ain't exactly full o' faith, but if we're lookin' to make the Resistance weapons stronger, the power o' them emotions might just do the trick.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: From what books I could find, Gunnhildr's Blades had the same idea─enhancin' their weapons usin' the power of prayer, but understandin' how to unlock the potential o' Save the Queen proved too much for 'em.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Fascinating. Should we succeed where even the ancient Bozjans failed, we will have forged the true blades of Gunnhildr, as they were meant to be...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, you could say that. 'Course I'd rather we keep callin' 'em Resistance weapons.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Whatever we choose to name them, it certainly is an exciting prospect! You shall have the support of the House of Splendors, and any resources that might prove useful to your work.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The cooperation of the House is greatly appreciated, but I assume this is not an act of charity.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Well, we are a business, after all. But surely any price we ask is a pittance if it means a glorious new standard for your countrymen to rally behind?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: ...Yes, such splendorous weapons would more than serve as a beacon of hope for our peoples' future once the imperials are driven out of Bozja.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: ...Yes, such splendorous weapons would more than serve as a beacon of hope for our peoples now that the imperials have been driven out of Bozja.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: More importantly, me contract with the House o' Splendors'll be fulfilled. Assumin', that is, we can get a hold o' everything we need.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That bein' an alloy what can handle higher concentrations of aether, a potent reagent to bind aetherial energies to the weapon, and a means o' committin' the power of emotions to it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Rather a tall order, but I am certain that the House of Splendors can provide. I will have my associates look through our inventories and bring the necessary resources to Gangos. Naturally, the House will expect something in return, most likely goods of equivalent value.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And what part will you play in the proceedings, if I may ask?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Oh, I plan to have the Ironworks make adjustments to the Allagan node, in order to more precisely tailor the completed weapons to their future wielders. After all, such attention to detail will increase their value exponentially.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And one last thing. I will be instructing my colleagues to deliver the requested materials in bulk. That they should have to travel so far, I intend to make it worth their time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I suppose that is fair. And we will certainly have need to forge more weapons when new members of Gunnhildr's Blades are appointed.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you for understanding. Now, without any further ado, I shall begin my preparations.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For the time being, that leaves us to ponder upon the not-so-simple matter of the goods the House will demand as payment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Leave it to me!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Oh dear...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wonderful. Once we know more, I shall act as an intermediary to ensure a smooth transaction.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Well, you don't have to help us if you don't want to. Although, from what I gather, most adventurers find the lure of a shiny, new weapon hard to resist. Does that sound accurate?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Heh heh heh. Now all I need to do is wait for my moment...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It'll be nice not havin' to deal directly with Regana for a while, eh? With any luck, her cronies won't drive too hard a bargain.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I but moments ago received a list of desired goods from Mistress Regana. The House of Splendors works with frightening efficiency...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: What they are asking for does not seem entirely unreasonable. As Regana has arranged three separate transactions, I shall let you decide which to attend to first.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Three new Resistance weapon quests are now available from Zlatan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon completing these three quests, an additional Resistance weapon quest will become available.

obj.n: 「レジスタンス・ウェポン」は新たな道を

quest.name: 「霊薬」の特別取引
journal: Zlatan has learned what the House of Splendors seeks in exchange for a reagent.

As Zlatan explains, the House of Splendors has reached an agreement with goblin metalworkers in Idyllshire to supply the Resistance with the reagent needed to refine your weapon. In exchange, you have been asked to provide two varieties of mechanical parts─compact axles and springs, thirty of each.

※Mechanical parts can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor, as well as any of the normal Alexander 8-man raids. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned duties.

You return with an assortment of mechanical parts, and after verifying everything is accounted for, Regana's colleague, Seika, hands over the reagent. With the transaction concluded, she takes her leave, but not before proposing an extended contract for additional shipments of reagent. Gerolt promptly refuses, but Seika appears unperturbed by the rejection. This reaction leaves Zlatan wondering if there was more to her proposal than meets the eye.
objectives: Deliver the compact axles and compact springs to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As Gerolt mentioned, we will require some manner of reagent to bind the crystal's aether to the weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For this particular transaction, the House of Splendors is but an intermediary for the manufacturer. Goblin metalworkers of some renown in Idyllshire, apparently.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: According to Regana, despite the material requiring the use of some sort of special forge, she was able to negotiate a reasonable agreement. It still struck me as rather a lopsided deal in their favor, but we have little choice but to take her word for it...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For our part in the bargain, we've been asked to procure two varieties of mechanical parts. They must be of the highest quality if we are to appease the goblins' discerning eyes.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Supposedly, the parts in question are commonly found in an apparatus employed by the Illuminati as well as the Empire's forces. We've been asked to collect thirty of each.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requested mechanical parts can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any of the normal Alexander 8-man raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We've been asked for compact springs and axles, thirty of each. I'm sure you encounter plenty of imperials in your line of work, and possibly even a few Illuminati, both of which should possess the parts we seek.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requested mechanical parts can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any of the normal Alexander 8-man raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Seika, the House of Splendors representative overseeing this transaction, has arrived with the reagent. May I assume you have the requested parts?

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: Hmmm. Yes, everything appears to be in order. As agreed, here is the reagent.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Wait, I know you. Well, of you, at any rate. Good o' you to be takin' time away from yer forge just to make a delivery.

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it. Having carried out my fair share of weapon repairs and alterations, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't curious to see what it might be used for.

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, it took me longer to get here than I expected, so I'd better get back to my other commissions. When you are finished here, perhaps we could discuss your work over drinks in Idyll─

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ahem!

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: A-Ah! Yes. Before I leave, there was a proposal I wished to make.

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: A wholesale contract for subsequent shipments of reagent.

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: As a fellow artisan, I'm sure you can appreciate the convenience of a surplus stock. What's more, such a contract would eliminate much of the clerical work in requesting more from our goblin colleagues.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We will eventually have need of more reagent, but enough to warrant a wholesale contract...?

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: Just think of it as a friendly agreement between artisans.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Sorry, lass, the answer's no! I'd rather boil me own head than agree to any more deals with the House of Splendors, of all bloody places!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You must forgive Gerolt, he is not usually so...forthright in these negotiations. That said, I cannot help but suspect Mistress Rowena has some ulterior motive in allowing such a contract to be signed on her behalf.

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: Well, you are free to believe what you will. With or without this contract, so long as the goblins get their parts, we can continue to do business.

dialogue.name: SEIKA
dialogue.text: My invitation to Idyllshire still stands, by the way. I hope you'll consider it when your work here has finished.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hmm... If she would still welcome Gerolt in Idyllshire after his little outburst, perhaps her offer truly was in good faith.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Through your various dealings with the House of Splendors, you have acquired all the materials needed to refine your Resistance weapon. Speak with Gerolt to proceed to the next phase in his plan.

obj.n: 古代ボズヤが思い描きし姿

quest.name: 「特殊合金」の特別取引
journal: The House of Splendors is prepared to deliver a shipment of metal alloy, provided that you fulfill your side of the bargain.

In exchange for the metal alloy, the House of Splendors has asked for two sets of freshly penned memoirs. They went on to say these tales of heated battle should be based on encounters in Bozja or, failing that, those of an otherworldly nature. There is a pained look in Zlatan's eyes as he tells you they have asked for thirty volumes of each. And so he bids you safe travels as you set off to the battlefield in search of inspiration for your writings.

※Memoirs can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor, as well as any of the normal Omega 8-man raids. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned duties.

You return with the requested memoirs, an arduous labor of blood, sweat, and ink. Regana's associates are thrilled to have completed the transaction, but apparently more so to meet Gerolt. They shower him with compliments, followed by a proposal for a wholesale contract for additional shipments of metal alloy. You quickly interject before he has the chance to accept, prompting the attendants to take their leave. Though no new contracts were signed, you are one step closer to a more powerful Resistance weapon.
objectives: Deliver the copies of A Day in the Life: Battles for the Realm and A Day in the Life: Beyond the Rift to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you are up to the task, Blade Surname, I thought we might tend to the metal alloy required for the Resistance weapons' refinement.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I say “we,” but I fear there is little I can do to help with this particular request from the House of Splendors.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For some reason, they have requested memoirs of battle in return for their services. They were quite adamant that said memoirs are of fierce battles far more harrowing than anything I myself have experienced.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: What's more, they went on to say these writings should be based on battles here in Bozja, or battles of an “otherworldly nature.” My apologies, Blade Surname, but they have asked for thirty freshly penned volumes of each.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requested memoirs can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any of the normal Omega 8-man raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I can scarcely imagine what manner of harrowing tales you intend to pen, but I have every confidence the House of Splendors will be pleased.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requested memoirs can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any of the normal Omega 8-man raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned. Regana's attendants arrived with a shipment of alloy not long ago. May I presume you found ample inspiration for your memoirs?

dialogue.name: ESCHINA
dialogue.text: ...Twenty-nine. Thirty. Everything is accounted for. Here is your alloy, as promised.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: A pleasure to do business with you. Though...may I ask why the House of Splendors sent two representatives for this transaction?

dialogue.name: ESCHINA
dialogue.text: Considering the difficulties likely involved in penning these memoirs, we thought it best to leave nothing to chance with this particular shipment. In any case, sixty volumes of anything is rather a lot, so we decided to share the load.

dialogue.name: ENNA
dialogue.text: Though there was one other reason we both elected to come...

dialogue.name: ENNA
dialogue.text: Those chiseled muscles. That rugged jawline... You must be Gerolt, the world-renowned blacksmith. I've heard many a tale of the wonders borne from your forge.

dialogue.name: ESCHINA
dialogue.text: Aye, a master smith whose striking good looks are matched only by his incomparable business acumen. In fact, we wish to make you a proposition─an exclusive contract for wholesale shipments of our alloy. If anyone can realize the potential of this king amongst metals, it would be the illustrious Gerolt Blackthorne.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, it's nice to see someone finally recognizes me talent for what it is. And yer absolutely right─I'm sure I could find a use for more o' this here alloy. Mayhap a new line o' kettles, or...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Take this deal, and you can write your own bloody memoirs.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Are you sure you want more dealings with Rowena's lot?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
B-But...ye know damn well waxin' poetic ain't me strong suit, and what if Rowena found out I'm the one what wrote 'em?
...Fine. If that's the way you want to be about it, I guess we'll have to decline the offer.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, let's not bring Rowena into this! <sigh> You're right... It's only a matter o' time before she weasels more clauses an' loopholes into the contract... She'd have me over a barrel before I know it.

dialogue.name: ESCHINA
dialogue.text: So Rowena has you wrapped about her finger, does she? What a pity.

dialogue.name: ENNA
dialogue.text: We'd hoped you might be interested in a little “something on the side,” but it seems she's got you all to herself.

dialogue.name: ENNA
dialogue.text: Well, you can't say we didn't try. Perhaps you should keep to the strait and narrow?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And perhaps you should be running along?

dialogue.name: ESCHINA
dialogue.text: As you wish. We'll be back again when the Resistance has need of our services. Until then, Regana...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Through your various dealings with the House of Splendors, you have acquired all the materials needed to refine your Resistance weapon. Speak with Gerolt to proceed to the next phase in his plan.

obj.n: 古代ボズヤが思い描きし姿

quest.name: 「術式」の特別取引
journal: The House of Splendors has devised a way to bind the power of emotion to weapons, which it is willing to share for a price.

Based on the techniques used to create materia, the House of Splendors has devised an incantation that can commit the energies of emotion to the Resistance weapon. For ease of use─or perhaps ease of profit─the spell has been penned to magicked scrolls, and the House has asked you supply them with memories of the dying in exchange. Zlatan forgoes explanations of the crystallized memories and tells you only that two varieties of memory are required, thirty of each.

※Memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor, as well as any of the normal Eden 8-man raids. The Unrestricted Party option cannot be enabled when clearing the aforementioned duties.

You return to Gangos, memories of the dying in hand. The transaction is carried out as arranged, but before Regana's associate leaves, she takes a moment to offer Gerolt an additional contract for larger shipments of magicked scrolls. Much to Zlatan's surprise, the attendant is strangely composed when the offer is rejected. As she turns to leave, you find yourself another step closer to refining your Resistance weapon.
objectives: Deliver the bleak memories of the dying and lurid memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: According to Master Gerolt, the means by which emotional energies are committed to the Resistance weapons is perhaps the most crucial part of the refinement process.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Somehow, the House of Splendors has contrived an incantation they believe will do precisely that, inspired by the techniques used to create materia. They are penned to magicked scrolls, no doubt designed to expire after a handful of uses. But I digress...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: In exchange for these scrolls, they have asked we procure crystallized memories of the dying. Our work on the Resistance weapons has garnered their attention, it seems, and now they wish to study the crystals to perhaps refine their own wares.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I would rather we didn't have to share the techniques of our forebears, but if this is the price we must pay to benefit Bozja's future, so be it.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I will forgo explanations on how to acquire them, as you are already quite familiar. You need only know they have requested two varieties of memories, thirty of each.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requested memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any of the normal Eden 8-man raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: By now I would imagine you know far better than I how best to procure memories of the dying. Remember─they have asked for two varieties of memories, thirty of each.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requested memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Zadnor.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any of the normal Eden 8-man raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Blade Surname. Regana's colleague arrived not long ago with the magicked scrolls. I trust you were able to find a suitable assortment of memories?

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Yes, these will do nicely. Here are your scrolls.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And with this, we are yet another step closer to achieving what even our forebears could only dream of. You have my sincerest gratitude.

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it. Thanks to you, I'm more likely to make my quota for this month's sales. I've been going through a bit of a rough spot lately, and that was even before Regana's proposition...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Proposition?

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Ah! Sorry, forget I said anything! Now, if I'm not mistaken, the burly gentleman over there is Eorzea's finest blacksmith, Gerolt Blackthorne, correct?

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Excuse me. Would you be interested in negotiating larger shipments of magicked scrolls? Wholesale, perhaps?

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: A man of your talents could use the surplus to make a hefty profit selling them to the Resistance, maybe even pay off outstanding debts. What do you say?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As temptin' as that sounds, I'm not too keen on doin' any more work than I have to at present, even if I end up regrettin' it later. And I'm not about to ask Forename here or the Resistance to empty their coffers to solve me troubles.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I may interject, we have no intention of arming all of our soldiers with these Resistance weapons, and we simply do not have the resources required to exchange for a large number of scrolls. My apologies, but we cannot in good conscience commit to supplementary agreements.

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: I see... Well, if you should have a change of heart, you may call on me at any time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, of course, thank you. To be honest, I was expecting your proposition to be a touch more...

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: Aggressive? A great many of the House's attendants are rather forward, if not overbearing, in their negotiations, I'll not deny it. I can be as well if I deem it necessary, but now is not such an occasion.

dialogue.name: GJUSANA
dialogue.text: I hope the rest of your business proceeds as planned.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: It's a pity they didn't take you up on your offer, but your help is greatly appreciated all the same. I was right to call on you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Through your various dealings with the House of Splendors, you have acquired all the materials needed to refine your Resistance weapon. Speak with Gerolt to proceed to the next phase in his plan.

obj.n: 古代ボズヤが思い描きし姿

quest.name: 妙な態度の商会員
journal: With Regana's attendants gone, Gerolt is excited to finally fire up the forge.

Gerolt can hardly contain himself now that your dealings with the House of Splendors are complete. Meanwhile, Regana continues to act suspiciously as she leaves to handle heretofore unknown business. Zlatan intends to find out what she is up to while you see to the final step in Gerolt's plan.

The final and most vital ingredient needed to refine your Resistance weapon is the aetherial energy of raw emotions. With sightings of crystals bearing this energy on the battlefield, Zlatan asks that you make ready to go out and search for them.
objectives: Speak with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Good on ye fer gathering all them supplies, lasslad. We've nearly everything we need to get started.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: HersHis are not the only efforts to be commended, Master Gerolt. Your diligence in researching how best to make use of all these materials was genuinely surprising.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Makin' sense of all them ancient texts about Bozja and the holy blade hurt me head somethin' fierce, if I'm to be honest.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If it makes me a better smith, though, I can't rightly complain. But more importantly, there's only one ingredient left that we need─crystals o' raw emotion.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
