dialogue.text: And when the weapon's finished, that just leaves takin' it over to Regana's node to add the finishin' touches.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ain't that right, Regana?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (We did everything right, yet still we have nothing to show for it. They've left me no choice... The contract must be renegotiated.)

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: ...Regana?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: ...Yes? Oh, the Allagan node. Of course. After analyzing the recently discovered crystals, the Ironworks engineers had no trouble making the necessary adjustments.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> <blip> Ready to begin parameter regulation sequence.
But first, a word from our sponsors at Rowena's House of Splendors...

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: See? Everything is as it should be. Now if you will excuse me, there is some business I would attend to before we begin. Call me when everything is ready, would you?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Is it me or does she seem a bit distracted o' late?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, she was acting rather strangely when her associates were present.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: While the two of you see to work on the Resistance weapon, I will look into this business preoccupying Regana.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, then. I'll see to gettin' everything ready here. Time for you to get out there an' grab us some o' them, uh...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah, no need to be fancy about it, they are what they are─raw emotions. If ye need anythin' else, be sure to talk with Zoltron.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: ...You're not even trying anymore, are you? <sigh> Very well. Let us be about our tasks then, shall we?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Was it Zalaton? No, there wasn't an “o” in it. Or was there? So help me gods, I'll remember his name, one way or another.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We are on the precipice of an achievement that matches, if not surpasses, the feats performed by our forebears. All that remains is a suitable number of these raw emotions to finish refining the Resistance weapon.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And by the time you return, I hope to have learned more of Regana's plans. Safe travels, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A new Resistance weapons quest is now available from Zlatan.

obj.n: 真の「レジスタンス・ウェポン」

quest.name: 真の「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Before the finishing touches can be added to the Resistance weapon, Zlatan has one last task for you.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

As Zlatan explains it, the raw emotions you seek were first discovered at the site of intense battles where emotions ran high. He asks that you seek out equally fierce confrontations to find fifteen crystals of raw emotion.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada in Zadnor, any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

You return to Gangos with the required raw emotions, and it is not long before the familiar clangor of Gerolt's hammer and the whirring of the Allagan node fills the air. Before long, the work is completed, and you find yourself the proud owner of a weapon the ancient Bozjans could only dream of, possessed of a strength that may very well rival that of Save the Queen. Zlatan wastes no time relaying the good news to Bajsaljen.

Interrupting the jubilant mood, Regana brings up the matter of their contract, claiming Rowena has doubled the asking price for the materials used in the forging of such weapons. To everyone's surprise, Rowena herself appears unexpectedly to refute those selfsame claims and thereby uncover Regana's extortion scheme. Her plans exposed, Regana fully expects her employment to be terminated, but Zlatan insists she stays on to fulfill the contract between the Resistance and the House of Splendors. Rowena consents to his request, and all present, save perhaps Gerolt, are pleased to see that their work will be allowed to continue.

Your work to perfect the Resistance weapon has enheartened Bajsaljen, for now the people of Bozja will at last have a shining beacon of hope under which they might rally.
objectives: Obtain raw emotionsAugmented Law's Order Bastard Sword and Augmented Law's Order Kite ShieldAugmented Law's Order KnucklesAugmented Law's Order LabrysAugmented Law's Order SpearAugmented Law's Order Composite BowAugmented Law's Order CaneAugmented Law's Order RodAugmented Law's Order IndexAugmented Law's Order CodexAugmented Law's Order KnivesAugmented Law's Order RevolverAugmented Law's Order ZweihanderAugmented Law's Order AstrometerAugmented Law's Order Samurai BladeAugmented Law's Order RapierAugmented Law's Order ManatriggerAugmented Law's Order ChakramsWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the raw emotions to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Irresistible,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Irresistible,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Irresistible,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: This new variety of crystals was first discovered on the plateaus of Zadnor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Much like the memories of the dying, we believe these crystals manifested from pitched battle with the enemy where emotions ran high.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For a warrior of your prowess, I can only assume this means you must seek out perilous battles with the most deadly of foes to stir such emotions. We believe that fifteen of these crystallized emotions should suffice.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Seeking to refine another Resistance weapon, I see. Thankfully, there are still resources left over from the last weapon, though we will require another assortment of raw emotions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, we will need fifteen to see our work done.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by undertaking the duties Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I dare not ask where exactly you plan to procure the emotions we require, but I pray that you will return to us safely, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Raw emotions can be obtained by completing the raids Delubrum Reginae or the Dalriada.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing any level 70 dungeon, or the deep dungeon Heaven-on-High.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Blade Surname. If you have obtained a suitable store of raw emotions, let us commence the refining process. Before we begin, might I ask you to unequip your weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt has made ready the forge, and all the other requisite materials are accounted for. May I see the crystals you have collected?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Now, let us take these to Master Gerolt. I can scarcely wait to see what wonders he will work with his forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this seems to be everythin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Time to get to work. Why don't you go and tell the node what tickles yer fancy while I start in on the weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Speaking of the Allagan node, Regana, a sealant was required when we last made use of it. Will we not have need of more?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Yes, a sealant made with aetherial siltstone is still required to complete the refining process.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: However, when making adjustments to the node and testing the enhanced coating process, there was a surprising amount of sealant left unused. There should be enough for now, but if Forename should be inclined to refine other weapons, we will need to acquire more.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's awful kind o' ye. Maybe you ain't such a skinflint after all.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Well, it is in everyone's best interests to see these weapons perfected. And if the House of Splendors is to establish good relations with the Resistance, a constant cutthroat approach to business will get us nowhere.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That don't sound like the House o' Splendors I know, but if you've a mind to throw the Resistance a bone, who am I to argue?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lookin' to fire up the forge again, eh? Well, let's get to it.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And you needn't worry about the aetherial sealant─I have already seen to its preparation. It is the least I can do after my previous transgressions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That is incredibly generous of you, Regana. Thank you.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, well... Generosity aside, there are material concerns that must be addressed if our work is to continue. Should you wish to make further alterations to the weapon, I'm afraid you will have to supply your own sealant.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Weapon receptacle ready for aetheroinsulation coating application. Please select desired attribute adjustment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Adjust Resistance weapon attributes.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Inquire about the refinement process.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may raise four attributes associated with your Resistance weapon as you see fit. When you are satisfied with the allotment of attributes, select Allocate to complete the process.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Choose carefully, as redistribution of attributes will require the procurement of additional materials.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, that'll do. And that Allagan node did a mighty fine job on the finishin' touches.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A weapon truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hopes an' dreams of ancient Bozja made manifest. A blade truly worthy o' Gunnhildr's Blades─[???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er twin, [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The queen's inscription ain't never shined so bright as when I hammered them crystals into the Resistance weapon. Can scarcely imagine what went into the makin' o' Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Havin' come face-to-face with Her Majesty yerself, I suppose you'd know better than any of us how potent the power o' memory an' emotions can be, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' now that selfsame power is coursin' through yer Resistance weapon. I reckon even Queen Gunnhildr herself'd be hard-pressed to draw any more power out o' them inscriptions.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: The way you describe it, one might think this Resistance weapon rivals the strength of Save the Queen!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, Zlatan! That she might!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wha... What did you just call me?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Surely I'm not the only one who heard that. My actual name... Oh, I pray this is not merely a fleeting moment of sobriety.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So that's his name!? I s'pose it was only a matter a time afore I got it right...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But anyway, let's not get carried away with celebratin' just yet. We still have to share the fruits of our labor with Bajsaljen and the others.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Yes, of course! I will go and inform him at once.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: And I will see our contract to its conclusion...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I swear, if me kettles shined half as bright as these Resistance weapons, me debts'd be paid in no time at all.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt, I would rather you refrained from drawing comparisons between the legacy of my forebears and...kettles, no matter how shiny they may be.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Just a bit o' humor to keep the mood light, nothin' to get worked up about Laz─er, lad.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: No harm done, Master Gerolt. If no offense was meant, then none shall be taken.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I fear he hasn't realized Gerolt has already forgotten his name.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Thank you for using the House of Splendor's weapon refinement services. <blip> <blip>
We look forward to serving you again. And remember─if quality is what you seek, be sure to visit Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A weapon beyond even the reach of Gunnhildr's Blades. Truly a marvel of craftsmanship.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though you were tasked only with recreating the weapons of Queen Gunnhildr's illustrious guard, it is clear you have gone far above and beyond what anyone could have hoped for. There is no doubt in my mind that you have made this seemingly impossible dream reality.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it will serve as a beacon of hope in our fight for freedom.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And I can think of no finer soldier than you to wield it, Blade Surname. In your hands, it shall serve as a reminder of our hard-earned freedom.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Now that the weapon is forged, I wish to discuss the matter of payment for supplies and services rendered to the Resistance.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: In light of the considerable drain on the House's resources, I am afraid the cost for manufacturing subsequent Resistance weapons will henceforth be doubled.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I wish it were not so, but Mistress Rowena insisted─

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Did I now?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: M-Mistress Rowena! To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Zlatan here called me, hopin' to talk over the terms o' the wholesale contracts I supposedly offered the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And after speakin' with G'jusana and the others, they said it was you who set up these deals. Clearly, you were hopin' to skim a not-so-small amount o' profits off the top, ain't that right?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: N-No! Never! All that I do has ever been for the House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And how, exactly, is tryin' to steal profits from your colleagues in the company's best interest? Usin' me good name to try and extort decent folk? If this is supposed to impress me, you're very much mistaken!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impress...?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye. For reasons I'll likely never understand, this one here took a real shine to me. Matter o' fact, unlike most of the other girls, she joined the House o' Splendors because she wanted to learn the trade. And from her very first day, she's run herself ragged tryin' to prove her worth.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I...we stood to make so much from this deal, I hoped you might overlook me using your name to see it done. But I've betrayed the trust you've placed in me, and for that, I'm truly sorry. I'll not darken your door again, Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If I might interject, Regana's work with the Resistance has been nothing short of exceptional. From her commissioning of the Allagan node, to her assistance with our research, she has contributed much and more to our cause. Why, she's even helped keep Gerolt focused─and more importantly, sober─long enough to see the job through to its conclusion.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is no exaggeration to say that without her, we would not be presenting Bajsaljen with the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: If you could find it within your heart to forgive Regana her transgressions, it would be my honor and privilege to continue business with the House of Splendors with her as your representative.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Provided our original agreement stands, and the cost of your services has not, in fact, doubled, I see no reason to object to a continued partnership.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Seein' as we narrowly avoided any wrongdoin', I'm willin' to agree to our clients' wishes. Regana will remain here and oversee House business until the obligations of our contract have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That sounds all well an' good, but I thought our work─and more importantly, me contract─was finished after I hammered out that weapon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Your jokes never were funny, Gerolt. The original agreement was to forge weapons for all of Gunnhildr's Blades. Your work has only just begun.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname's weapon was always meant to be only a prototype... Though experience tells me remembrance of fine details is not one of your strong suits.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And my experience tells me you lot should keep an eye on how much that daft sod's been drinkin'. I can tell you now, I ain't payin' for any of it, so be sure to charge him for every drop.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Bajsaljen. I swear you will not regret this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is yet a long road ahead of us, Blade Surname, but I have faith in them. And you. For far too long the people of Bozja have been without a symbol of hope. But now, thanks to you and the others, they will soon find one.

quest.name: マンダヴィル家と古の武具
journal:
The House Manderville manservant has been patiently waiting to speak with you.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

With no small degree of trepidation, you approach the House Manderville manservant to offer your assistance in Godbert's weaponsmithing endeavor. The servant responds with deferent appreciation, and directs you towards their base of operations in a corner of the High Crucible.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Upon reaching the crafting station, the manservant departs to inform Lord Manderville of your arrival. Godbert appears in short order, and after providing you with a brief history of Manderville weaponry, introduces you to the third member of your crew: the legendary blacksmith, Gerolt. Various obstacles yet stand in the way of Godbert and the recreation of his ancestor's armaments, and your particular task will be to acquire a sufficient quantity of manderium meteorite. According to Gerolt, the sky rocks in question might be available from one of Rowena's lackeys, Jubrunnah, who has set up shop near the city aetheryte. Suspiciously convenient.

You approach Jubrunnah, and find that the opportunistic merchant has a large quantity of meteorite pieces in stock. Gil is the preferred currency of collectors the world over, but not for Rowena's very special customer, oh no. It seems her agent has been instructed to charge you a sizable bounty of Allagan tomestones for each chunk of fantastically rare sky rock. And Gerolt will need three of them.

You deliver the manderium meteorite to the waiting blacksmith, who wastes no time in beginning the oil extraction process. The inert results are disappointing, to say the least. Godbert chooses that moment to make his appearance, treating a dumbfounded Gerolt to an outrageously masculine display of alchemy which transforms the liquid into glowing Exalamanderville. With all the necessary components now in place, Gerolt takes up his hammer, and succeeds in forging what is apparently only the first iteration of your chosen Manderville weaponry. Further refinements, however, will have to wait until Godbert has deciphered the next passage of his ancestor's manual. For the moment, it seems you are free to spend your time as you see fit. Embroiled in another madcap case, perhaps...?
objectives: Speak with the House Manderville manservant.
Speak with Jubrunnah.
Deliver the chunks of manderium meteorite to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Make It a Manderville,” you will receive a Manderville weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with the House Manderville manservant.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with the House Manderville manservant again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SERVANT04652
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Surname, how wonderful to finally speak with you. Your cooperation in Lord Manderville's weaponsmithing endeavor is highly appreciated.

dialogue.name: SERVANT04652
dialogue.text: Regarding said endeavor, we've borrowed a corner of the High Crucible in which to base our crafting station. If you would be so kind as to follow me?

dialogue.name: SERVANT04652
dialogue.text: Our humble base of operations.

dialogue.name: SERVANT04652
dialogue.text: You will no doubt be coming back and forth many times in the days ahead, so I strongly suggest that you attune to the city Aethernet...if you've not done so already.

dialogue.name: SERVANT04652
dialogue.text: Otherwise, I trust you are all set to proceed? One moment whilst I inform Lord Manderville of your arrival.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Oho! Welcome, Forename, welcome! With your stalwart assistance added into the mix, I have every confidence that this adventure in forging will be a complete success!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And so, let us begin...with a detailed exposition on the history of Manderville weaponry!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: First of all, when I say “Manderville weaponry,” what I refer to is the series of masterpieces crafted by the legendary artisan, Godbrand Manderville, the first lord of House Manderville.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Made with mystical manderium, these purportedly peerless armaments are perhaps our most prized treasures...or at least they were, until someone misplaced them. Terrible housekeeping, that. Fortunately, the timeworn manual in which Godbrand penned his secrets is both intact and still within our possession.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Thus with that precious family heirloom in hand─and a ready supply of purest ore─I intend to recreate what was lost!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The work, however, cannot proceed without a few more key ingredients. I should like to call upon you to procure said materials, as well as provide a seasoned adventurer's perspective on the fruits of our labor.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Excellent! I knew I could count on you. As a goldsmith, crafting weaponry is akin to venturing into unknown territory, and I would place my trust only in the most proficient guides.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, may I introduce one of the very best in the business. Come on over, my friend!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ugh, bloody hells...I had a feelin' you were the “adventurer” his lordship mentioned was helpin' out. Like a fly on shite when ye catch a whiff of shiny new weapons, ain't ye? <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Pleased to meet ye an' all that. The name's Gerolt. I suppose we'll be workin' together on this excitin' little project of his lordship. <sigh>

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You don't seem too eager to be here...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Come on, this'll be fun!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' why should I be!? Look at this gil-addled dandy I'm forced to hammer fer. I'd rather drag me stones 'cross hot coals than forge yet another rich old bastard's trinkets.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, aye, like a barrelful o' plague-ridden paissas. Look at this gil-addled dandy I'm forced to hammer fer. I'd rather drag me stones 'cross hot coals than forge yet another rich old bastard's trinkets.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Is that the way of it, then? I contacted Rowena hoping to employ the talents of Eorzea's finest smith...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: But as you clearly have no interest in providing me with your services, I shall hire another artisan. We can put this talk of stones and coals behind us...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait, ye've got me all wrong, yer lordship! That was just a bit o' smitty humor to lighten the mood! I would be honored to work on yer trink─er, Manderville weapon!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ugh, so here's the thing... I already spent the coin this job'll bring me on some right fancy bottles o' Thavnairian liquor. I can't afford not to do it.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: So that means we're back in business, yes? Marvelous!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, it's bloody splendid, it is. Yer crew is all present an' accounted fer, so let's get to smithin'!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: There is naught I'd like to do more. Presently, however, there are three conundrums which stand between us and making any Manderville armament a reality.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The first of these is the devising of a method for working the manderium. From what I've been able to decipher from the manual, the process is quite demanding.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye jus' leave that to ol' Gerolt. I've yet to meet a metal I can't beat into shape.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Oho! Then I shall cede that chore to your artisanal ingenuity!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The second is the crafting of ornamentation which will amplify the weapon's aetheric intensity.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If it's a sturdy blade ye need, then I'm yer man. But fiddly bits o' decoration are not in me smithin' wheelhouse.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Then 'tis fortunate that fiddling with bits is most assuredly in mine! Though it shall no doubt be a challenge, creating suitably exquisite adornments is a task well suited to me and my goldsmithing hammer.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As for the third and final problem wanting for resolution, we require a vial of Exalamanderville. If one has access to an industrial-size alchemical furnace, it should be possible to extract this superlative mineral oil from manderium-rich meteorites.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Assumin' I've understood what I heard o' the process, this exalamandra-whatsit oil is key to maximizin' aetherial conductivity.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And thanks to the good graces of the High Crucible, we have the extraction apparatus we require right here. All that remains is to collect three or so goodly chunks of manderium meteorite. That will be your charge, Forename.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Right, then I will see about preparing materials for my share of the workload.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' I'll start stokin' the flames. Sounds like we'll need 'em nice an' hot.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, Rowena asked me to tell ye summat. Seems like one o' her lackeys has oh-so-bloody-conveniently set up shop over by the aetheryte, an' jus' might have the meteorite chunks we need.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lass by the name o' Jubrunnah, I think it was. Could save ye some searchin', but she sure as shite ain't givin' out sky rocks fer free.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jubrunnah. In the aetheryte plaza. I expect she's got the meteorite chunks ye need, but like I said, they won't come cheap.

dialogue.name: JUBRUNNAH
dialogue.text: You must be the famous Forename. Mistress Rowena said to expect you, and to assist with any procurement requests.

dialogue.name: JUBRUNNAH
dialogue.text: Manderium meteorite? Why, yes, we happen to have cornered the market on that particular asset.

dialogue.name: JUBRUNNAH
dialogue.text: Only so many of them fall from the sky, you see, and collectors offer top gil for such rarities. In your case, however, I've been instructed to request payment in an alternative currency. Say it with me now...

dialogue.name: JUBRUNNAH
dialogue.text: Allagan. Tome. Stones.

dialogue.name: JUBRUNNAH
dialogue.text: The going rate is 500 Allagan Tomestone of Causality for one chunk of manderium meteorite. I'll be here whenever you're ready to make the trade.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Do ye have them chunks of sky rock yet? ...Then why are ye wastin' time gabbin' to me?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of manderium meteorite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well? Don't jus' stand there with yer thumb up yer arse. Let's see the goods.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, these are proper sky rocks, an' no mistake. Godbert's not back yet, but I reckon we can get a head start on extractin' that special oil o' his!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bugger. This might as well be cookin' grease fer all the conductivity it's got.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I must've botched one o' the steps. But which one? Pretty sure I followed them instructions to the damn letter.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: (-Godbert-)There was no fault in your process, Master Gerolt!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh? Then how do ye explain this bottle o' weak piss sittin' on me anvil?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: It has yet to undergo the final treatment─an advanced oil-pressing technique passed down through generations of Manderville lubricant enthusiasts.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph... It'll take more'n some enthusiastic oil pressin' to bring this liquid up to snuff.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: O ye of little faith. Observe!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Egads, man, what in the hells are ye strippin' down to yer smallclothes fer!? I should've known ye were jus' some degenerate fop!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Patience, Master Gerolt! This is merely the prelude.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Behold the mighty squats of a Manderville man!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: That should be enough to get the juices flowing. Now, to demonstrate the aforementioned technique!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: A single drop...of potently empowered...Manderville perspiration!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye gods, it's full o' stars...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: B-But that don't change anythin'! Yer still jus' an eccentric ol' bugger prancin' about an' sweatin' on things!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Maybe so, but look closer, Master Gerolt. Thus is the Exalamanderville made ready!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What d'ye mean, “ready”? All ye did was add yer drippings...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: B-Bugger me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It ain't possible... Don't s'pose yer gonna explain this, are ye?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: One does not simply reveal the tricks of one's trade, especially long-guarded family traditions. As a fellow professional, I'm sure you understand.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, well...makes no difference to me! Wouldn't be caught dead doin' them creepy poses!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Bracing banter aside, I do believe this puts us in possession of all the necessary components. 'Tis your time to shine, Master Gerolt!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, I'll shine, alright. Yer a cut above the average craftsman, I'll grant you that, but ye've still a few rungs to climb.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Best shield yer eyes, ladies and gentsgents, 'cause my work is positively blindin'!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Success! Just as I predicted!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That right there is a collaborative masterpiece...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: [Error] an' [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: [Error]!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: That I would live to see my ancestor's wondrous forge work recreated... You've made me a happy Manderville man, Forename!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Let's not break out the bubbly booze jus' yet, yer lordship. We've got a ways to go afore we can call our work “finished.”

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt is quite right. I've neglected to properly explain that this is but the first stage of a much grander creation─the bare bones of the weaponry, if you will.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, now begins the endless chore o' refinement. Which means I'll be stuck here fer gods know how long...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I am loath to monopolize your time, my good blacksmith, but the manual is written in a most confounding cipher. I am not even certain when I will finish decoding the next step in the process...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So I'm to sit idle, then? At least I've a few bottles of quality liquor to keep me company, heh heh!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: A regrettable yet unavoidable delay. Let us reconvene when the manual has given up its secrets, shall we?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, I leave the weaponry in your battle-hardened hands. When next we meet, your report of its performance will be indispensable in guiding our improvements.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ah, and should you wish to experiment with a different variety of Manderville weapon...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: ...Then this highly trained House Manderville artisan is at your service. I've imparted to him the necessary techniques for facilitating this initial stage of crafting. He requires only a contribution of manderium meteorite to forge a weapon of your choosing.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Another near-naked bastard! What do ye Manderville folk have against trousers!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye know what, I don't even wanna know, jus'...leave the smithin' to me. When I do a job, I do it right.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Very well, then I shall return anon. I am most eager to see the next stage of our masterpiece take shape!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A repeatable quest is now available from the House Manderville artisan at the High Crucible of Al-Kimiya. This quest may be accepted to create Manderville weapons for other jobs.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with the House Manderville artisan.

quest.name: もうひとつのマンダヴィルウェポン
journal:
The House Manderville artisan stands ready to facilitate your forging request.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You approach the House Manderville artisan with a request to forge a new Manderville weapon. The accommodating craftsman asks only that you supply him with the necessary chunks of manderium meteorite─an exhausting and expensive process with which you are already intimately familiar.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

No sooner have you delivered the meteorite chunks into the artisan's hands than he and Gerolt collaborate in the creation of another masterful Manderville armament. Should you wish to expand your armory of Manderville weaponry, it seems you have only to ask...assuming you've brought a sufficient number of exorbitantly priced sky rocks, of course.
objectives: Deliver the chunks of manderium meteorite to the House Manderville artisan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Make Another Manderville,” you will receive a Manderville weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with the House Manderville artisan.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with the House Manderville artisan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with the House Manderville artisan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with the House Manderville artisan again.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Greetings and salutations, MistressMaster Surname! I stand willing and able to aid you in the creation of any Manderville weaponry you may desire.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Before we can fulfill your request, however, I must ask that you provide me with the necessary quantity of manderium meteorite. Three solid chunks of the stuff, to be precise.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of manderium meteorite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: How fare your efforts to acquire the manderium meteorite? ...Ah, still a work in progress, I see. Not to worry! I shall endure the tedium of waiting by imagining all the ways I might spend my substantial retainer's fee.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of manderium meteorite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: You have something for me, MistressMaster Surname?

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, the meteorite chunks! I certainly wasn't expecting a Hannish curry and a bottle of chilled lassi, no indeed... Ahem, the extraction process should take but a moment, so I shall call upon Master Gerolt to have his anvil ready.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Another masterpiece!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer now the proud owner o' [Error] an' [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer now the proud owner o' [Error]!

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Bravo! You are truly an inspiration, Master Gerolt! Never could I have achieved such perfection alone, and certainly not within the constraints of excess clothing!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All in a day's work fer this ol' dog, hah!

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: I trust you are satisfied with the results of our work? Should you ever wish to expand your armory of Manderville weaponry, I am at your service for the foreseeable future.

quest.name: 目覚めよ、闘争本能！
journal:
Gerolt isn't immediately shooing you away, which means he must have something to share.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Godbert is ready to proceed with the refinement of his family's weaponry, and to that end, the goldsmith informs you that yet another type of meteoritic material is needed to enhance your armament's aetherial conductivity. According to his ancestor's manual, however, the true key to the process is something rather more intangible: a clarity achieved in the aftermath of an invigorating victory. Godbert claims to have already gained such battle-based enlightenment through his encounter with Doctor Lugae, and insists that Gerolt undergo his own form of martial meditation. You are to accompany the blacksmith to Windweft, where Godbert has prepared for him the perfect opponent.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Godbert introduces you to Gerolt's opponent: an adorable axe-wielding mammet. Despite his obvious advantage in size and strength, Gerolt loses the initial bout, but a generous application of Salamanderville empowers him to overcome the surprisingly agile automaton. Fired up by his win, the blacksmith can hardly wait to stoke the flames of his furnace. It seems you had best acquire the necessary materials swiftly, before the glow of victory fades...

※Chunks of complementary chondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

You deliver the chunks of chondrite to Gerolt, and the world seems to grow dark as you anxiously await the outcome. When the hammering stops, however, you find yourself in possession of a successfully augmented Manderville masterpiece. Gerolt then inquires as to how long the entire refinement process is likely to take─a question to which Godbert has no present answer. In breaking the cipher, Godbert has realized that the manual is but the first part of an incomplete set, and that locating the remainder of Godbrand's instructions will be a quest unto itself. Until the continuation of the guide is found, you must content yourself with your as-yet-imperfect weaponry.
objectives: Wait at the designated location.

Obtain chunks of complementary chondriteManderville Knuckles and Manderville Kite ShieldManderville KnucklesManderville AxeManderville SpearManderville Harp BowManderville CaneManderville RodManderville IndexManderville CodexManderville KnivesManderville RevolverManderville ZweihanderManderville TorquetumManderville Samurai BladeManderville RapierManderville GunbladeManderville ChakramsManderville ScytheManderville MilprevesWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the chunks of complementary chondrite to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Well-oiled,” you will receive a Manderville weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Gerolt.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Gerolt again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Well-oiled,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Well-oiled,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Forename. How're ye findin' that Manderville weaponry o' yers?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seein' as mine was the hand at the forge, the answer yer lookin' for is “bloody marvelous.”

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Still, it can always be better. And it sounds like Godbert's ready to build on the bare bones o' what we've produced so far.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: I shall call upon his lordship...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Forename! So good of you to come!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I've had my nose buried in that mystifying manual for what feels an age or more, but my decoding efforts have at last borne delicious fruits.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem that to further enhance the aetherial conductivity of our weaponry, we must apply yet another variety of meteorite─much as one produces sparks by smashing one rock against another. A rare chondrite, in this case.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The true key to the process, however, is something rather more intangible...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, don't leave us hangin', ye overdramatic peacock. Tell us already!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: My ancestor's tome is...well, it is as much journal as it is instructional guide, and Godbrand details a history of failure to elevate his creations.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As he was an accomplished warrior as well, he thus removed himself to the furthest reaches of the wilds, where he sought to vent his frustrations upon the most fearsome fiends that crossed his path.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Post-battle clarity filled his spirit, and, miracle of miracles, his very next attempt at augmentation was a resounding success.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: So you see, the missing ingredient in Godbrand's recipe for refinement was the sublime tranquility achieved in the wake of an invigorating victory.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I, myself, received the blessings of battle-based enlightenment on my travels with Forename, following a mildly strenuous encounter with one Doctor Lugae.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: However! I contend, Master Gerolt, that your martial meditation is as yet woefully inadequate!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Eh!? Ye think me smashin' skulls instead o' ingots'll somehow improve me forgin' instincts!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I guarantee it! In fact, until you triumph over this trial, I suspect the next rung of Manderville mastery will forever remain beyond your reach.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Not that I expect you to charge blindly into fisticuffs. Nay, sir, I have prepared for you the perfect opponent.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Forename, if you would be so kind as to join Master Gerolt at Windweft, I shall be with you momentarily.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: He wants me to fight some poor sap out at Windweft...? Waste o' bloody time, if ye ask me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, here I am. So where's me “perfect opponent”?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Eager to begin, I see. Capital! Follow me, and we can get this clarifying combat underway.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Pfft. A flimsy little mammet? Now, I ain't a warrior, but feast yer eyes on these corded arms. If this were a tavern brawl, the smart coin'd be on the smitty.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As it should be! Which is why I've set this fellow's battle parameters to the maximum level.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: R-Right, then! Let's do this!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Tricky...little bastard...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hm. I know what this calls for...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: A generous application of Manderville-mandated lubrication!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What did ye jus' slather me with!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Only the finest Salamanderville, my good man! Feel it sink into your muscles and augment your natural prowess. 'Tis the oil of champions!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye know, I do feel oddly powerful...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hah! Take that, tin man!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What a rush─I've never wanted to forge summat so badly. Is this that “battle enlightenment” ye was on about?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The very same. In your heightened state of awareness, our enhancements are sure to be flawless.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Then let's get to work. As before, yer job is to bargain for meteorite chunks from Jubrunnah. Rowena knows to supply her with the chondrite we need.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll head back an' warm up the furnace!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho! Even at its weakest, watching my mammet do battle is always a treat.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Yes, I actually had this axe-wielding gentleman set to his lowest parameters. And while the Salamanderville does stimulate circulation, it has no other special effects.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The most daunting opponent, you see, is the prison of the mind. Even should the battle itself be a charade, the positive momentum one gains from prevailing in what was perceived to have been a mighty struggle is no less real.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Now, if you would kindly see to procuring the chondrite, I must attend to my part of the preparations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of complementary chondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Where's the chondrite? Three chunks ought to do it, but make it quick─I don't want to lose me fightin' focus!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of complementary chondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye've got the chondrite? And I'll need ye to unbuckle the weaponry afore I can work on it, ye daft sod.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The furnace is roarin' an' ready. Let's have them new space rocks, then.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right. Send for his lordship, an' we can break out the hammer an' tongs!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Success!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Our collaborative masterpiece, taken to new heights...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: [Error] an' [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: [Error]!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: What did I tell you! 'Tis the undeniable results of your martial awakening!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I still have me doubts on that front, but aye, 'tis a thing o' beauty, nonetheless.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: On the topic of masterpieces, Forename, should you desire to refine any other Manderville armaments in your possession, then pray call upon my artisanal protégé here.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: He, too, has found enlightenment in the crucible of battle, and stands ready with a clear mind and steady hand.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, well...I'll be around, as usual, to make sure it all meets me demandin' standards.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Are you pleased with your weaponry's new appearance, by the by? Or were you mayhap more enamored with its previous incarnation?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohoho, I do understand the attraction of simple elegance.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Which is why we've begun offering a line of Manderville weapon replicas!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I am opening a storefront here on a trial basis, so please, do bless us with your patronage if you feel so inclined.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' I thought Rowena was a glutton for commerce.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Our work is as aesthetically pleasing as it is practical. 'Twould be foolish to leave such an obvious business venture untapped.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Merchant talk aside, how much longer until we properly perfect yer ancestor's creation? I get the feelin' we've scarce scratched the surface.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: An excellent question...and a difficult one to answer. In breaking the cipher, I've come to realize that the manual is but the first part of an incomplete set.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Incomplete? Ye can't be serious! Where's the bloody rest of it, then?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Presently unknown. Finding the continuation of Godbrand's guide shall consume my waking hours.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah, then occupyin' a table at the meyhane will consume mine. Yer lucky they've got an impressive selection of spirits...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Once again, I do apologize for the interminable delays.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Fare thee well, my friends. I shall depart on my quest without further ado.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Manderville weapon replicas can now be purchased from the House Manderville vendor.

quest.name: 驚くべきマンダヴィルウェポン
journal:
The House Manderville artisan stands ready to facilitate your augmentation request.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You approach the House Manderville artisan with a request to augment a different Manderville weapon. The ever-enthusiastic craftsman asks only that you supply him with the necessary chunks of complementary chondrite─a substance which is, of course, only available from a particular merchant for a very particular type of currency.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

※Chunks of complementary chondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

You make the required meteoritic contribution, and are once more blessed to witness a collaboration of artisanal brilliance. Encouraged by Gerolt's grudging praise, the House Manderville artisan bids you call upon him again should you have other armaments you wish to have augmented.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with the House Manderville artisan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with the House Manderville artisan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Next Mander-level,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “The Next Mander-level,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Am I free to perform an augmentation? Why, certainly, MistressMaster Surname!

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: You need but contribute the necessary quantity of complementary chondrite, and we can elevate your Manderville weaponry to the next Mander-level, ahahaha! Ahem. Three chunks, if you please.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of complementary chondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Yes, that would be three chunks of complementary chondrite, I'm afraid. We wouldn't wish to upset the delicate balance of your armaments with an unproven ratio now, would we?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of complementary chondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: <sniff> Is that chondrite I smell? Splendid! If you would be so kind as to unbuckle your weaponry...?

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Are we ready to proceed, MistressMaster Surname?

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Very good. As for my inner fires, I assure you that they burn hotter than Master Gerolt's furnace. Let us bring the blacksmith and his hammer to bear, shall we?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...An' done! What do ye think o' that, eh?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've upgraded ye to [Error] an' [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've upgraded ye to [Error]!

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Another collaborative triumph, Master Gerolt! I feel the more I work at your side, the closer I come towards achieving true mastery!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hah! Don't be daft, ye trouser-less twit! I've seen better craftsmen in a goblin's nursery!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' while we're yappin', his lordship made ye do the same “martial meditation” as me, didn't he? What'd he have ye fight, then?

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: I locked tusks, as it were, with a furious gaja of Saltwind's Welcome.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Y-Ye mean one o' them huge stompin' brutes!? An' ye took it down!?

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Yes, though I barely survived with my smallclothes intact...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: D-Did ye, now...? <cough> Might be as I was exaggeratin' a bit earlier. Yer a credit to yer craft, so keep at it, all right?

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: I will, Master Gerolt!

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: A superlative result as usual, Master Gerolt! I could ask for no finer example to aspire to in my own pursuit of perfection!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, when ye've got the gift like I have, ye can fix up any weapon ye put yer hand to! ...Ye did help a little, o' course.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: There you have it, MistressMaster Surname. Should you have further need of our augmentation services, we are at your beck and call.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: All we require is a handful of chondrite and a few moments of your time!

quest.name: 匠の酒宴
journal:
Gerolt seems even less enthused to see you than usual.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

While you are eager to continue making improvements to your Manderville weaponry, Gerolt's sullen demeanor suggests he is anything but. The blacksmith's suddenly blatant antagonism is of great concern to Godbert, who fears this negative attitude may adversely affect your crafting endeavors. He suggests a shared drink to resolve their differences, and sends you to secure a table at Mehryde's Meyhane.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

After consuming enough liquid courage to drown a behemoth, Gerolt lays bare his reasons for despising Godbert─a fundamental difference of perspectives which ultimately leaves the smitty wallowing in a mire of self-loathing. Thankfully, a carefully considered remark from you (or was it Rowena?) reignites Gerolt's sense of professional pride. As he staggers off back to his anvil, Godbert entreats you to begin gathering the required quantity of achondrite before returning to his own various tasks.

※Chunks of amplifying achondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

The augmentation process is once more a success, with the miraculous Maxalamanderville oil allowing you to fine-tune the properties of your enhanced weaponry. Impressive though your progress may be, however, Godbert assures you that one final stage in the armaments' evolution yet remains...
objectives: Wait for Godbert and Gerolt at an empty table in Mehryde's Meyhane.

Obtain chunks of amplifying achondriteAmazing Manderville Sword and Amazing Manderville Kite ShieldAmazing Manderville KnucklesAmazing Manderville AxeAmazing Manderville SpearAmazing Manderville Harp BowAmazing Manderville CaneAmazing Manderville RodAmazing Manderville IndexAmazing Manderville CodexAmazing Manderville KnivesAmazing Manderville RevolverAmazing Manderville ZweihanderAmazing Manderville TorquetumAmazing Manderville Samurai BladeAmazing Manderville RapierAmazing Manderville GunbladeAmazing Manderville ChakramsAmazing Manderville ScytheAmazing Manderville MilprevesWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the chunks of amplifying achondrite to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “A Spirited Reforging,” you will receive a Manderville weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Gerolt.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be advised that once you have undertaken this quest, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Gerolt again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “A Spirited Reforging,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “A Spirited Reforging,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I suppose that bespectacled fop did mention he'd made some kind o' breakthrough and needed to round up the usual suspects.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: I shall inform his lordship of your arrival...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Forename, welcome, welcome!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I do hope you are prepared for another spot of modest labor, for I have plucked a new weaponsmithing secret from the depths of my family's extraordinary heirloom.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As for why Godbrand abandoned his ciphered journals, 'twould seem he desired the greater security afforded by the relic's recording apparatus. That he so feared this knowledge falling into wicked hands bespeaks the destructive potential of what we seek to recreate.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, this stage of augmentation will require a fundamental alteration to the weaponry's design.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Godbrand understood that individual wielders have different needs and preferences, and thus conceived of a method to modify each armament's base qualities.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Essential to the process is a new type of oil known as “Maxalamanderville.” By subtly adjusting the precise ratio of ingredients for this coating, we can influence the paths of aetherial conductivity as we see fit.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ugh, more bloody oil...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The oil's chief ingredient is, once again, derived from a meteorite─specifically an achondrite with amplifying properties.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ah, so many out-of-this-world materials! But 'tis unsurprising now that we know the alien origin of Godbrand's weaponsmithing techniques.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Alien origin, ye say? Little wonder I weren't familiar with 'em...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As has become customary, I shall prepare the bulk of the necessary resources, whilst you procure our supply of achondrite.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oh, aye, an' a lovely bloody “custom” that is. Man o' your means, I reckon ye could buy a mountain o' them space rocks as well.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And I would gladly do so...except the merchant in question will accept naught less than a specific type of tomestone in trade.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As much as it pains me to impose upon Forename further, shehe is the best equipped to handle that onerous task.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: These improvements call for a drastic reforging, and it is your expertise that shall see us succeed or fail as well, Master Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fine, fine, I'll shut me gob an' do as I'm told...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hrm. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I'm getting the distinct impression you've lost interest in this project.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye bloody think?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Look, I took this job to pay off me drinkin' debts. Now that I've managed that, I've got no desire to keep workin' for an underdressed, over-primped, pretentious arse.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I see. Admittedly, even from the beginning, your distaste for me was rather poorly concealed.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And I fear such festering antagonism will adversely affect our smithing endeavors...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Yes, let us resolve our differences over a flagon of fine spirits─or several, as circumstances dictate! All at my expense, of course!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Free liquor, is it? Then ye'd best be bringin' yer biggest purse!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Forename, you must join us. If you would be so kind as to secure a table at the meyhane, I shall be along in short order.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ooh hoo hoo! The drinks are on ol' Godbert! We're about to see jus' how deep his lordship's pockets really are!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho! A splendid night for spirituous beverages!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer sure about this then, are ye? I've a mighty thirst, an' it'll not be slaked by the cheap stuff!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: What of you, Forename? Will you be following Master Gerolt's fine example?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Bring on the high-class brews!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I might have one or two...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No liquor for me, thanks.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Very well. Then I shall order us all the same to start.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Very well. Then we shall order you a tasty alternative.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Your beverages, Lord Godbert. Enjoy!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: To your health, my friends!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right─no point beatin' around the bush. I've hated yer guts for a good long while now.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hah, so even my insides offend you. And why might that be?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Cause for a proper artisan, devotion to yer craft ought to be yer number one priority.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But you, yer off foundin' a consortium, or buildin' some fool's playground for fleecin' the masses. Yer...yer a bloody merchant, that's what you are!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: You believe my “devotion” is insufficient, then. Yet our works require not only the sweat of our brow, but capital to cover expenses, no? Thus, does not a steady revenue facilitate the creative process?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: In that respect, my business ventures have allowed me to indulge in goldsmithing projects I could never have otherwise afforded.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Is it not true that you craft kettles as a means to repay loans or simply make ends meet? Would not a substantial source of wealth spare you such tedious drudgery and empower you to pursue your heart's desire?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: B-Booze! We're goin' to need more booze over here!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What really─hic!─soured me was when ye sat yer arse on the Syndicate. How can ye craft aught worthwhile with yer head buried in political shite!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: You may be surprised. My participation in Ul'dah's governance opened my eyes to a different world, which in turn provided great inspiration for several original pieces.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, you can keep yer bleedin' inspi─hic!─ration! I want nothin' to do with prissy rule-makers of yer ilk!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: You...you an' yer bloody─hic!─reasonable arguments.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Rich sods ain't got a...got a clue what it's like for poor buggers like me. An' what've ye got against wearin' clothes, anyroad!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: We are more alike than you realize, Master Gerolt. Especially when it comes to the simplicity of our attire!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, s'all clear now... Yer the master craftsman...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' I'm a soddin' failure... A failure! <sob>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Rowena? Where'd ye...? How'd ye...?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, bugger it... I'm a sorry excuse for a smitty, an' that's all that matters.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hm, he seems to be mistaking you for someone else. Perhaps you could offer him a kind word...?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Gerolt, your craftsmanship is flawless.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Gerolt, you're a sniveling disgrace to your profession!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That...that means a lot comin' from ye. Me thanks.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye always give it to me straight. I appreciate that.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, I'm done weepin' into me cups. I'll fix up them weapons, an' to hells with the money─I'll do it for me own damn sense o' pride.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem Master Gerolt has overcome his aversion to our partnership. Splendid. Although I never would have guessed carrot juice could be so intoxicating...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ah, I was concerned for our good smith's health, you see, and had Mihleel switch his spirits to something less potent several rounds ago. The meyhane's liquors are sublime, but too much can wreak havoc on a man's constitution.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: There was a time when I, too, devoted every waking moment to my craft...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: But alas, running a mercantile empire comes with its own responsibilities. Monetary woes notwithstanding, I do envy Master Gerolt his purity of purpose.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And on that note, let us return to our appointed acquisitions. We shall require three chunks of the aforementioned achondrite, as soon as you are able!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of amplifying achondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ugh, that was one too many meyhane brews... So, where are them blasted rocks, then? Or are ye jus' here to make me head feel worse?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Chunks of amplifying achondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems ye've got the achondrite sorted. Now, unless ye want me hammer in crotch-strikin' distance, ye'd best unbuckle that weaponry afore we get started.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ah, the heat o' the furnace has me all sobered up. Let's have them special rocks, then.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, I reckon that's enough, but...there's one other thing that's been botherin' me. Was Rowena there at the meyhane? I don't rightly remember...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah, forget it. Let's get his lordship over here afore I lose me will to forge!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Now for the finishing touch: the Maxalamanderville oil. Before we can finalize the mixture, however, you must tell us how you wish your weaponry to serve you in battle.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The ratio of the coating's ingredients will greatly influence the armament's various qualities, so think carefully ere you give your answer...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Adjust the attributes of your Manderville weaponry.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Learn about Manderville weaponry attributes.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can choose three attributes to add to your newly augmented Manderville weaponry. One of these attributes will be set to a lower value than the other two.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have adjusted the values to your liking, select “Confirm” to finalize your decision.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Resetting your weaponry's attributes will require an additional chunk of amplifying achondrite, so consider your choices carefully.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Understood! Your wish is our command!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: And 'tis done!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer holdin' the result of undyin' devotion to craftin' excellence...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: [Error] an' [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: [Error]!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Had you not so bravely confessed your grievances that evening, I daresay this degree of collaborative work would have remained unattainable!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, well, me memory's a mite fuzzy on that score...but I'll take me victories where I can get 'em.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: As always, Forename, should you wish to enhance other Manderville weapons in your possession, you need only say the word. My diligent retainer is at your service.

dialogue.name: CRAFTER04653
dialogue.text: Ahem, Lord Godbert... Though it shames me to admit, the expertise necessary to manufacture the Maxalamanderville oil is beyond my limited alchemical knowledge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't look at me. If I could mix magic potions, I'd have grown me hair back long ago.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho, I am aware it would prove an insurmountable feat for you as well. Which is why I've employed a master alchemist.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Huh. Bloody odd taste in clothes, but at least he's wearing some...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Our newest addition to the House Manderville retinue will assist with further augmentations, and oversee the preparation of the oil.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: He will also be available to readjust your weapons' properties should you but bring him the required quantity of achondrite.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: This has been a monumental step forward, my friends! Yet one stage remains ere the Manderville weaponry's evolution can be considered complete.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I knew ye was leadin' up to that. Let me guess: we're to sit here in breathless bleedin' anticipation while ye sort out what comes next?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Precisely! Preparing the process is like to be a lengthy endeavor, so I do suggest you continue breathing.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The final step is upon us, Forename. Pray indulge this ambition of mine one last time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Manderville weapon readjustments are now available from the House Manderville alchemist at the High Crucible of Al-Kimiya.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Collect the single required chunk of amplifying achondrite and equip the weapon you wish to readjust before approaching Lord Godbert's ever-patient retainer.

quest.name: 堂々たるマンダヴィルウェポン
journal:
The House Manderville artisan stands ready to facilitate your augmentation request.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Having resolved to have a different Manderville weapon augmented, you consult with the House Manderville artisan. Enthusiastic yet apologetic, he asks that you once more supply him with the necessary rare materials─in this case, three chunks of amplifying achondrite.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

※Chunks of amplifying achondrite can be obtained from Jubrunnah at the aetheryte plaza in Radz–at–Han.

As promised, the House Manderville retainers─with the aid of the ever-irascible Gerolt─elevate your chosen weaponry to a new stage of majesty. Should you wish to augment other armaments, the artisan bids you engage their services without hesitation.
